1+\frac{\left|x_{i}+y_{i}\right|+\left|x_{i}+z_{i}\right|}{1+\left|x_{i}-y_{i}\right|+\left|x_{i}-z_{i}\right|} \geq \frac{2\left(\left|y_{i}\right|+\left|z_{i}\right|\right)}{1+\left|x_{i}-y_{i}\right|+\left|x_{i}-z_{i}\right|}
$$

$$
\geq \frac{4 \mathrm{~d}\left(Q^{i}, \mathbb{I}^{i}\right)}{1+2 \ell\left(Q^{i}\right)} \geq \frac{\mathrm{d}\left(Q^{i}, \mathbb{I}^{i}\right)}{\max \left\{\ell\left(Q^{i}\right), 1\right\}}=\operatorname{rd}\left(Q^{i}, \mathbb{I}^{i}\right)
$$

By the monotoncity of $F_{1}^{i}, F_{2}^{i}$, and $F_{3}^{i}$, the estimates above imply

$$
F^{i}\left(x_{i}, y_{i}, z_{i}\right) \leq F_{1}^{i}\left(\ell\left(K_{i}\right)\right) F_{2}^{i}\left(\ell\left(K_{i}\right)\right) F_{3}^{i}\left(\operatorname{rd}\left(Q_{i}, \mathbb{I}_{i}\right)\right) \leq F^{i}\left(K^{i}, Q^{i}\right)
$$

which along with $\gamma_{i}=\frac{\delta_{i}}{2\left(2 n_{i}+\delta_{i}\right)}$ gives

$$
\begin{aligned}
\mathscr{P}_{i}\left(I^{i}, J^{i}, K^{i}\right) & \lesssim \frac{F^{i}\left(K^{i}, Q^{i}\right) \ell\left(K^{i}\right)^{\delta_{i}}}{\left[\ell\left(K_{i}\right)^{\gamma_{i}} \ell\left(Q^{i}\right)^{1-\gamma_{i}}\right]^{2 n_{i}+\delta_{i}}}\left|I^{i}\right|\left|J^{i}\right|\left|K^{i}\right| \\
& =\left[\frac{\ell\left(K^{i}\right)}{\ell\left(Q^{i}\right)}\right]^{\frac{\delta_{i}}{2}} F^{i}\left(K^{i}, Q^{i}\right) \frac{\left|I^{i}\right|\left|J^{i}\right|\left|K^{i}\right|}{\left|Q^{i}\right|^{2}}
\end{aligned}
$$

This completes the proof.
Lemma 4.5. For each $i=1,2$, let $\left(F_{1}^{i}, F_{2}^{i}, F_{3}^{i}\right) \in \mathscr{F}$ satisfy that $F_{1}^{i}$ is increasing, $F_{2}^{i}$ and $F_{3}^{i}$ are decreasing. Let $I^{i}, J^{i}, K^{i}, Q^{i} \subset \mathbb{R}^{n_{i}}$ be cubes such that $\ell\left(I^{i}\right) \simeq \ell\left(J^{i}\right) \simeq$ $\ell\left(K^{i}\right) \simeq \ell\left(Q^{i}\right)$ and $I^{i} \cup J^{i} \cup K^{i} \subset Q^{i}$. If either $K^{i} \cap I^{i}=\emptyset$ or $K^{i} \cap J^{i}=\varnothing$, then

$$
\begin{aligned}
\mathscr{Q}_{i}\left(I^{i}, J^{i}, K^{i}\right) & :=\int_{J^{i}} \int_{I^{i}} \int_{K^{i}} \frac{F^{i}\left(x_{i}, y_{i}, z_{i}\right)}{\left(\left|x_{i}-y_{i}\right|+\left|x_{i}-z_{i}\right|\right)^{2 n_{i}}} d x_{i} d y_{i} d z_{i} \\
& \lesssim\left[\frac{\ell\left(K^{i}\right)}{\ell\left(Q^{i}\right)}\right]^{\frac{\delta_{i}}{2}} F^{i}\left(K^{i}, Q^{i}\right) \frac{\left|I^{i}\right|\left|J^{i}\right|\left|K^{i}\right|}{\left|Q^{i}\right|^{2}}
\end{aligned}
$$

where $F^{i}\left(K^{i}, Q^{i}\right)$ is given in (4.1), and
$F^{i}\left(x_{i}, y_{i}, z_{i}\right):=F_{1}^{i}\left(\left|x_{i}-y_{i}\right|+\left|x_{i}-z_{i}\right|\right) F_{2}^{i}\left(\left|x_{i}-y_{i}\right|+\left|x_{i}-z_{i}\right|\right) F_{3}^{i}\left(1+\frac{\left|x_{i}+y_{i}\right|+\left|x_{i}+z_{i}\right|}{1+\left|x_{i}-y_{i}\right|+\left|x_{i}-z_{i}\right|}\right)$.
Proof. By symmetry, we may assume that $K^{i} \cap I^{i}=\varnothing$. Then $K^{i} \subset \kappa I^{i} \backslash I^{i}$ for some universal constant $\kappa>1$. Let $\alpha_{i} \in(0,1)$ be an auxiliary parameter. For any $x_{i} \in K^{i}$, we have $J^{i}-x_{i} \subset\left\{\left|z_{i}\right| \leq \ell\left(Q^{i}\right)\right\}$ and

$$
\int_{J^{i}} \frac{d z_{i}}{\left|x_{i}-z_{i}\right|^{n_{i}-\alpha_{i}}}=\int_{J^{i}-x_{i}} \frac{d z_{i}}{\left|z_{i}\right|^{n_{i}-\alpha_{i}}} \lesssim \int_{0}^{\ell\left(Q^{i}\right)} t^{\alpha_{i}-1} d t \lesssim \ell\left(Q^{i}\right)^{\alpha_{i}}
$$

Pick $q \in\left(1, \frac{n_{i}+1}{n_{i}+\alpha_{i}}\right)$. Then [6, Lemma 2.12] yields

$$
\begin{aligned}
& \int_{I^{i}} \int_{\kappa I^{i} \backslash I^{i}} \frac{F_{2}^{i}\left(\left|x_{i}-y_{i}\right|\right)}{\left|x_{i}-y_{i}\right|^{n_{i}+\alpha_{i}}} d x_{i} d y_{i} \\
& \leq\left[\int_{I^{i}} \int_{\kappa I^{i} \backslash I^{i}} \frac{d x_{i} d y_{i}}{\left|x_{i}-y_{i}\right|^{q\left(n_{i}+\alpha_{i}\right)}}\right]^{\frac{1}{q}}\left[\int_{I^{i}} \int_{\kappa I^{i} \backslash I^{i}} F_{2}^{i}\left(\left|x_{i}-y_{i}\right|\right)^{q^{\prime}} d x_{i} d y_{i}\right]^{\frac{1}{q^{\prime}}} \\
& \lesssim\left|I^{i}\right|^{\frac{2}{q}-1-\frac{\alpha_{i}}{n_{i}}} \widetilde{F}_{2}^{i}\left(\ell\left(I^{i}\right)\right)\left|I^{i}\right|^{\frac{3}{q}} \leq \widetilde{F}_{2}^{i}\left(\ell\left(K^{i}\right)\right)\left|I^{i}\right| \ell\left(I^{i}\right)^{-\alpha_{i}}
\end{aligned}
$$

In addition, for all $\left(x_{i}, y_{i}, z_{i}\right) \in K^{i} \times I^{i} \times J^{i}$,

$$
F_{1}^{i}\left(\left|x_{i}-y_{i}\right|+\left|x_{i}-z_{i}\right|\right) \leq F_{1}^{i}\left(2 \ell\left(Q^{i}\right)\right) \lesssim F_{1}^{i}\left(\ell\left(K^{i}\right)\right)
$$

and

$$
\begin{aligned}
1 & +\frac{\left|x_{i}+y_{i}\right|+\left|x_{i}+z_{i}\right|}{1+\left|x_{i}-y_{i}\right|+\left|x_{i}-z_{i}\right|} \geq \frac{2\left(\left|y_{i}\right|+\left|z_{i}\right|\right)}{1+\left|x_{i}-y_{i}\right|+\left|x_{i}-z_{i}\right|} \\
& \geq \frac{4 \mathrm{~d}\left(Q^{i}, \mathbb{I}^{i}\right)}{1+2 \ell\left(Q^{i}\right)} \geq \frac{\mathrm{d}\left(Q^{i}, \mathbb{I}^{i}\right)}{\max \left\{\ell\left(Q^{i}\right), 1\right\}}=\operatorname{rd}\left(Q^{i}, \mathbb{I}^{i}\right)
\end{aligned}
$$

Thus, the desired inequality follows from the estimates above.
Lemma 4.6. For each $i=1,2$, let $\left(F_{1}^{i}, F_{2}^{i}, F_{3}^{i}\right) \in \mathscr{F}$ satisfy that $F_{1}^{i}$ is increasing, $F_{2}^{i}$ and $F_{3}^{i}$ are decreasing. Let $J^{i}, K^{i} \subset \mathbb{R}^{n_{i}}$ be cubes such that $K^{i} \subset J^{i}$. If $\mathrm{d}\left(K^{i},\left(J^{i}\right)^{c}\right) \geq$ $\ell_{i} \geq \ell\left(K^{i}\right)$, then

$$
\begin{aligned}
\mathscr{R}_{i}^{1}\left(J^{i}, K^{i}\right) & :=\int_{\left(J^{i}\right)^{c}} \int_{3 K^{i}} \int_{K^{i}} \frac{F^{i}\left(x_{i}, y_{i}, z_{i}\right) \ell\left(K^{i}\right)^{\delta_{i}}}{\left(\left|x_{i}-y_{i}\right|+\left|x_{i}-z_{i}\right|\right)^{2 n_{i}+\delta_{i}}} d x_{i} d y_{i} d z_{i} \\
& \lesssim F_{1}^{i}\left(\ell\left(K^{i}\right)\right) F_{2}^{i}\left(\ell\left(K^{i}\right)\right) \widetilde{F}_{3}^{i}\left(J^{i}\right)\left|K^{i}\right|\left[\ell\left(K^{i}\right) / \ell_{i}\right]^{\delta_{i}}
\end{aligned}
$$

and

$$
\begin{aligned}
\mathscr{R}_{i}^{2}\left(J^{i}, K^{i}\right) & :=\int_{\left(J^{i}\right)^{c}} \int_{\left(3 K^{i}\right)^{c}} \int_{K^{i}} \frac{F^{i}\left(x_{i}, y_{i}, z_{i}\right) \ell\left(K^{i}\right)^{\delta_{i}}}{\left(\left|x_{i}-y_{i}\right|+\left|x_{i}-z_{i}\right|\right)^{2 n_{i}+\delta_{i}}} d x_{i} d y_{i} d z_{i} \\
& \lesssim F_{1}^{i}\left(\ell\left(K^{i}\right)\right) F_{2}^{i}\left(\ell\left(K^{i}\right)\right) \widetilde{F}_{3}^{i}\left(J^{i}\right)\left|K^{i}\right|\left[\ell\left(K^{i}\right) / \ell_{i}\right]^{\delta_{i}}
\end{aligned}
$$

where
$F^{i}\left(x_{i}, y_{i}, z_{i}\right):=F_{1}^{i}\left(\left|x_{i}-c_{K^{i}}\right|\right) F_{2}^{i}\left(\left|x_{i}-y_{i}\right|+\left|x_{i}-z_{i}\right|\right) F_{3}^{i}\left(1+\frac{\left|x_{i}+y_{i}\right|+\left|x_{i}+z_{i}\right|}{1+\left|x_{i}-y_{i}\right|+\left|x_{i}-z_{i}\right|}\right)$.
Proof. For all $x_{i} \in K^{i}$ and $z_{i} \in\left(J^{i}\right)^{c}$, there holds

$$
\left|x_{i}-z_{i}\right| \geq \mathrm{d}\left(K^{i},\left(J^{i}\right)^{c}\right) \geq \ell_{i} \geq \ell\left(K^{i}\right) \geq 2\left|x_{i}-c_{K^{i}}\right|
$$

Observe that for any $\alpha_{i} \in(0,1)$,

$$
\int_{3 K^{i}} \frac{d y_{i}}{\left|x_{i}-y_{i}\right|^{n_{i}-\alpha_{i}}} \lesssim \ell\left(K^{i}\right)^{\alpha_{i}}, \quad x_{i} \in K^{i}
$$

and for any $\beta_{i}>0$,

$$
\begin{aligned}
\psi\left(\beta_{i}\right) & :=\int_{K^{i}} \int_{\left|x_{i}-z_{i}\right| \geq \ell_{i}} F_{3}^{i}\left(\frac{4\left|x_{i}\right|}{1+\left|x_{i}-z_{i}\right|}\right) \frac{1}{\left|x_{i}-z_{i}\right|^{n_{i}+\beta_{i}}} d z_{i} d x_{i} \\
& \leq \sum_{k \geq 0} \int_{K^{i}} \int_{2^{k} \ell_{i} \leq\left|x_{i}-z_{i}\right|<2^{k+1} \ell_{i}}\left(2^{k} \ell_{i}\right)^{-n_{i}-\beta_{i}} F_{3}^{i}\left(\operatorname{rd}\left(2^{k} J^{i}, \mathbb{I}^{i}\right)\right) d z_{i} d x_{i} \\
& \lesssim\left|K^{i}\right| \ell_{i}^{-\beta_{i}} \sum_{k \geq 0} 2^{-k \beta_{i}} F_{3}^{i}\left(\operatorname{rd}\left(2^{k} J^{i}, \mathbb{I}^{i}\right)\right)
\end{aligned}
$$

provided that for all $x_{i} \in K^{i} \subset J^{i}$ and $2^{k} \ell_{i} \leq\left|x_{i}-z_{i}\right|<2^{k+1} \ell_{i}$,

$$
\frac{4\left|x_{i}\right|}{1+\left|x_{i}-z_{i}\right|} \geq \frac{4 \mathrm{~d}\left(2^{k} J^{i}, 0\right)}{1+2^{k+1} \ell\left(J^{i}\right)} \geq \frac{\mathrm{d}\left(2^{k} J^{i}, 0\right)}{\max \left\{2^{k} \ell\left(J^{i}\right), 1\right\}}=\operatorname{rd}\left(2^{k} J^{i}, \mathbb{I}^{i}\right)
$$

Thus, by the monotonicity of $F_{1}^{i}, F_{2}^{i}, F_{3}^{i}$,

$$
\begin{aligned}
\mathscr{R}_{i}^{1}\left(J^{i}, K^{i}\right) & \lesssim F_{1}^{i}\left(\ell\left(K^{i}\right)\right) F_{2}^{i}\left(\ell\left(K^{i}\right)\right) \ell\left(K^{i}\right)^{\delta_{i}+\alpha_{i}} \psi\left(\delta_{i}+\alpha_{i}\right) \\
& \lesssim F_{1}^{i}\left(\ell\left(K^{i}\right)\right) F_{2}^{i}\left(\ell\left(K^{i}\right)\right) \widetilde{F}_{3}^{i}\left(J^{i}\right)\left|K^{i}\right|\left[\ell\left(K^{i}\right) / \ell_{i}\right]^{\delta_{i}}
\end{aligned}
$$

which shows (4.7).
Additionally, given $k \geq 0$ and $x_{i} \in K^{i} \subset J^{i}$, letting

$$
R_{k}\left(x_{i}\right):=\left\{\left(y_{i}, z_{i}\right) \in \mathbb{R}^{2 n_{i}}: 2^{k} \ell_{i} \leq\left|x_{i}-y_{i}\right|+\left|x_{i}-z_{i}\right|<2^{k+1} \ell_{i}\right\}
$$

we obtain for all $\left(y_{i}, z_{i}\right) \in R_{k}\left(x_{i}\right)$,

$$
1+\frac{\left|x_{i}+y_{i}\right|+\left|x_{i}+z_{i}\right|}{1+\left|x_{i}-y_{i}\right|+\left|x_{i}-z_{i}\right|} \geq \frac{4\left|x_{i}\right|}{1+2^{k+1} \ell\left(J^{i}\right)} \geq \frac{\mathrm{d}\left(2^{k} J^{i}, 0\right)}{\max \left\{2^{k} \ell\left(J^{i}\right), 1\right\}}=\operatorname{rd}\left(2^{k} J^{i}, \mathbb{I}^{i}\right)
$$

and hence,

$$
\begin{aligned}
\mathscr{R}_{i}^{2}\left(J^{i}, K^{i}\right) & \lesssim F_{1}^{i}\left(\ell\left(K^{i}\right)\right) F_{2}^{i}\left(\ell\left(K^{i}\right)\right) \ell\left(K^{i}\right)^{\delta_{i}} \\
& \times \int_{K^{i}}\left(\sum_{k \geq 0} \iint_{R_{k}\left(x_{i}\right)} \frac{F_{3}^{i}\left(\operatorname{rd}\left(2^{k} J^{i}, \mathbb{I}^{i}\right)\right)}{\left(2^{k} \ell_{i}\right)^{2 n_{i}+\delta_{i}}} d y_{i} d z_{i}\right) d x_{i} \\
& \lesssim F_{1}^{i}\left(\ell\left(K^{i}\right)\right) F_{2}^{i}\left(\ell\left(K^{i}\right)\right) \ell\left(K^{i}\right)^{\delta_{i}}\left|K^{i}\right| \ell_{i}^{-\delta_{i}} \sum_{k \geq 0} 2^{-k \delta_{i}} F_{3}^{i}\left(\operatorname{rd}\left(2^{k} J^{i}, \mathbb{I}^{i}\right)\right) \\
& \leq F_{1}^{i}\left(\ell\left(K^{i}\right)\right) F_{2}^{i}\left(\ell\left(K^{i}\right)\right) \widetilde{F}_{3}^{i}\left(J^{i}\right)\left|K^{i}\right|\left[\ell\left(K^{i}\right) / \ell_{i}\right]^{\delta_{i}}
\end{aligned}
$$

This coincides with (4.8).
4.2. BMO and CMO estimates. The estimates in this section will be applied to obtain bi-parameter partial paraproducts in Sections 5.5, 5.7, and 5.8.
Lemma 4.9. Let $I^{1}, J^{1} \in \mathcal{D}^{1}$ and $K^{1} \in \mathcal{D}_{\text {good }}^{1}$ satisfy $\ell\left(K^{1}\right) \leq \ell\left(I^{1}\right)=2 \ell\left(J^{1}\right)$ and $\max \left\{\mathrm{d}\left(K^{1}, I^{1}\right), \mathrm{d}\left(K^{1}, J^{1}\right)\right\}>2 \ell\left(K^{1}\right)^{\gamma_{1}} \ell\left(J^{1}\right)^{\{-\gamma_{1}}}$. Set

$$
b_{I^{1}, J^{1}, K^{1}}:=\left\langle T\left(h_{I^{1}} \otimes 1, h_{J^{1}}^{0} \otimes 1\right), h_{K^{1}}\right\rangle
$$

Then

$$
\left\|b_{I^{1}, J^{1}, K^{1}}\right\|_{\mathrm{BMO}\left(\mathcal{D}^{2}\right)} \lesssim\left[\frac{\ell\left(K^{1}\right)}{\ell\left(Q^{1}\right)}\right]^{\frac{\delta_{1}}{2}} F^{1}\left(K^{1}, Q^{1}\right) \frac{\left|I^{1}\right|^{\frac{1}{2}}\left|J^{1}\right|^{\frac{1}{2}}\left|K^{1}\right|^{\frac{1}{2}}}{\left|Q^{1}\right|^{2}}
$$

and

$$
\left\|P_{\mathcal{D}^{2}(N)}^{\perp} b_{I^{1}, J^{1}, K^{1}}\right\|_{\mathrm{BMO}\left(\mathcal{D}^{2}\right)} \lesssim \mathcal{F}_{N}^{2}\left[\frac{\ell\left(K^{1}\right)}{\ell\left(Q^{1}\right)}\right]^{\frac{\delta_{1}}{2}} F^{1}\left(K^{1}, Q^{1}\right) \frac{\left|I^{1}\right|^{\frac{1}{2}}\left|J^{1}\right|^{\frac{1}{2}}\left|K^{1}\right|^{\frac{1}{2}}}{\left|Q^{1}\right|^{2}}
$$

where

$$
\mathcal{F}_{N}^{2}:=\sup _{\mathcal{D}^{2}} \sup _{K^{2} \notin \mathcal{D}^{2}(N)} \mathcal{F}^{2}\left(K^{2}\right):=\sup _{\mathcal{D}^{2}} \sup _{K^{2} \notin \mathcal{D}^{2}(N)}\left[F^{2}\left(K^{2}\right)+F^{2}\left(K^{2}, K^{2}\right)\right]
$$

$F^{2} \in \mathscr{F}^{2}, F^{i}(\cdot, \cdot)$ is given in (4.1), and $Q^{1}$ is defined in Lemma 2.1 (a).

Proof. Given $K^{2} \in \mathcal{D}^{2}$, let $a_{K^{2}}^{\prime}$ be an arbitrary $\infty$-atom of $\mathrm{H}_{\mathcal{D}^{2}}^{1}$, namely, $\operatorname{supp}\left(a_{K^{2}}^{\prime}\right) \subset$ $K^{2},\left\|a_{K^{2}}^{\prime}\right\|_{L^{\infty}} \leq\left|K^{2}\right|^{-1}$, and $\int_{\mathbb{R}^{n_{2}}} a_{K^{2}}^{\prime} d x_{2}=0$. Write $a_{K^{2}}=a_{K^{2}}^{\prime}\left|K^{2}\right|$. By a similar argument in $[6$, p. 6272$]$, the inequalities (4.10) and (4.11) are reduced to showing

$$
\left|\left\langle b_{I^{1}, J^{1}, K^{1}}, a_{K^{2}}\right\rangle\right| \lesssim\left[\frac{\ell\left(K^{1}\right)}{\ell\left(Q^{1}\right)}\right]^{\frac{\delta_{1}}{2}} F^{1}\left(K^{1}, Q^{1}\right) \frac{\left|I^{1}\right|^{\frac{1}{2}}\left|J^{1}\right|^{\frac{1}{2}}\left|K^{1}\right|^{\frac{1}{2}}}{\left|Q^{1}\right|^{2}} \mathcal{F}^{2}\left(K^{2}\right)\left|K^{2}\right|
$$

By the fact $1=\mathbf{1}_{K^{2}}+\mathbf{1}_{3 K^{2} \backslash K^{2}}+\mathbf{1}_{\left(3 K^{2}\right)^{c}}, b_{I^{1}, J^{1}, K}$ can be split into nine terms. By symmetry, it suffices to bound the following:

$$
\begin{aligned}
& \mathscr{I}_{1}:=\left\langle T\left(h_{I^{1}} \otimes \mathbf{1}_{K^{2}}, h_{J^{1}}^{0} \otimes \mathbf{1}_{K^{2}}\right), h_{K^{1}} \otimes a_{K^{2}}\right\rangle, \\
& \mathscr{I}_{2}:=\left\langle T\left(h_{I^{1}} \otimes \mathbf{1}_{K^{2}}, h_{J^{1}}^{0} \otimes \mathbf{1}_{3 K^{2} \backslash K^{2}}\right), h_{K^{1}} \otimes a_{K^{2}}\right\rangle, \\
& \mathscr{I}_{3}:=\left\langle T\left(h_{I^{1}} \otimes \mathbf{1}_{K^{2}}, h_{J^{1}}^{0} \otimes \mathbf{1}_{\left(3 K^{2}\right)^{c}}\right), h_{K^{1}} \otimes a_{K^{2}}\right\rangle, \\
& \mathscr{I}_{4}:=\left\langle T\left(h_{I^{1}} \otimes \mathbf{1}_{3 K^{2} \backslash K^{2}}, h_{J^{1}}^{0} \otimes \mathbf{1}_{3 K^{2} \backslash K^{2}}\right), h_{K^{1}} \otimes a_{K^{2}}\right\rangle, \\
& \mathscr{I}_{5}:=\left\langle T\left(h_{I^{1}} \otimes \mathbf{1}_{3 K^{2} \backslash K^{2}}, h_{J^{1}}^{0} \otimes \mathbf{1}_{\left(3 K^{2}\right)^{c}}\right), h_{K^{1}} \otimes a_{K^{2}}\right\rangle, \\
& \mathscr{I}_{6}:=\left\langle T\left(h_{I^{1}} \otimes \mathbf{1}_{\left(3 K^{2}\right)^{c}}, h_{J^{1}}^{0} \otimes \mathbf{1}_{\left(3 K^{2}\right)^{c}}\right), h_{K^{1}} \otimes a_{K^{2}}\right\rangle .
\end{aligned}
$$

By the cancellation of $h_{K^{1}}$, the compact partial kernel representation (cf. (H2)), the Hölder condition, and Lemma 4.4, there holds

$$
\begin{aligned}
\left|\mathscr{I}_{1}\right| & \leq \mathscr{P}_{1}\left(I^{1}, J^{1}, K^{1}\right) C\left(\mathbf{1}_{K^{2}}, \mathbf{1}_{K^{2}}, a_{K^{2}}\right)\left|I^{1}\right|^{-\frac{1}{2}}\left|J^{1}\right|^{-\frac{1}{2}}\left|K^{1}\right|^{-\frac{1}{2}} \\
& \lesssim\left[\frac{\ell\left(K^{1}\right)}{\ell\left(Q^{1}\right)}\right]^{\frac{\delta_{1}}{2}} F^{1}\left(K^{1}, Q^{1}\right) \frac{\left|I^{1}\right|^{\frac{1}{2}}\left|J^{1}\right|^{\frac{1}{2}}\left|K^{1}\right|^{\frac{1}{2}}}{\left|Q^{1}\right|^{2}} F^{2}\left(K^{2}\right)\left|K^{2}\right|
\end{aligned}
$$

Note that for any cube $K^{i} \subset \mathbb{R}^{n_{i}}$, there exists a family of disjoint cubes $\left\{K_{j}^{i}\right\}_{j=0}^{3 n_{i}-1}$ in $\mathbb{R}^{n_{i}}$ such that

$$
3 K^{i}=\bigcup_{j=0}^{3 n_{i}-1} K_{j}^{i}, \quad \text { where } \quad K_{0}^{i}=K^{i}, \quad \ell\left(K_{j}^{i}\right)=\ell\left(K^{i}\right), \quad \mathrm{d}\left(K_{j}^{i}, K^{i}\right)=0
$$

Then using the cancellation of $h_{K^{1}}$, the compact full kernel representation (cf. (H1)), the mixed size-Hölder condition, and Lemmas 4.4 and 4.5, we obtain

$$
\begin{aligned}
\left|\mathscr{I}_{2}\right| & \leq \mathscr{P}_{1}\left(I^{1}, J^{1}, K^{1}\right) \sum_{j=1}^{3 n_{2}-1} \mathscr{Q}_{2}\left(K^{2}, K_{j}^{2}, K^{2}\right)\left|I^{1}\right|^{-\frac{1}{2}}\left|J^{1}\right|^{-\frac{1}{2}}\left|K^{1}\right|^{-\frac{1}{2}} \\
& \lesssim\left[\frac{\ell\left(K^{1}\right)}{\ell\left(Q^{1}\right)}\right]^{\frac{\delta_{1}}{2}} F^{1}\left(K^{1}, Q^{1}\right) \frac{\left|I^{1}\right|^{\frac{1}{2}}\left|J^{1}\right|^{\frac{1}{2}}\left|K^{1}\right|^{\frac{1}{2}}}{\left|Q^{1}\right|^{2}} F^{2}\left(K^{2}, 3 K^{2}\right)\left|K^{2}\right|,
\end{aligned}
$$

and $\mathscr{I}_{4}$ has the same bound replacing $\mathscr{Q}_{2}\left(K^{2}, K_{j}^{2}, K^{2}\right)$ by $\sum_{k=1}^{3 n_{2}-1} \mathscr{Q}_{2}\left(K_{k}^{2}, K_{j}^{2}, K^{2}\right)$. Additionally, in view of the cancellation of $h_{K^{1}}$ and $a_{K^{2}}$, the compact full kernel representation (cf. (H1)), and the Hölder condition, Lemmas 4.4 and 4.6 applied to $\ell_{2}=\ell\left(K^{2}\right)$ imply

$$
\left|\mathscr{I}_{3}\right|+\left|\mathscr{I}_{5}\right| \leq \mathscr{P}_{1}\left(I^{1}, J^{1}, K^{1}\right) \mathscr{R}_{2}^{1}\left(3 K^{2}, K^{2}\right)\left|I^{1}\right|^{-\frac{1}{2}}\left|J^{1}\right|^{-\frac{1}{2}}\left|K^{1}\right|^{-\frac{1}{2}}
$$

$$
\lesssim\left[\frac{\ell\left(K^{1}\right)}{\ell\left(Q^{1}\right)}\right]^{\frac{\delta_{1}}{2}} F^{1}\left(K^{1}, Q^{1}\right) \frac{\left|I^{1}\right|^{\frac{1}{2}}\left|J^{1}\right|^{\frac{1}{2}}\left|K^{1}\right|^{\frac{1}{2}}}{\left|Q^{1}\right|^{2}} F^{2}\left(K^{2}, 3 K^{2}\right)\left|K^{2}\right|
$$

Besides, $\mathscr{I}_{6}$ can be estimated instead of $\mathscr{R}_{2}^{1}$ above by $\mathscr{R}_{2}^{2}$. Consequently, (4.13) follows from (4.14), (4.16), (4.17), and the fact that $F^{2}\left(K^{2}, 3 K^{2}\right) \simeq F^{2}\left(K^{2}, K^{2}\right)$ by (4.3).

Lemma 4.18. Let $I^{1}, J^{1} \in \mathcal{D}^{1}, K^{1} \in \mathcal{D}_{\text {good }}^{1}$, and $K^{2} \in \mathcal{D}_{\text {good }}^{2}$ satisfy $\ell\left(K^{1}\right) \leq \ell\left(I^{1}\right)=$ $2 \ell\left(J^{1}\right), \max \left\{\mathrm{d}\left(K^{1}, I^{1}\right), \mathrm{d}\left(K^{1}, J^{1}\right)\right\} \leq 2 \ell\left(K^{1}\right)^{\gamma_{1}} \ell\left(J^{1}\right)^{1-\gamma_{1}}$, and either $K^{1} \cap I^{1}=\varnothing$ or $K^{1} \cap J^{1}=\varnothing$ or $K^{1}=I^{1}$. Set

$$
b_{I^{1}, J^{1}, K^{1}}:=\left\langle T\left(h_{I^{1}} \otimes 1, h_{J^{1}}^{0} \otimes 1\right), h_{K^{1}}\right\rangle
$$

Then

$$
\left\|b_{I^{1}, J^{1}, K^{1}}\right\|_{\mathrm{BMO}\left(\mathcal{D}^{2}\right)} \lesssim\left[\frac{\ell\left(K^{1}\right)}{\ell\left(Q^{1}\right)}\right]^{\frac{\delta_{1}}{2}}\left[F^{1}\left(K^{1}, Q^{1}\right)+\sum_{J^{1} \in \operatorname{ch}\left(K^{1}\right)} F^{1}\left(J^{1}\right)\right] \frac{\left|I^{1}\right|^{\frac{1}{2}}\left|J^{1}\right|^{\frac{1}{2}}\left|K^{1}\right|^{\frac{1}{2}}}{\left|Q^{1}\right|^{2}}
$$

and

$$
\left\|P_{\mathcal{D}^{2}(N)}^{1} b_{I^{1}, J^{1}, K^{1}}\right\|_{\mathrm{BMO}\left(\mathcal{D}^{2}\right)} \lesssim \mathcal{F}_{N}^{2}\left[\frac{\ell\left(K^{1}\right)}{\ell\left(Q^{1}\right)}\right]^{\frac{\delta_{1}}{2}}\left[F^{1}\left(K^{1}, Q^{1}\right)+\sum_{J^{1} \in \operatorname{ch}\left(K^{1}\right)} F^{1}\left(J^{1}\right)\right] \frac{\left|I^{1}\right|^{\frac{1}{2}}\left|J^{1}\right|^{\frac{1}{2}}\left|K^{1}\right|^{\frac{1}{2}}}{\left|Q^{1}\right|^{2}}
$$

where $\mathcal{F}_{N}^{2}$ is given in (4.12) and $Q^{1}$ is defined in Lemma 2.1 (b).
Proof. In the case $K^{1} \cap I^{1}=\varnothing$, the proof is much as that of Lemma 4.9. The only difference is that $\mathscr{P}_{1}\left(I^{1}, J^{1}, K^{1}\right)$ is replaced by $\mathscr{Q}_{1}\left(I^{1}, J^{1}, K^{1}\right)$. Then Lemma 4.5 gives the same estimates. The case $K^{1} \cap J^{1}=\varnothing$ is similar.

Let $K^{1} \cap J^{1} \neq \varnothing$ and $K^{1}=I^{1}$. Then, $J^{1} \in \operatorname{ch}\left(K^{1}\right)$ and

$$
\left\langle b_{I^{1}, J^{1}, K^{1}}, a_{K^{2}}\right\rangle=\sum_{K_{1}^{1}, K_{2}^{1} \in \operatorname{ch}\left(K^{1}\right)}\left\langle h_{I^{1}}\right\rangle_{K_{1}^{1}}\left\langle h_{K^{1}}\right\rangle_{K_{2}^{1}}\left\langle T\left(\mathbf{1}_{K_{1}^{1}} \otimes 1, h_{J^{1}}^{0} \otimes 1\right), \mathbf{1}_{K_{2}^{1}} \otimes a_{K^{2}}\right\rangle
$$

If $K_{1}^{1}=J^{1}=K_{2}^{1}$, then we use the same decomposition as in the proof of Lemma 4.9. For the first term, the diagonal CMO condition (cf. (H4)) gives

$$
\left|\left\langle T\left(\mathbf{1}_{K_{1}^{1}} \otimes \mathbf{1}_{K^{2}}, h_{J^{1}}^{0} \otimes \mathbf{1}_{K^{2}}\right), \mathbf{1}_{K_{2}^{1}} \otimes a_{K^{2}}\right\rangle\right| \leq\left|J^{1}\right|^{-\frac{1}{2}} F^{1}\left(J^{1}\right)\left|J^{1}\right| F^{2}\left(K^{2}\right)\left|K^{2}\right|
$$

Moreover, replacing $\mathscr{P}_{1}\left(I^{1}, J^{1}, K^{1}\right)$ by $C\left(\mathbf{1}_{J^{1}}, \mathbf{1}_{J^{1}}, \mathbf{1}_{J^{1}}\right)$ in the proof of Lemma 4.9, the remaining terms are dominated by

$$
\left|J^{1}\right|^{-\frac{1}{2}} F^{1}\left(J^{1}\right)\left|J^{1}\right|\left[F^{2}\left(K^{2}\right)+F^{2}\left(K^{2}, 3 K^{2}\right)\right]\left|K^{2}\right|
$$

If $K_{1}^{1} \neq J^{1}$ or $K_{2}^{1} \neq J^{1}$, then it is similar to the case $K^{1} \cap I^{1}=\varnothing$. Hence,

$$
\begin{aligned}
\left|\left\langle b_{I^{1}, J^{1}, K^{1}}, a_{K^{2}}\right\rangle\right| & \lesssim \sup _{K_{2}^{1} \in \operatorname{ch}\left(K^{1}\right)}\left[\frac{\ell\left(K_{2}^{1}\right)}{\ell\left(Q^{1}\right)}\right]^{\frac{\delta_{1}}{2}} F^{1}\left(K_{2}^{1}, Q^{1}\right) \frac{\left|I^{1}\right|^{\frac{1}{2}}\left|J^{1}\right|^{\frac{1}{2}}\left|K_{2}^{1}\right|^{\frac{1}{2}}}{\left|Q^{1}\right|^{2}} F^{2}\left(K^{2}, 3 K^{2}\right)\left|K^{2}\right| \\
& \lesssim\left[\frac{\ell\left(K^{1}\right)}{\ell\left(Q^{1}\right)}\right]^{\frac{\delta_{1}}{2}} F^{1}\left(K^{1}, Q^{1}\right) \frac{\left|I^{1}\right|^{\frac{1}{2}}\left|J^{1}\right|^{\frac{1}{2}}\left|K^{1}\right|^{\frac{1}{2}}}{\left|Q^{1}\right|^{2}} F^{2}\left(K^{2}, 3 K^{2}\right)\left|K^{2}\right|
\end{aligned}
$$

This completes the proof.

Lemma 4.19. Let $K^{2} \in \mathcal{D}_{\text {good }}^{2}$ and $Q^{2} \in \mathcal{D}^{2}$ satisfy $K^{2} \subset Q^{2}$. Set

$$
b_{K^{2}, Q^{2}}:=\left\langle h_{\left(Q^{2}\right)^{(1)}}\right\rangle_{Q^{2}}\left\langle T\left(1,1 \otimes \mathbf{1}_{\left(Q^{2}\right)^{c}}\right), h_{K^{2}}\right\rangle
$$

Then

$$
\left\|b_{K^{2}, Q^{2}}\right\|_{\mathrm{BMO}\left(\mathcal{D}^{1}\right)} \lesssim\left[\frac{\ell\left(K^{2}\right)}{\ell\left(Q^{2}\right)}\right]^{\frac{s_{2}}{2}} F^{2}\left(K^{2}, Q^{2}\right) \frac{\left|K^{2}\right|^{\frac{1}{2}}}{\left|Q^{2}\right|^{\frac{1}{2}}}
$$

and

$$
\left\|P_{\mathcal{D}^{1}(N)}^{\perp} b_{K^{2}, Q^{2}}\right\|_{\mathrm{BMO}\left(\mathcal{D}^{1}\right)} \lesssim \mathcal{F}_{N}^{1}\left[\frac{\ell\left(K^{2}\right)}{\ell\left(Q^{2}\right)}\right]^{\frac{s_{2}}{2}} F^{2}\left(K^{2}, Q^{2}\right) \frac{\left|K^{2}\right|^{\frac{1}{2}}}{\left|Q^{2}\right|^{\frac{1}{2}}}
$$

where

$$
\mathcal{F}_{N}^{1}:=\sup _{\mathcal{D}^{1}} \sup _{Q^{1} \notin \mathcal{D}^{1}(N)} \mathcal{F}^{1}\left(Q^{1}\right):=\sup _{\mathcal{D}^{1}} \sup _{Q^{1} \notin \mathcal{D}^{1}(N)}\left[F^{1}\left(Q^{1}\right)+F^{1}\left(Q^{1}, Q^{1}\right)\right]
$$

$F^{1} \in \mathscr{F}^{1}$, and $F^{1}(\cdot, \cdot)$ is given in (4.1).
Proof. Given $Q^{1} \in \mathcal{D}^{1}$, let $a_{Q^{1}}^{\prime}$ be an arbitrary $\infty$-atom of $\mathrm{H}_{\mathcal{D}^{1}}^{1}$, namely, $\operatorname{supp}\left(a_{Q^{1}}^{\prime}\right) \subset$ $Q^{1},\left\|a_{Q^{1}}^{\prime}\right\|_{L^{\infty}} \leq\left|Q^{1}\right|^{-1}$, and $\int_{\mathbb{R}^{n_{1}}} a_{Q^{1}}^{\prime} d x_{1}=0$. Write $a_{Q^{1}}=a_{Q^{1}}^{\prime}\left|Q^{1}\right|$. As argued in [6, p. 6272], it is enough to prove

$$
\left|\left\langle b_{K^{2}, Q^{2}}, a_{Q^{1}}\right\rangle\right| \lesssim \mathcal{F}^{1}\left(Q^{1}\right)\left|Q^{1}\right|\left[\frac{\ell\left(K^{2}\right)}{\ell\left(Q^{2}\right)}\right]^{\frac{s_{2}}{2}} F^{2}\left(K^{2}, Q^{2}\right) \frac{\left|K^{2}\right|^{\frac{1}{2}}}{\left|Q^{2}\right|^{\frac{1}{2}}}
$$

First, we deal with the case $\ell\left(Q^{2}\right)>2^{\vartheta} \ell\left(K^{2}\right)$. The goodness of $K^{2}$ gives

$$
\mathrm{d}\left(K^{2},\left(Q^{2}\right)^{c}\right)>2 \ell\left(K^{2}\right)^{\gamma_{2}} \ell\left(Q^{2}\right)^{1-\gamma_{2}} \geq \ell\left(K^{2}\right)^{\frac{1}{2}} \ell\left(Q^{2}\right)^{\frac{1}{2}} \geq \ell\left(K^{2}\right)
$$

which allows us to write $\left\langle b_{K^{2}, Q^{2}}, a_{Q^{1}}\right\rangle=\mathscr{J}_{1}+\mathscr{J}_{2}$, where

$$
\begin{aligned}
\mathscr{J}_{1} & :=\left\langle h_{\left(Q^{2}\right)^{(1)}}\right\rangle_{Q^{2}}\left\langle T\left(1 \otimes \mathbf{1}_{3 K^{2}}, 1 \otimes \mathbf{1}_{\left(Q^{2}\right)^{c}}\right), a_{Q^{1}} \otimes h_{K^{2}}\right\rangle \\
\mathscr{J}_{2} & :=\left\langle h_{\left(Q^{2}\right)^{(1)}}\right\rangle_{Q^{2}}\left\langle T\left(1 \otimes \mathbf{1}_{\left(3 K^{2}\right)^{c}}, 1 \otimes \mathbf{1}_{\left(Q^{2}\right)^{c}}\right), a_{Q^{1}} \otimes h_{K^{2}}\right\rangle
\end{aligned}
$$

Using the fact $1=\mathbf{1}_{Q^{1}}+\mathbf{1}_{3 Q^{1}\left\langle Q^{1}\right.}+\mathbf{1}_{\left(3 Q^{1}\right)^{c}}$, we split $\mathscr{I}_{1}$ into nine terms. By symmetry, it suffices to treat the following terms:

$$
\begin{aligned}
& \mathscr{J}_{1,1}:=\left\langle h_{\left(Q^{2}\right)^{(1)}}\right\rangle_{Q^{2}}\left\langle T\left(\mathbf{1}_{Q^{1}} \otimes \mathbf{1}_{3 K^{2}}, \mathbf{1}_{Q^{1}} \otimes \mathbf{1}_{\left(Q^{2}\right)^{c}}\right), a_{Q^{1}} \otimes h_{K^{2}}\right\rangle \\
& \mathscr{J}_{1,2}:=\left\langle h_{\left(Q^{2}\right)^{(1)}}\right\rangle_{Q^{2}}\left\langle T\left(\mathbf{1}_{Q^{1}} \otimes \mathbf{1}_{3 K^{2}}, \mathbf{1}_{3 Q^{1}\left\langle Q^{1}\right.} \otimes \mathbf{1}_{\left(Q^{2}\right)^{c}}\right), a_{Q^{1}} \otimes h_{K^{2}}\right\rangle \\
& \mathscr{J}_{1,3}:=\left\langle h_{\left(Q^{2}\right)^{(1)}}\right\rangle_{Q^{2}}\left\langle T\left(\mathbf{1}_{Q^{1}} \otimes \mathbf{1}_{3 K^{2}}, \mathbf{1}_{\left(3 Q^{1}\right)^{c}} \otimes \mathbf{1}_{\left(Q^{2}\right)^{c}}\right), a_{Q^{1}} \otimes h_{K^{2}}\right\rangle \\
& \mathscr{J}_{1,4}:=\left\langle h_{\left(Q^{2}\right)^{(1)}}\right\rangle_{Q^{2}}\left\langle T\left(\mathbf{1}_{3 Q^{1}\left\langle Q^{1}\right.} \otimes \mathbf{1}_{3 K^{2}}, \mathbf{1}_{\left(3 Q^{1}\right)^{c}} \otimes \mathbf{1}_{\left(Q^{2}\right)^{c}}\right), a_{Q^{1}} \otimes h_{K^{2}}\right\rangle \\
& \mathscr{J}_{1,5}:=\left\langle h_{\left(Q^{2}\right)^{(1)}}\right\rangle_{Q^{2}}\left\langle T\left(\mathbf{1}_{3 Q^{1}\left\langle Q^{1}\right.} \otimes \mathbf{1}_{3 K^{2}}, \mathbf{1}_{\left(3 Q^{1}\right)^{c}} \otimes \mathbf{1}_{\left(Q^{2}\right)^{c}}\right), a_{Q^{1}} \otimes h_{K^{2}}\right\rangle \\
& \mathscr{J}_{1,6}:=\left\langle h_{\left(Q^{2}\right)^{(1)}}\right\rangle_{Q^{2}}\left\langle T\left(\mathbf{1}_{\left(3 Q^{1}\right)^{c}} \otimes \mathbf{1}_{3 K^{2}}, \mathbf{1}_{\left(3 Q^{1}\right)^{c}} \otimes \mathbf{1}_{\left(Q^{2}\right)^{c}}\right), a_{Q^{1}} \otimes h_{K^{2}}\right\rangle
\end{aligned}
$$

By the cancellation of $h_{K^{2}}$, the compact partial kernel representation (cf. (H2)), and the Hölder condition, Lemma 4.6 applied to $\ell_{2}=\ell\left(K^{2}\right)^{\frac{1}{2}} \ell\left(Q^{2}\right)^{\frac{1}{2}}$ yields

$$
\left|\mathscr{J}_{1,1}\right| \lesssim C\left(\mathbf{1}_{Q^{1}}, \mathbf{1}_{Q^{1}}, a_{Q^{1}}\right) \mathscr{R}_{2}^{1}\left(Q^{2}, K^{2}\right)\left|Q^{2}\right|^{-\frac{1}{2}}\left|K^{2}\right|^{-\frac{1}{2}}
$$

$$
\lesssim F^{1}\left(Q^{1}\right)\left|Q^{1}\right|\left[\frac{\ell\left(K^{2}\right)}{\ell\left(Q^{2}\right)}\right]^{\frac{\delta_{2}}{2}} F^{2}\left(K^{2}, Q^{2}\right) \frac{\left|K^{2}\right|^{\frac{1}{2}}}{\left|Q^{2}\right|^{\frac{1}{2}}}
$$

It follows from the cancellation of $h_{K^{2}}$, the compact full kernel representation (cf. (H1)), the mixed size-Hölder condition, and Lemmas 4.5 and 4.6 applied to $\ell_{2}=$ $\ell\left(K^{2}\right)^{\frac{1}{2}} \ell\left(Q^{2}\right)^{\frac{1}{2}}$ that

$$
\begin{aligned}
\left|\mathscr{J}_{1,2}\right| & \lesssim \sum_{j=1}^{3^{n_{1}}-1} \mathscr{Q}_{1}\left(Q^{1}, Q_{j}^{1}, Q^{1}\right) \mathscr{R}_{2}^{1}\left(Q^{2}, K^{2}\right)\left|Q^{2}\right|^{-\frac{1}{2}}\left|K^{2}\right|^{-\frac{1}{2}} \\
& \lesssim F^{1}\left(Q^{1}, 3 Q^{1}\right)\left|Q^{1}\right|\left[\frac{\ell\left(K^{2}\right)}{\ell\left(Q^{2}\right)}\right]^{\frac{\delta_{2}}{2}} F^{2}\left(K^{2}, Q^{2}\right) \frac{\left|K^{2}\right|^{\frac{1}{2}}}{\left|Q^{2}\right|^{\frac{1}{2}}}
\end{aligned}
$$

Likewise, instead of $\mathscr{Q}_{1}\left(Q^{1}, Q_{j}^{1}, Q^{1}\right)$ by $\sum_{k=1}^{3^{n_{1}}-1} \mathscr{Q}_{1}\left(Q_{k}^{1}, Q_{j}^{1}, Q^{1}\right)$, the same estimate holds for $\mathscr{J}_{1,4}$. Moreover, using the cancellation of $a_{Q^{1}}$ and $h_{K^{2}}$, the compact full kernel representation (cf. (H1)), the Hölder condition, and Lemma 4.6 applied to $\ell_{1}=\ell\left(Q^{1}\right)$ and $\ell_{2}=\ell\left(K^{2}\right)^{\frac{1}{2}} \ell\left(Q^{2}\right)^{\frac{1}{2}}$, we arrive at

$$
\begin{aligned}
\left|\mathscr{J}_{1,3}\right|+\left|\mathscr{J}_{1,5}\right| & \lesssim \mathscr{R}_{1}^{1}\left(3 Q^{1}, Q^{1}\right) \mathscr{R}_{2}^{1}\left(Q^{2}, K^{2}\right)\left|Q^{2}\right|^{-\frac{1}{2}}\left|K^{2}\right|^{-\frac{1}{2}} \\
& \lesssim F^{1}\left(Q^{1}, 3 Q^{1}\right)\left|Q^{1}\right|\left[\frac{\ell\left(K^{2}\right)}{\ell\left(Q^{2}\right)}\right]^{\frac{\delta_{2}}{2}} F^{2}\left(K^{2}, Q^{2}\right) \frac{\left|K^{2}\right|^{\frac{1}{2}}}{\left|Q^{2}\right|^{\frac{1}{2}}}
\end{aligned}
$$

Similarly, replacing $\mathscr{R}_{1}^{1}$ by $\mathscr{R}_{1}^{2}$, we obtain the same bound for $\mathscr{J}_{1,6}$.
Much as above, instead of $\mathscr{R}_{2}^{1}\left(Q^{2}, K^{2}\right)$ by $\mathscr{R}_{2}^{2}\left(Q^{2}, K^{2}\right)$, we have the same estimates for $\mathscr{J}_{2}$.

Next, in the case $\ell\left(Q^{2}\right) \leq 2^{\theta} \ell\left(K^{2}\right)$, using $\mathbf{1}_{\left(Q^{2}\right)^{c}}=\mathbf{1}_{3 Q^{2} \backslash Q^{2}}+\mathbf{1}_{\left(3 Q^{2}\right)^{c}}$, we split $\mathscr{J}_{1, k}$ into two terms $\mathscr{J}_{1, k}^{1}$ and $\mathscr{J}_{1, k}^{2}, k=1, \ldots, 6$. By the compact partial kernel representation (cf. (H2)) and the size condition, Lemma 4.5 implies

$$
\begin{aligned}
\left|\mathscr{J}_{1,1}^{1}\right| & \lesssim C\left(\mathbf{1}_{Q^{1}}, \mathbf{1}_{Q^{1}}, a_{Q^{1}}\right) \sum_{j=1}^{3 n_{2}-1} \mathscr{Q}_{2}\left(3 K^{2}, Q_{j}^{2}, K^{2}\right)\left|Q^{2}\right|^{-\frac{1}{2}}\left|K^{2}\right|^{-\frac{1}{2}} \\
& \lesssim F^{1}\left(Q^{1}\right)\left|Q^{1}\right|\left[\frac{\ell\left(K^{2}\right)}{\ell\left(Q^{2}\right)}\right]^{\frac{\delta_{2}}{2}} F^{2}\left(K^{2}, Q^{2}\right) \frac{\left|K^{2}\right|^{\frac{1}{2}}}{\left|Q^{2}\right|^{\frac{1}{2}}}
\end{aligned}
$$

provided $\ell\left(K^{2}\right) \simeq \ell\left(Q^{2}\right)$. Moreover, using the cancellation of $h_{K_{2}}$, the compact partial kernel representation (cf. (H2)), the Hölder condition, Lemma 4.6 applied to $\ell_{2}=$ $\ell\left(K^{2}\right)$, we conclude

$$
\begin{aligned}
\left|\mathscr{J}_{1,1}^{2}\right| & \lesssim C\left(\mathbf{1}_{Q^{1}}, \mathbf{1}_{Q^{1}}, a_{Q^{1}}\right) \mathscr{R}_{2}^{1}\left(3 Q^{2}, K^{2}\right)\left|Q^{2}\right|^{-\frac{1}{2}}\left|K^{2}\right|^{-\frac{1}{2}} \\
& \lesssim F^{1}\left(Q^{1}\right)\left|Q^{1}\right|\left[\frac{\ell\left(K^{2}\right)}{\ell\left(Q^{2}\right)}\right]^{\frac{\delta_{2}}{2}} F^{2}\left(K^{2}, 3 Q^{2}\right) \frac{\left|K^{2}\right|^{\frac{1}{2}}}{\left|Q^{2}\right|^{\frac{1}{2}}}
\end{aligned}
$$

Combining the techniques above, we can handle $\mathscr{J}_{1, k}^{j}$ for all $k=2, \ldots, 6$ and $j=1,2$.

Finally, we conclude (4.23) from the argument above, (4.24)-(4.28), and the fact that $F^{1}\left(Q^{1}, 3 Q^{1}\right) \simeq F^{1}\left(Q^{1}, Q^{1}\right)$ by (4.3). The proof is complete.
Lemma 4.29. Let $K^{2} \in \mathcal{D}_{\text {good }}^{2}$ and $Q^{2} \in \mathcal{D}^{2}$ satisfy $K^{2} \subset Q^{2}$. Set

$$
\phi_{Q^{2}}:=\mathbf{1}_{\left(Q^{2}\right)^{c}}\left(h_{\left(Q^{2}\right)^{(1)}}-\left\langle h_{\left(Q^{2}\right)^{(1)}}\right\rangle_{Q^{2}}\right) \quad \text { and } \quad b_{K^{2}, Q^{2}}:=\left\langle T\left(1 \otimes \phi_{Q^{2}}, 1 \otimes \mathbf{1}_{Q^{2}}\right), h_{K^{2}}\right\rangle
$$

Then

$$
\left\|b_{K^{2}, Q^{2}}\right\|_{\mathrm{BMO}\left(\mathcal{D}^{1}\right)} \lesssim\left[\frac{\ell\left(K^{2}\right)}{\ell\left(Q^{2}\right)}\right]^{\frac{\delta_{2}}{2}} F^{2}\left(K^{2}, Q^{2}\right) \frac{\left|K^{2}\right|^{\frac{1}{2}}}{\left|Q^{2}\right|^{\frac{1}{2}}}
$$

and

$$
\left\|P_{\mathcal{D}^{1}(N)}^{\perp} b_{K^{2}, Q^{2}}\right\|_{\mathrm{BMO}\left(\mathcal{D}^{1}\right)} \lesssim \mathcal{F}_{N}^{1}\left[\frac{\ell\left(K^{2}\right)}{\ell\left(Q^{2}\right)}\right]^{\frac{\delta_{2}}{2}} F^{2}\left(K^{2}, Q^{2}\right) \frac{\left|K^{2}\right|^{\frac{1}{2}}}{\left|Q^{2}\right|^{\frac{1}{2}}}
$$

where $\mathcal{F}_{N}^{1}$ is defined in (4.22).
Proof. Since the proof is almost the same as that of Lemma 4.19, we omit the details.

# 5. A COMPACT BILINEAR BI-PARAMETER DYADIC REPRESENTATION 

We are now ready to prove Theorem 1.4. To avoid cumbersome notation, we treat the most essential case $m=2$. For this purpose, we extend our method in [4] to the bi-parameter setting.
5.1. Dyadic reductions. Let $\mathbb{E}_{\omega}=\mathbb{E}_{\omega_{1}} \mathbb{E}_{\omega_{2}}$ for any $\omega=\left(\omega_{1}, \omega_{2}\right) \in \Omega_{1} \times \Omega_{2}$. It follows from (2.2) that

$$
\left\langle T\left(f_{1}, f_{2}\right), f_{3}\right\rangle=\mathbb{E}_{\omega} \sum_{\substack{I^{1}, J^{1}, K^{1} \in \mathcal{D}_{\omega_{1}}^{1} \\ I^{2}, J^{2}, K^{2} \in \mathcal{D}_{\omega_{2}}^{2}}}\left\langle T\left(\Delta_{I^{1}} \Delta_{I^{2}} f_{1}, \Delta_{J^{1}} \Delta_{J^{2}} f_{2}\right), \Delta_{K^{1}} \Delta_{K^{2}} f_{3}\right\rangle
$$

For each $i=1,2$, we split

$$
\sum_{\substack{I^{1}, J^{1}, K^{1} \in \mathcal{D}_{\omega_{i}}^{1} \\ \ell\left(K^{1}\right) \leq \ell\left(I^{1}\right) \\ \ell\left(K^{1}\right) \leq \ell\left(J^{1}\right)}}=\sum_{\substack{J^{1} \in \mathcal{D}_{\omega_{i}}^{1} \\ \ell\left(J^{1}\right) \leq \ell\left(I^{1}\right) \\ \ell\left(J^{1}\right)<\ell\left(K^{1}\right)}}+\sum_{\substack{I^{1} \in \mathcal{D}_{\omega_{i}}^{1} \\ \ell\left(I^{1}\right)<\ell\left(I^{1}\right) \\ \ell\left(I^{1}\right)<\ell\left(K^{1}\right)}}} \sum_{J^{1} \in \mathcal{D}_{\omega_{i}}^{1}} \delta\left(I^{1}\right)<\ell\left(J^{1}\right)
$$

Then $\left\langle T\left(f_{1}, f_{2}\right), f_{3}\right\rangle$ can be decomposed into nine symmetrical terms. By symmetry, it suffices to treat the following term:

$$
\mathscr{S}:=\mathbb{E}_{\omega} \sum_{\substack{I^{1}, J^{1}, K^{1} \in \mathcal{D}_{\omega_{1}}^{1} \\ \ell\left(K^{1}\right) \leq \ell\left(I^{1}\right) \\ \ell\left(K^{1}\right) \leq \ell\left(J^{1}\right)}} \sum_{\substack{I^{2}, J^{2}, K^{2} \in \mathcal{D}_{\omega_{2}}^{2} \\ \ell\left(K^{2}\right) \leq \ell\left(I^{2}\right) \\ \ell\left(K^{2}\right) \leq \ell\left(J^{2}\right)}} \left\langle T\left(\Delta_{I^{1}} \Delta_{I^{2}} f_{1}, \Delta_{J^{1}} \Delta_{J^{2}} f_{2}\right), \Delta_{K^{1}} \Delta_{K^{2}} f_{3}\right\rangle
$$

Setting

$$
E_{2^{k}}^{\omega_{i}} f:=\sum_{\left.I^{i} \in \mathcal{D}_{\omega_{i}}^{i} ; \ell\left(I^{i}\right)=2^{k}\langle f\rangle\right\rangle} \mathbf{1}_{I^{i}}, \quad i=1,2
$$

we invoke (2.5) to arrive at

$$
\begin{aligned}
\mathscr{S}=\mathbb{E}_{\omega} & \sum_{\substack{K^{1} \in \mathcal{D}_{\omega_{1}}^{1} \\
K^{2} \in \mathcal{D}_{\omega_{2}}^{2}}}\left\langle T\left(E_{\ell\left(K^{1}\right) / 2}^{\omega_{1}} E_{\ell\left(K^{2}\right) / 2}^{\omega_{2}} f_{1}, E_{\ell\left(K^{1}\right) / 2}^{\omega_{1}} E_{\ell\left(K^{2}\right) / 2}^{\omega_{2}} f_{2}\right), \Delta_{K^{1}} \Delta_{K^{2}} f_{3}\right\rangle \\
= & \mathbb{E}_{\omega} \sum_{\substack{K^{1} \in \mathcal{D}_{0}^{1} \\
K^{2} \in \mathcal{D}_{0}^{2}}}\left\langle T\left(E_{\ell\left(K^{1}\right) / 2}^{\omega_{1}} E_{\ell\left(K^{2}\right) / 2}^{\omega_{2}} f_{1}, E_{\ell\left(K^{1}\right) / 2}^{\omega_{1}} E_{\ell\left(K^{2}\right) / 2}^{\omega_{2}} f_{2}\right), \Delta_{\left(K^{1}+\omega_{1}\right)} \Delta_{\left(K^{2}+\omega_{2}\right)} f_{3}\right\rangle
\end{aligned}
$$

where the inner trilinear form is denoted by $\Lambda_{K}(\omega)$. By definition, $\mathbf{1}_{\text {good }}\left(K^{1}+\omega_{1}\right)$ depends on $\omega_{1}^{i}$ for $2^{-i} \geq \ell\left(K^{1}\right)$, and $\mathbf{1}_{\text {good }}\left(K^{2}+\omega_{2}\right)$ depends on $\omega_{2}^{j}$ for $2^{-j} \geq \ell\left(K^{2}\right)$, while both $E_{\ell\left(K^{1}\right) / 2}^{\omega_{1}} E_{\ell\left(K^{2}\right) / 2}^{\omega_{2}} f_{1}$ and $E_{\ell\left(K^{1}\right) / 2}^{\omega_{1}} E_{\ell\left(K^{2}\right) / 2}^{\omega_{2}} f_{2}$ depend on $\omega_{1}^{i}$ and $\omega_{2}^{j}$ for $2^{-i}<$ $\ell\left(K^{1}\right) / 2<\ell\left(K^{1}\right)$ and $2^{-j}<\ell\left(K^{2}\right) / 2<\ell\left(K^{2}\right)$, and $\Delta_{K^{1}+\omega_{1}} \Delta_{K^{2}+\omega_{2}} f_{3}$ depends on $\omega_{1}^{i}$ and $\omega_{2}^{j}$ for $2^{-i}<\ell\left(K^{1}\right)$ and $2^{-j}<\ell\left(K^{2}\right)$. Thus, by independence, we rewrite

$$
\begin{aligned}
\mathscr{S}=\frac{1}{\pi_{\text {good }}^{n_{1}}} \frac{1}{\pi_{\text {good }}^{n_{2}}} & \sum_{\substack{K^{1} \in \mathcal{D}_{0}^{1} \\
K^{2} \in \mathcal{D}_{0}^{2}}} \mathbb{E}_{\omega}\left[\mathbf{1}_{\text {good }}\left(K^{1}+\omega_{1}\right) \mathbf{1}_{\text {good }}\left(K^{2}+\omega_{2}\right)\right] \mathbb{E}_{\omega} \Lambda_{K}(\omega) \\
= & \frac{1}{\pi_{\text {good }}^{n_{1}}} \frac{1}{\pi_{\text {good }}^{n_{2}}} \sum_{\substack{K^{1} \in \mathcal{D}_{0}^{1} \\
K^{2} \in \mathcal{D}_{0}^{2}}} \mathbb{E}_{\omega}\left[\mathbf{1}_{\text {good }}\left(K^{1}+\omega_{1}\right) \mathbf{1}_{\text {good }}\left(K^{2}+\omega_{2}\right) \Lambda_{K}(\omega)\right] \\
= & \frac{1}{\pi_{\text {good }}^{n_{1}}} \frac{1}{\pi_{\text {good }}^{n_{2}}} \mathbb{E}_{\omega} \sum_{\substack{K^{1} \in \mathcal{D}_{\omega_{1}, \text { good }}^{1} \\
K^{2} \in \mathcal{D}_{\omega_{2}, \text { good }}^{2}}} \Lambda_{K}(\omega)=\frac{1}{\pi_{\text {good }}^{n_{1}}} \frac{1}{\pi_{\text {good }}^{n_{2}}} \mathbb{E}_{\omega} \mathscr{S}(\omega)
\end{aligned}
$$

where

$$
\mathscr{S}(\omega):=\sum_{\substack{K^{1} \in \mathcal{D}_{\omega_{1}}^{1} \text {,good } \\ K^{2} \in \mathcal{D}_{\omega_{2}, \text { good }}^{2}}} \sum_{\substack{I^{1}, J^{1} \in \mathcal{D}_{\omega_{1}}^{1} \\ \ell\left(K^{1}\right) \leq \ell\left(J^{1}\right)} \sum_{\substack{I^{2}, J^{2} \in \mathcal{D}_{\omega_{2}}^{2} \\ \ell\left(K^{2}\right) \leq \ell\left(I^{2}\right)}} \left\langle T\left(\Delta_{I^{1}} \Delta_{I^{2}} f_{1}, \Delta_{J^{1}} \Delta_{J^{2}} f_{2}\right), \Delta_{K^{1}} \Delta_{K^{2}} f_{3}\right\rangle
$$

In what follows, fix an arbitrary $\omega=\left(\omega_{1}, \omega_{2}\right)$ and denote $\mathscr{S}=\mathscr{S}(\omega)$. Simply write $\mathcal{D}^{i}=\mathcal{D}_{\omega_{i}}^{i}$ and $\mathcal{D}_{\text {good }}^{i}=\mathcal{D}_{\omega_{i}, \text { good }}^{i}$ for each $i=1,2$. Then using (2.5) and that

$$
\sum_{\substack{I^{i}, J^{i} \in \mathcal{D}^{i} \\ \ell\left(K^{i}\right) \leq \ell\left(I^{i}\right)} \sum_{\substack{I^{i}, J^{i} \in \mathcal{D}^{i} \\ \ell\left(K^{i}\right) \leq \ell\left(I^{i}\right)}} \sum_{\substack{I^{i}, J^{i} \in \mathcal{D}^{i} \\ \ell\left(K^{i}\right) \leq \ell\left(I^{i}\right)}} \sum_{\substack{i=1,2, \text { if } i} \leq \ell\left(I^{i}\right)} i=1,2
$$

we split

$$
\mathscr{S}=\sum_{j=1}^{4} \mathscr{S}^{j}
$$

where

$$
\mathscr{S}^{1}:=\sum_{\substack{I^{1}, J^{1} \in \mathcal{D}^{1}, K^{1} \in \mathcal{D}_{\text {good }}^{1} \\ \ell\left(K^{1}\right) \leq \ell\left(I^{1}\right)=2 \ell\left(J^{1}\right)}} \sum_{\substack{I^{2}, J^{2} \in \mathcal{D}^{2}, K^{2} \in \mathcal{D}_{\text {good }}^{2} \\ \ell\left(K^{2}\right) \leq \ell\left(I^{2}\right)=2 \ell\left(J^{2}\right)}} \sum_{\substack{\ell\left(K^{1}\right) \leq \ell\left(I^{2}\right)=2 \ell\left(J^{2}\right)}} \left\langle T\left(\Delta_{I^{1}} \Delta_{I^{2}} f_{1}, E_{J^{1}} E_{J^{2}} f_{2}\right), \Delta_{K^{1}} \Delta_{K^{2}} f_{3}\right\rangle
$$

$$
\begin{aligned}
& \mathscr{S}^{2}:=\sum_{\substack{I^{1}, J^{1} \in \mathcal{D}^{1}, K^{1} \in \mathcal{D}_{\text {good }}^{1} \\
\ell\left(K^{1}\right) \leq \ell\left(I^{1}\right)=2 \ell\left(J^{1}\right)}} \sum_{\substack{I^{2}, J^{2} \in \mathcal{D}^{2}, K^{2} \in \mathcal{D}_{\text {good }}^{2} \\
\ell\left(K^{2}\right) \leq \ell\left(I^{2}\right)=\ell\left(J^{2}\right)}} \sum_{\substack{I^{1}, J^{1} \in \mathcal{D}^{1}, K^{1} \in \mathcal{D}_{\text {good }}^{1} \\
\ell\left(K^{1}\right) \leq \ell\left(I^{1}\right)=\ell\left(J^{1}\right)}} \sum_{\substack{I^{2}, J^{2} \in \mathcal{D}^{2}, K^{2} \in \mathcal{D}_{\text {good }}^{2} \\
\ell\left(K^{2}\right) \leq \ell\left(I^{2}\right)=2 \ell\left(J^{2}\right)}} \sum_{\substack{I^{1}, J^{1} \in \mathcal{D}^{1}, K^{1} \in \mathcal{D}_{\text {good }}^{1} \\
\ell\left(K^{1}\right) \leq \ell\left(I^{1}\right)=\ell\left(J^{1}\right)}} \sum_{\substack{I^{2}, J^{2} \in \mathcal{D}^{2}, K^{2} \in \mathcal{D}_{\text {good }}^{2} \\
\ell\left(K^{2}\right) \leq \ell\left(I^{2}\right)=\ell\left(J^{2}\right)}} \sum_{\substack{I^{1}, J^{1} \in \mathcal{D}^{1}, K^{1} \in \mathcal{D}_{\text {good }}^{1} \\
\ell\left(K^{1}\right) \leq \ell\left(I^{1}\right)=\ell\left(J^{1}\right)}} \sum_{\substack{I^{2}, J, K \\
\ell\left(K^{2}\right) \leq \ell\left(I^{2}\right)=\ell\left(J^{2}\right)}} \sum_{\substack{I^{1}, J, K \\
\ell\left(K^{2}\right) \leq \ell\left(I^{2}\right)=\ell\left(J^{2}\right)}}}
\end{aligned}
$$

Considering symmetry, to show Theorem 1.4, we mainly focus on the term $\mathscr{S}^{1}$ :

$$
\mathscr{S}^{1}=\sum_{\substack{I^{1}, J^{1} \in \mathcal{D}^{1}, K^{1} \in \mathcal{D}_{\text {good }}^{1} \\
\ell\left(K^{1}\right) \leq \ell\left(I^{1}\right)=2 \ell\left(J^{1}\right)}} \sum_{\substack{I^{2}, J^{2} \in \mathcal{D}^{2}, K^{2} \in \mathcal{D}_{\text {good }}^{2} \\
\ell\left(K^{2}\right) \leq \ell\left(I^{2}\right)=2 \ell\left(J^{2}\right)}} \sum_{\substack{I^{1}, J, K \\
\ell\left(K^{1}\right) \leq \ell\left(I^{1}\right)=2 \ell\left(J^{1}\right)}} \sum_{\substack{I^{2}, J, K \\
\max \left\{\mathrm{~d}\left(K^{1}, J^{1}\right), \mathrm{d}\left(K^{1}, J^{1}\right)\right\}>2 \ell\left(K^{1}\right) \gamma_{i} \ell\left(J^{i}\right)^{1-\gamma_{i}}}} \mathscr{G}_{I, J, K} f_{1}^{I} f_{2}^{J} f_{3}^{K}}
$$

where

$$
\begin{aligned}
\mathscr{G}_{I, J, K} & :=\left\langle T\left(h_{I^{1}} \otimes h_{I^{2}}, h_{J^{1}}^{0} \otimes h_{J^{2}}^{0}\right), h_{K^{1}} \otimes h_{K^{2}}\right\rangle, \quad f_{1}^{I}:=\left\langle f_{1}, h_{I^{1}} \otimes h_{I^{2}}\right\rangle \\
f_{2}^{J} & :=\left\langle f_{2}, h_{J^{1}}^{0} \otimes h_{J^{2}}^{0}\right\rangle, \quad \text { and } \quad f_{3}^{K}:=\left\langle f_{3}, h_{K^{1}} \otimes h_{K^{2}}\right\rangle
\end{aligned}
$$

Observe that for each $i=1,2$,

$$
\begin{aligned}
& \sum_{\substack{I^{i}, J^{i} \in \mathcal{D}^{i}, K^{i} \in \mathcal{D}_{\text {good }}^{i} \\
\ell\left(K^{i}\right) \leq \ell\left(I^{i}\right)=2 \ell\left(J^{i}\right)}}:=\sum_{\substack{I^{i}, J^{i} \in \mathcal{D}^{i}, K^{i} \in \mathcal{D}_{\text {good }}^{i} \\
\ell\left(K^{i}\right) \leq \ell\left(I^{i}\right)=2 \ell\left(J^{i}\right)} \sum_{\substack{I^{i}, J^{i} \in \mathcal{D}^{i}, K^{i} \in \mathcal{D}_{\text {good }}^{i} \\
\max \left\{\mathrm{~d}\left(K^{i}, J^{i}\right), \mathrm{d}\left(K^{i}, J^{i}\right)\right\} \leq 2 \ell\left(K^{i}\right) \gamma_{i} \ell\left(J^{i}\right)^{1-\gamma_{i}}}} \\
& \max _{\substack{\left.\max \left\{\mathrm{~d}\left(K^{i}, J^{i}\right), \mathrm{d}\left(K^{i}, J^{i}\right)\right\} \leq 2 \ell\left(K^{i}\right) \gamma_{i} \ell\left(J^{i}\right)^{1-\gamma_{i}} K^{i} \cap I^{i}=\varnothing \text { or } K^{i} \cap J^{i}=\varnothing \text { or } K^{i}=I^{i}}}
\end{aligned}
$$

These three parts are called separated, adjacent, and nested respectively. By symmetry, it is enough to analyze six cases:
separated/separated, separated/adjacent, separated/nested,
adjacent/adjacent, adjacent/nested, and nested/nested,
for which the corresponding summations are successively denoted by $\mathscr{S}_{1}^{1}, \ldots, \mathscr{S}_{6}^{1}$.
5.2. Refined functions. Before starting the proof, we would like to refine some properties of functions in hypotheses in order to greatly simplify our estimates below. Following the strategy in $[4,6]$, we may assume that
(1) Given $i=1,2$, the function $\left(F_{1}^{i}, F_{2}^{i}, F_{3}^{i}\right) \in \mathscr{F}$ in the compact full kernel representation is the same as that in the compact partial kernel representation. Moreover, $F_{1}^{i}$ is monotone increasing while $F_{2}^{i}$ and $F_{3}^{i}$ are monotone decreasing.

(2) Given $i=1,2$, the function $F^{i} \in \mathscr{F}^{i}$ in the compact partial kernel representation is the same as those in the weak compactness property and the diagonal CMO condition.
(3) For any harmless constant $\lambda \in(0, \infty), F_{j}^{i}(\lambda t)$ and $F^{i}\left(\lambda I^{i}\right)$ are denoted by $F_{j}^{i}(t)$ and $F^{i}\left(I^{i}\right)$ respectively, since any dilation of them still belongs to the original space.
(4) In the compact full and partial kernel representations, when the size estimate happens on $\mathbb{R}^{n_{i}}$, the bound $F^{i}\left(x_{m+1}^{i}, x_{1}^{i}, \ldots, x_{m}^{i}\right)$ will be replaced by

$$
\begin{aligned}
& F^{i}\left(x_{m+1}^{i}, x_{1}^{i}, \ldots, x_{m}^{i}\right) \\
& =F_{1}^{i}\left(\sum_{j=1}^{m}\left|x_{m+1}^{i}-x_{j}^{i}\right|\right) F_{2}^{i}\left(\sum_{j=1}^{m}\left|x_{m+1}^{i}-x_{j}^{i}\right|\right) F_{3}^{i}\left(1+\frac{\sum_{j=1}^{m}\left|x_{m+1}^{i}+x_{j}^{i}\right|}{\sum_{j=1}^{m}\left|x_{m+1}^{i}-x_{j}^{i}\right|}\right)
\end{aligned}
$$

when the Hölder estimate happens to the variable $x_{m+1}^{i} \in \mathbb{R}^{n_{i}}$ (namely, $\left.\left|x_{m+1}^{i}-\right.\right.$ $\left.\left.\widetilde{x}_{m+1}^{i}\right| \leq \frac{1}{2} \max \left\{\left|x_{m+1}^{i}-x_{j}^{i}\right|: 1 \leq j \leq m\right\}\right)$, the bound $F^{i}\left(x_{m+1}^{i}, x_{1}^{i}, \ldots, x_{m}^{i}\right)$ is replaced by

$$
\begin{aligned}
& F^{i}\left(x_{m+1}^{i}, x_{1}^{i}, \ldots, x_{m}^{i}\right) \\
& =F_{1}^{i}\left(\left|x_{m+1}^{i}-\widetilde{x}_{m+1}^{i}\right|\right) F_{2}^{i}\left(\sum_{j=1}^{m}\left|x_{m+1}^{i}-x_{j}^{i}\right|\right) F_{3}^{i}\left(1+\frac{\sum_{j=1}^{m}\left|x_{m+1}^{i}+x_{j}^{i}\right|}{\sum_{j=1}^{m}\left|x_{m+1}^{i}-x_{j}^{i}\right|}\right)
\end{aligned}
$$

Other alternative estimates can be formulated in a similar way.
Henceforth, for each $i=1,2$, given $F^{i} \in \mathscr{F}^{i}$ and $\left(F_{1}^{i}, F_{2}^{i}, F_{3}^{i}\right) \in \mathscr{F}$, we define $\widetilde{F}_{2}^{i}$ and $\widetilde{F}_{3}^{i}$ as in (4.2). By homogeneity, we may assume that

$$
\left\|F^{i}\right\|_{L^{\infty}} \leq 2^{-(r+1) n_{i}}, \quad\left\|F_{k}^{i}\right\|_{L^{\infty}} \leq 1, \quad \text { and } \quad\left\|\widetilde{F}_{j}^{i}\right\|_{L^{\infty}} \leq 1
$$

for all $k=1,2,3$ and $j=2,3$.
5.3. Separated/Separated. By Lemma 2.1 part (a), for each $i=1,2$, let $Q^{i}:=$ $I^{i} \vee J^{i} \vee K^{i}$ be the smallest common dyadic ancestor of $I^{i}, J^{i}$, and $K^{i}$ such that

$$
I^{i} \cup J^{i} \cup K^{i} \subset Q^{i} \quad \text { and } \quad \max \left\{\mathrm{d}\left(K^{i}, I^{i}\right), \mathrm{d}\left(K^{i}, J^{i}\right)\right\} \gtrsim \ell\left(K^{i}\right)^{\gamma_{i}} \ell(Q)^{1-\gamma_{i}}
$$

By the cancellation of $h_{K^{1}}$ and $h_{K^{2}}$, the compact full kernel representation (cf. (H1)), the Hölder condition, and Lemma 4.4, we obtain

$$
\begin{aligned}
\left|\mathscr{G}_{I, J, K}\right| & \leq \prod_{i=1}^{2} \mathscr{P}_{i}\left(I^{i}, J^{i}, K^{i}\right)\left|I^{i}\right|^{-\frac{1}{2}}\left|J^{i}\right|^{-\frac{1}{2}}\left|K^{i}\right|^{-\frac{1}{2}} \\
& \lesssim \prod_{i=1}^{2}\left[\frac{\ell\left(K^{i}\right)}{\ell\left(Q^{i}\right)}\right]^{\frac{\delta_{i}}{2}} F^{i}\left(K^{i}, Q^{i}\right) \frac{\left|I^{i}\right|^{\frac{1}{2}}\left|J^{i}\right|^{\frac{1}{2}}\left|K^{i}\right|^{\frac{1}{2}}}{\left|Q^{i}\right|^{2}}
\end{aligned}
$$

Let $C_{0} \in(0, \infty)$ be a universal constant chosen later. Set

$$
a_{I, J, K, Q}=\frac{\mathscr{G}_{I, J, K}}{C_{0} \prod_{i=1}^{2}\left[\ell\left(K^{i}\right) / \ell\left(Q^{i}\right)\right]^{\delta_{i} / 2}}
$$

if $I^{i}, J^{i} \in \mathcal{D}^{i}$ and $K^{i} \in \mathcal{D}_{\text {good }}^{i}$ satisfy $\ell\left(K^{i}\right) \leq \ell\left(I^{i}\right)=2 \ell\left(J^{i}\right)$ and $\max \left\{\mathrm{d}\left(K^{i}, I^{i}\right), \mathrm{d}\left(K^{i}, J^{i}\right)\right\}>$ $2 \ell\left(K^{i}\right)^{\gamma_{i}} \ell\left(J^{i}\right)^{1-\gamma_{i}}$ for each $i=1,2$, and otherwise set $a_{I, J, K, Q}=0$. Then it follows from (5.1) and (5.3) that

$$
\begin{aligned}
& \mathscr{S}_{1}^{1}=\sum_{\substack{0 \leq i_{1} \leq k_{1} \\
0 \leq i_{2} \leq k_{2}}} \sum_{Q^{1} \in \mathcal{D}^{1}} \sum_{\substack{I^{1}, J^{1} \in \mathcal{D}^{1}, K^{1} \in \mathcal{D}_{\text {good }}^{1} \\
2 \ell\left(J^{1}\right)=\ell\left(I^{1}\right)=2^{-i_{1}} \ell\left(Q^{1}\right) \\
\ell\left(K^{1}\right)=2^{-k_{1}} \ell\left(Q^{1}\right), I^{1} \vee J^{1} \vee K^{1}=Q^{1}} \\
& \text { max } \left\{\mathrm{d}\left(K^{2}, I^{2}\right), \mathrm{d}\left(K^{2}, J^{2}\right)\right\}>2 \ell\left(K^{2}\right)^{\gamma_{2}} \ell\left(J^{2}\right)^{1-\gamma_{2}} \\
& 2 \ell\left(J^{2}\right)=\ell\left(I^{2}\right)=2^{-i_{2} \ell\left(Q^{2}\right)} \\
& \ell\left(K^{2}\right)=2^{-k_{2} \ell\left(Q^{2}\right), I^{2} \vee J^{2} \vee K^{2}=Q^{2}} \\
& =C_{0} \sum_{\substack{0 \leq i_{1} \leq k_{1} \\
0 \leq i_{2} \leq k_{2}}} 2^{-k_{1} \frac{\delta_{1}}{2}} 2^{-k_{2} \frac{\delta_{2}}{2}} \sum_{Q^{1} \in \mathcal{D}^{1}} \sum_{\substack{I^{1} \in \mathcal{D}_{11}^{1}\left(Q^{1}\right) \\
Q^{2} \in \mathcal{D}^{2}}} \sum_{\substack{J^{2} \in \mathcal{D}_{21}^{2}\left(Q^{2}\right) \\
J^{1} \in \mathcal{D}_{21+1}^{1}\left(Q^{1}\right) \\
K^{1} \in \mathcal{D}_{k_{1}}^{1}\left(Q^{1}\right)}} a_{I, J, K, Q} f_{1}^{I} f_{2}^{J} f_{3}^{K} .
\end{aligned}
$$

For any $k=\left(k_{1}, k_{2}\right) \in \mathbb{N}^{2}$, if we define

$$
\mathcal{F}(Q):=\prod_{i=1}^{2} F_{1}^{i}\left(\ell\left(Q^{i}\right)\right) \widetilde{F}_{2}^{i}\left(2^{-k_{i}} \ell\left(Q^{i}\right)\right) \widetilde{F}_{3}^{i}\left(Q^{i}\right)
$$

for all $Q=Q^{1} \times Q^{2} \in \mathcal{D}^{1} \times \mathcal{D}^{2}:=\mathcal{D}$, then (5.2) gives

$$
\left|a_{I, J, K, Q}\right| \leq \mathcal{F}(Q) \prod_{i=1}^{2} \frac{\left|I^{i}\right|^{\frac{1}{2}}\left|J^{i}\right|^{\frac{1}{2}}\left|K^{i}\right|^{\frac{1}{2}}}{\left|Q^{i}\right|^{2}}
$$

with

$$
\mathcal{F}(Q) \leq 1 \quad \text { and } \quad \lim _{N \rightarrow \infty} \mathcal{F}_{N}:=\lim _{N \rightarrow \infty} \sup _{\mathcal{D}} \sup _{Q \notin \mathcal{D}(N)} \mathcal{F}(Q)=0
$$

provided that $C_{0}$ is large enough and $\left(F_{1}^{i}, F_{2}^{i}, F_{3}^{i}\right) \in \mathscr{F}$. As a consequence of (5.5) and (5.6), we conclude

$$
\mathscr{S}_{1}^{1}=C_{0} \sum_{k_{1}=0}^{\infty} \sum_{k_{2}=0}^{\infty} 2^{-k_{1} \frac{\delta_{1}}{2}} 2^{-k_{2} \frac{\delta_{2}}{2}} \sum_{i_{1}=0}^{k_{1}} \sum_{i_{2}=0}^{k_{2}}\left\langle\mathbf{S}_{\mathcal{D}}^{\sigma(i, k)}\left(f_{1}, f_{2}\right), f_{3}\right\rangle
$$

where $\sigma(i, k):=\left(\left(i_{1}, i_{2}\right),\left(i_{1}+1, i_{2}+1\right),\left(k_{1}, k_{2}\right)\right)$.
5.4. Separated/Adjacent. By Lemma 2.1 part (b), there exists a minimal cube $Q^{2}:=I^{2} \vee J^{2} \vee K^{2} \in \mathcal{D}^{2}$ such that

$$
I^{2} \cup J^{2} \cup K^{2} \subset Q^{2} \quad \text { and } \quad \ell\left(Q^{2}\right) \leq 2^{\theta} \ell\left(K^{2}\right)
$$

Lemma 5.8. There holds

$$
\left|\mathscr{G}_{I, J, K}\right| \lesssim \prod_{i=1}^{2}\left[\frac{\ell\left(K^{i}\right)}{\ell\left(Q^{i}\right)}\right]^{\frac{\delta_{i}}{2}} \widetilde{F}^{i}\left(K^{i}, Q^{i}\right) \frac{\left|I^{i}\right|^{\frac{1}{2}}\left|J^{i}\right|^{\frac{1}{2}}\left|K^{i}\right|^{\frac{1}{2}}}{\left|Q^{i}\right|^{2}}
$$

where $\widetilde{F}^{1}\left(K^{1}, Q^{1}\right):=F^{1}\left(K^{1}, Q^{1}\right)$ defined in (4.1) and

$$
\widetilde{F}^{2}\left(K^{2}, Q^{2}\right):=\widetilde{F}^{2}\left(Q^{2}\right)=F^{2}\left(Q^{2}, Q^{2}\right)+\sum_{\substack{0 \leq k_{2} \leq \vartheta \\ J^{2} \in \mathcal{D}_{k_{2}+1}\left(Q^{2}\right)}} F^{2}\left(J^{2}\right)

Proof. First, consider the case $K^{2} \cap I^{2}=\varnothing$. By the cancellation of $h_{K^{1}}$, the compact full kernel representation (cf. (H1)), the mixed size-Hölder condition, and Lemmas 4.4 and 4.5 , we deduce

$$
\begin{aligned}
\left|\mathscr{G}_{I, J, K}\right| & \leq \mathscr{P}_{1}\left(I^{1}, J^{1}, K^{1}\right) \mathscr{Q}_{2}\left(I^{2}, J^{2}, K^{2}\right) \prod_{i=1}^{2}\left|I^{i}\right|^{-\frac{1}{2}}\left|J^{i}\right|^{-\frac{1}{2}}\left|K^{i}\right|^{-\frac{1}{2}} \\
& \lesssim \prod_{i=1}^{2}\left[\frac{\ell\left(K^{i}\right)}{\ell\left(Q^{i}\right)}\right]^{\frac{\delta_{i}}{2}} F^{i}\left(K^{i}, Q^{i}\right) \frac{\left|I^{i}\right|^{\frac{1}{2}}\left|J^{i}\right|^{\frac{1}{2}}\left|K^{i}\right|^{\frac{1}{2}}}{\left|Q^{i}\right|^{2}}
\end{aligned}
$$

Likewise, the same estimate holds in the case $K^{2} \cap J^{2}=\varnothing$.
Next, we treat the case $K^{2} \cap J^{2} \neq \varnothing$ and $K^{2}=I^{2}$. Obviously, $J^{2} \in \operatorname{ch}\left(K^{2}\right)$. Then we rewrite

$$
\mathscr{G}_{I, J, K}=\sum_{K_{1}^{2}, K_{2}^{2} \in \operatorname{ch}\left(K^{2}\right)} \mathscr{G}_{I, J, K}^{K_{1}^{2}, K_{2}^{2}}
$$

where

$$
\mathscr{G}_{I, J, K}^{K_{1}^{2}, K_{2}^{2}}:=\left\langle h_{K^{2}}\right\rangle_{K_{1}^{2}}\left\langle h_{K^{2}}\right\rangle_{K_{2}^{2}}\left|J^{2}\right|^{-\frac{1}{2}}\left\langle T\left(h_{I^{1}} \otimes \mathbf{1}_{K_{1}^{2}}, h_{J^{1}}^{0} \otimes \mathbf{1}_{J^{2}}\right), h_{K^{1}} \otimes \mathbf{1}_{K_{2}^{2}}\right\rangle
$$

If $K_{1}^{2}=J^{2}=K_{2}^{2}$, then the Hölder condition, the compact partial kernel representation (cf. (H2)), and Lemma 4.4 imply

$$
\begin{aligned}
\left|\mathscr{G}_{I, J, K}^{K_{1}^{2}, K_{2}^{2}}\right| \leq & \mathscr{P}_{1}\left(I^{1}, J^{1}, K^{1}\right) C\left(\mathbf{1}_{J^{2}}, \mathbf{1}_{J^{2}}, \mathbf{1}_{J^{2}}\right) \prod_{i=1}^{2}\left|I^{i}\right|^{-\frac{1}{2}}\left|J^{i}\right|^{-\frac{1}{2}}\left|K^{i}\right|^{-\frac{1}{2}} \\
& \lesssim\left[\frac{\ell\left(K^{1}\right)}{\ell\left(Q^{1}\right)}\right]^{\frac{\delta_{1}}{2}} F^{1}\left(K^{1}, Q^{1}\right) \frac{\left|I^{1}\right|^{\frac{1}{2}}\left|J^{1}\right|^{\frac{1}{2}}\left|K^{1}\right|^{\frac{1}{2}}}{\left|Q^{1}\right|^{2}} \\
& \times\left[\frac{\ell\left(K^{2}\right)}{\ell\left(Q^{2}\right)}\right]^{\frac{\delta_{2}}{2}} F^{2}\left(J^{2}\right) \frac{\left|I^{2}\right|^{\frac{1}{2}}\left|J^{2}\right|^{\frac{1}{2}}\left|K^{2}\right|^{\frac{1}{2}}}{\left|Q^{2}\right|^{2}}
\end{aligned}
$$

provided that $\ell\left(I^{2}\right) \simeq \ell\left(J^{2}\right) \simeq \ell\left(K^{2}\right) \simeq \ell\left(Q^{2}\right)$. If $K_{2}^{2} \neq J^{2}$, then $K_{2}^{2} \subset 3 J^{2} \backslash J^{2}$, which together with Lemmas 4.4 and 4.5 gives

$$
\begin{aligned}
\left|\mathscr{G}_{I, J, K}^{K_{1}^{2}, K_{2}^{2}}\right| \leq & \mathscr{P}_{1}\left(I^{1}, J^{1}, K^{1}\right) \mathscr{Q}_{2}\left(K_{1}^{2}, J^{2}, K_{2}^{2}\right) \prod_{i=1}^{2}\left|I^{i}\right|^{-\frac{1}{2}}\left|J^{i}\right|^{-\frac{1}{2}}\left|K^{i}\right|^{-\frac{1}{2}} \\
& \lesssim\left[\frac{\ell\left(K^{1}\right)}{\ell\left(Q^{1}\right)}\right]^{\frac{\delta_{1}}{2}} F^{1}\left(K^{1}, Q^{1}\right) \frac{\left|I^{1}\right|^{\frac{1}{2}}\left|J^{1}\right|^{\frac{1}{2}}\left|K^{1}\right|^{\frac{1}{2}}}{\left|Q^{1}\right|^{2}} \\
& \times\left[\frac{\ell\left(K_{2}^{2}\right)}{\ell\left(Q^{2}\right)}\right]^{\frac{\delta_{2}}{2}} F^{2}\left(K_{2}^{2}, Q^{2}\right) \frac{\left|K_{1}^{2}\right|^{\frac{1}{2}}\left|J^{2}\right|^{\frac{1}{2}}\left|K_{2}^{2}\right|^{\frac{1}{2}}}{\left|Q^{2}\right|^{2}}
\end{aligned}
$$

$$
\lesssim \prod_{i=1}^{2}\left[\frac{\ell\left(K^{i}\right)}{\ell\left(Q^{i}\right)}\right]^{\frac{\delta_{i}}{2}} F^{i}\left(K^{i}, Q^{i}\right) \frac{\left|I^{i}\right|^{\frac{1}{2}}\left|J^{i}\right|^{\frac{1}{2}}\left|K^{i}\right|^{\frac{1}{2}}}{\left|Q^{i}\right|^{2}}
$$

By symmetry, the same bound also holds in the case $K_{1}^{2} \neq J^{2}$. Accordingly, (5.9) is a consequence of (5.10)-(5.13) and that $F^{2}\left(K^{2}, Q^{2}\right) \simeq F^{2}\left(Q^{2}, Q^{2}\right)$ because of $\ell\left(K^{2}\right) \simeq$ $\ell\left(Q^{2}\right)$.

Set

$$
a_{I, J, K, Q}=\frac{\mathscr{G}_{I, J, K}}{C_{0} \prod_{i=1}^{2}\left[\ell\left(K^{i}\right) / \ell\left(Q^{i}\right)\right]^{h / 2}}
$$

if $I^{i}, J^{i} \in \mathcal{D}^{i}$ and $K^{i} \in \mathcal{D}_{\text {good }}^{i}$ with $\ell\left(K^{i}\right) \leq \ell\left(I^{i}\right)=2 \ell\left(J^{i}\right), i=1,2$, satisfy $\max \left\{\mathrm{d}\left(K^{1}, I^{1}\right), \mathrm{d}\left(K^{1}, J^{1}\right)\right\}>2 \ell\left(K^{1}\right)^{\gamma_{1}} \ell\left(J^{1}\right)^{1-\gamma_{1}}, \max \left\{\mathrm{d}\left(K^{2}, I^{2}\right), \mathrm{d}\left(K^{2}, J^{2}\right)\right\} \leq 2 \ell\left(K^{2}\right)^{\gamma_{2}} \ell\left(J^{2}\right)^{1-\gamma_{2}}$, and either $K^{2} \cap I^{2}=\varnothing$ or $K^{2} \cap J^{2}=\varnothing$ or $K^{2}=I^{2}$, and otherwise set $a_{I, J, K, Q}=0$. In view of (5.1) and (5.7), this allows us to write

$$
\begin{aligned}
& \mathscr{S}_{2}^{1}=\sum_{\substack{0 \leq i_{1} \leq k_{1} \\
0 \leq i_{2} \leq k_{2} \leq \vartheta \\
0 \leq i_{2} \leq k_{2} \leq \vartheta}} \sum_{Q^{1} \in \mathcal{D}^{1}} \sum_{\substack{I^{1}, J^{1} \in \mathcal{D}^{1}, K^{1} \in \mathcal{D}_{\text {good }}^{1} \\
\max \left\{\mathrm{d}\left(K^{1}, I^{1}\right), \mathrm{d}\left(K^{1}, J^{1}\right)\right\}>2 \ell\left(K^{1}\right)^{\gamma_{1}} \ell\left(J^{1}\right)^{1-\gamma_{1}}} \\
& \max \left\{d\left(K^{1}, I^{1}\right), \mathrm{d}\left(K^{1}, J^{1}\right)\right\}>2 \ell\left(K^{1}\right)^{\gamma_{1}} \ell\left(J^{1}\right)^{1-\gamma_{1}} \\
& 2 \ell\left(J^{1}\right)=\ell\left(I^{1}\right)=2^{-i_{1}} \ell\left(Q^{1}\right) \\
& \ell\left(K^{1}\right)=2^{-k_{1}} \ell\left(Q^{1}\right), I^{1} \vee J^{1} \vee K^{1}=Q^{1} \\
& \max \left\{\mathrm{d}\left(K^{2}, I^{2}\right), \mathrm{d}\left(K^{2}, J^{2}\right)\right\} \leq 2 \ell\left(K^{2}\right)^{\gamma_{2}} \ell\left(J^{2}\right)^{1-\gamma_{2}} \\
& K^{2} \cap I^{2}=43 \text { or } K^{2} \cap J^{2}=\varnothing \text { or } K^{2}=I^{2} \\
& 2 \ell\left(J^{2}\right)=\ell\left(I^{2}\right)=2^{-i_{2}} \ell\left(Q^{2}\right) \\
& \ell\left(K^{2}\right)=2^{-k_{2}} \ell\left(Q^{2}\right), I^{2} \vee J^{2} \vee K^{2}=Q^{2} \\
& =C_{0} \sum_{\substack{0 \leq i_{1} \leq k_{1} \\
0 \leq i_{2} \leq k_{2} \leq \vartheta}} 2^{-k_{1} \frac{\delta_{1}}{2}} 2^{-k_{2} \frac{\delta_{2}}{2}} \sum_{\substack{Q^{1} \in \mathcal{D}^{1} \\
Q^{2} \in \mathcal{D}^{2}}} \sum_{\substack{I^{1} \in \mathcal{D}_{i_{1}}^{1}\left(Q^{1}\right) \\
J^{1} \in \mathcal{D}_{i_{1}+1}^{1}\left(Q^{1}\right) \\
K^{1} \in \mathcal{D}_{k_{1}}^{2}\left(Q^{1}\right)}} \sum_{I^{1} \in \mathcal{D}_{i_{2}}^{2}\left(Q^{2}\right)} a_{I, J, K, Q} f_{1}^{I} f_{2}^{J} f_{3}^{K} .
\end{aligned}
$$

For any $k_{1} \in \mathbb{N}^{2}$ and $Q=\left(Q^{1}, Q^{2}\right) \in \mathcal{D}^{1} \times \mathcal{D}^{2}:=\mathcal{D}$, denote

$$
\mathcal{F}(Q):=F_{1}^{1}\left(\ell\left(Q^{1}\right)\right) \widetilde{F}_{2}^{1}\left(2^{-k_{1}} \ell\left(Q^{1}\right)\right) \widetilde{F}_{3}^{1}\left(Q^{1}\right) \widetilde{F}^{2}\left(Q^{2}\right)
$$

Then by Lemma 5.8 and that $F^{i} \in \mathscr{F}^{i}$ and $\left(F_{1}^{i}, F_{2}^{i}, F_{3}^{i}\right) \in \mathscr{F}$, we see that (5.5) and (5.6) hold whenever $C_{0}$ is large. Hence, we have

$$
\mathscr{S}_{2}^{1}=C_{0} \sum_{k_{1}=0}^{\infty} \sum_{k_{2}=0}^{\vartheta} 2^{-k_{1} \frac{\delta_{1}}{2}} 2^{-k_{2} \frac{\delta_{2}}{2}} \sum_{i_{1}=0}^{k_{1}} \sum_{i_{2}=0}^{k_{2}}\left\langle\mathbf{S}_{\mathcal{D}}^{\sigma(i, k)}\left(f_{1}, f_{2}\right), f_{3}\right\rangle
$$

where $\sigma(i, k):=\left(\left(i_{1}, i_{2}\right),\left(i_{1}+1, i_{2}+1\right),\left(k_{1}, k_{2}\right)\right)$.
5.5. Separated/Nested. In this case, denote $I^{2}:=\left(J^{2}\right)^{(1)}$. Noting that $h_{I^{2}} \mathbf{1}_{J^{2}}=$ $\left\langle h_{I^{2}}\right\rangle_{J^{2}} \mathbf{1}_{J^{2}}$, we perform the decomposition

$$
\mathscr{G}_{I, J, K}=\mathscr{G}_{I, J, K}^{1}+\mathscr{G}_{I, J, K}^{2}+\mathscr{G}_{I, J, K}^{3}
$$

where

$$
\begin{aligned}
& \mathscr{G}_{I, J, K}^{1}:=\left\langle h_{I^{2}}\right\rangle_{J^{2}}\left|J^{2}\right|^{-\frac{1}{2}}\left\langle T\left(h_{I^{1}} \otimes 1, h_{J^{1}}^{0} \otimes 1\right), h_{K^{1}} \otimes h_{K^{2}}\right\rangle, \\
& \mathscr{G}_{I, J, K}^{2}:=\left\langle h_{I^{2}}\right\rangle_{J^{2}}\left|J^{2}\right|^{-\frac{1}{2}}\left\langle T\left(h_{I^{1}} \otimes 1, h_{J^{1}}^{0} \otimes \mathbf{1}_{\left(J^{2}\right)^{c}}\right), h_{K^{1}} \otimes h_{K^{2}}\right\rangle, \\
& \mathscr{G}_{I, J, K}^{3}:=\left|J^{2}\right|^{-\frac{1}{2}}\left\langle T\left(h_{I^{1}} \otimes \phi_{J^{2}}, h_{J^{1}}^{0} \otimes \mathbf{1}_{J^{2}}\right), h_{K^{1}} \otimes h_{K^{2}}\right\rangle,
\end{aligned}
$$

with $\phi_{J^{2}}:=\mathbf{1}_{\left(J^{2}\right)^{c}}\left(h_{I^{2}}-\left\langle h_{I^{2}}\right\rangle_{J^{2}}\right)$. We then define the summation $\mathscr{S}_{3, k}^{1}$ corresponding to $\mathscr{G}_{I, J, K^{1}}^{k}, k=1,2,3$.

- Partial paraproducts. Rewrite

$$
\begin{aligned}
\mathscr{S}_{3,1}^{1}= & \sum_{\substack{I^{1}, J^{1} \in \mathcal{D}^{1}, K^{1} \in \mathcal{D}_{\text {good }}^{1} \\
\max \left\{\mathrm{~d}\left(K^{1}, J^{1}\right), \mathrm{d}\left(K^{1}, J^{1}\right)\right\}>2 \ell\left(K^{1}\right)^{\gamma_{1}} \ell\left(J^{1}\right)^{1-\gamma_{1}}} \sum_{\ell\left(K^{1}\right) \leq \ell\left(I^{1}\right)=2 \ell\left(J^{1}\right)} \sum_{K^{2} \in \mathcal{D}_{\text {good }}^{2}} \sum_{\substack{J^{2} \in \mathcal{D}^{2} \\
J^{2} \supset K^{2}}} \left\langle f_{3}, h_{K^{1}} \otimes h_{K^{2}}\right\rangle \\
& \times\left\langle T\left(h_{I^{1}} \otimes 1, h_{J^{1}}^{0} \otimes 1\right), h_{K^{1}} \otimes h_{K^{2}}\right\rangle\left\langle\left\langle f_{1}, h_{I^{1}}\right\rangle, h_{I^{2}}\right\rangle\left\langle\left\langle f_{2}, h_{J^{1}}^{0}\right\rangle\right\rangle_{J^{2}}\left\langle h_{I^{2}}\right\rangle_{J^{2}}
\end{aligned}
$$

Much as above, for $\mathscr{S}^{2}$, the separated/nested term is given by

$$
\begin{aligned}
\mathscr{S}_{3}^{2}:= & \sum_{\substack{I^{1}, J^{1} \in \mathcal{D}^{1}, K^{1} \in \mathcal{D}_{\text {good }}^{1} \\
\max \left\{\mathrm{~d}\left(K^{1}, I^{1}\right), \mathrm{d}\left(K^{1}, J^{1}\right)\right\}>2 \ell\left(K^{1}\right)^{\gamma_{1}} \ell\left(J^{1}\right)^{1-\gamma_{1}}} \sum_{\ell\left(K^{1}\right) \leq \ell\left(I^{1}\right)=2 \ell\left(J^{1}\right)}} \sum_{K^{2} \in \mathcal{D}_{\text {good }}^{2}} \sum_{\substack{J^{2} \in \mathcal{D}^{2} \\
J^{2} \supset K^{2}}} \left\langle f_{3}, h_{K^{1}} \otimes h_{K^{2}}\right\rangle \\
& \times\left\langle T\left(h_{I^{1}} \otimes \mathbf{1}_{I^{2}}, h_{J^{1}}^{0} \otimes h_{I^{2}}\right), h_{K^{1}} \otimes h_{K^{2}}\right\rangle\left\langle\left\langle f_{1}, h_{I^{1}}\right\rangle\right\rangle_{I^{2}}\left\langle\left\langle f_{2}, h_{J^{1}}^{0}\right\rangle, h_{I^{2}}\right\rangle
\end{aligned}
$$

As done in (5.14), we obtain the corresponding term

$$
\begin{aligned}
\mathscr{S}_{3,1}^{2}= & \sum_{\substack{I^{1}, J^{1} \in \mathcal{D}^{1}, K^{1} \in \mathcal{D}_{\text {good }}^{1} \\
\max \left\{\mathrm{~d}\left(K^{1}, I^{1}\right), \mathrm{d}\left(K^{1}, J^{1}\right)\right\}>2 \ell\left(K^{1}\right)^{\gamma_{1}} \ell\left(J^{1}\right)^{1-\gamma_{1}}} \sum_{\ell\left(K^{1}\right) \leq \ell\left(I^{1}\right)=2 \ell\left(J^{1}\right)}} \sum_{K^{2} \in \mathcal{D}_{\text {good }}^{2}}\left\langle f_{3}, h_{K^{1}} \otimes h_{K^{2}}\right\rangle \\
& \times\left\langle T\left(h_{I^{1}} \otimes 1, h_{J^{1}}^{0} \otimes 1\right), h_{K^{1}} \otimes h_{K^{2}}\right\rangle\left\langle\left\langle f_{1}, h_{I^{1}}\right\rangle\right\rangle_{I^{2}}\left\langle\left\langle f_{2}, h_{J^{1}}^{0}\right\rangle, h_{I^{2}}\right\rangle\left\langle h_{I^{2}}\right\rangle_{J^{2}}
\end{aligned}
$$

Note that

$$
\left\langle g, h_{I^{(1)}}\right\rangle\left\langle h_{I^{(1)}}\right\rangle_{I}=\langle g\rangle_{I}-\langle g\rangle_{I^{(1)}}
$$

which gives

$$
\left[\left\langle g_{1}, h_{I^{(1)}}\right\rangle\left\langle g_{2}\right\rangle_{I}+\left\langle g_{1}\right\rangle_{I^{(1)}}\left\langle g_{2}, h_{I^{(1)}}\right\rangle\right]\left\langle h_{I^{(1)}}\right\rangle_{I}=\left\langle g_{1}\right\rangle_{I}\left\langle g_{2}\right\rangle_{I}-\left\langle g_{1}\right\rangle_{I^{(1)}}\left\langle g_{2}\right\rangle_{I^{(1)}}
$$

Hence,

$$
\begin{aligned}
\mathscr{S}_{3,1}^{1}+\mathscr{S}_{3,1}^{2}= & \sum_{\substack{I^{1}, J^{1} \in \mathcal{D}^{1}, K^{1} \in \mathcal{D}_{\text {good }}^{1} \\
\max \left\{\mathrm{~d}\left(K^{1}, I^{1}\right), \mathrm{d}\left(K^{1}, J^{1}\right)\right\}>2 \ell\left(K^{1}\right)^{\gamma_{1}} \ell\left(J^{1}\right)^{1-\gamma_{1}}} \sum_{\ell\left(K^{1}\right) \leq \ell\left(I^{1}\right)=2 \ell\left(J^{1}\right)}} \sum_{K^{2} \in \mathcal{D}_{\text {good }}^{2}}\left\langle f_{3}, h_{K^{1}} \otimes h_{K^{2}}\right\rangle \\
& \times\left\langle T\left(h_{I^{1}} \otimes 1, h_{J^{1}}^{0} \otimes 1\right), h_{K^{1}} \otimes h_{K^{2}}\right\rangle\left\langle\left\langle f_{1}, h_{I^{1}}\right\rangle\right\rangle_{K^{2}}\left\langle\left\langle f_{2}, h_{J^{1}}^{0}\right\rangle\right\rangle_{K^{2}}
\end{aligned}
$$

$$
\begin{aligned}
= & \sum_{\substack{0 \leq i_{1} \leq k_{1} \\
Q^{1} \in \mathcal{D}^{1}}} \sum_{\substack{I^{1}, J^{1} \in \mathcal{D}^{1}, K^{1} \in \mathcal{D}_{\text {good }}^{1} \\
\max \left\{\mathrm{~d}\left(K^{1}, I^{1}\right), \mathrm{d}\left(K^{1}, J^{1}\right)\right\}>2 \ell\left(K^{1}\right)^{\gamma_{1}} \ell\left(J^{1}\right)^{1-\gamma_{1}}} \sum_{K^{2} \in \mathcal{D}_{\text {good }}^{2}}}\left\langle f_{3}, h_{K^{1}} \otimes h_{K^{2}}\right\rangle \\
& \left\langle f_{3}, h_{K^{1}} \otimes h_{K^{2}}\right\rangle \\
& \text { Let } Q=\left(Q^{1}, Q^{2}\right) \in \mathcal{D}^{1} \times \mathcal{D}^{2}=: \mathcal{D} \text {. Set } \\
& a_{I^{1}, J^{1}, K^{1}, Q}=\frac{\left\langle T\left(h_{I^{1}} \otimes 1, h_{J^{1}}^{0} \otimes 1\right), h_{K^{1}} \otimes h_{Q^{2}}\right\rangle}{C_{0}\left[\ell\left(K^{1}\right) / \ell\left(Q^{1}\right)\right]^{\delta_{1} / 2}} \\
& \text { if } I^{1}, J^{1} \in \mathcal{D}^{1}, K^{1} \in \mathcal{D}_{\text {good }}^{1} \text {, and } Q^{2} \in \mathcal{D}_{\text {good }}^{2} \text { satisfy } \ell\left(K^{1}\right) \leq \ell\left(I^{1}\right)=2 \ell\left(J^{1}\right) \text { and } \\
& \max \left\{\mathrm{d}\left(K^{1}, I^{1}\right), \mathrm{d}\left(K^{1}, J^{1}\right)\right\}>2 \ell\left(K^{1}\right)^{\gamma_{1}} \ell\left(J^{1}\right)^{1-\gamma_{1}} \text {, and otherwise set } a_{I^{1}, J^{1}, K^{1}, Q}=0 \text {. } \\
& \text { Then we rewrite }
\end{aligned}
$$

$$
\begin{aligned}
& \mathscr{S}_{3,1}^{1}+\mathscr{S}_{3,1}^{2}=C_{0} \sum_{0 \leq i_{1} \leq k_{1}} 2^{-k_{1} \frac{\delta_{1}}{2}} \sum_{\substack{Q^{1} \in \mathcal{D}^{1} \\
Q^{2} \in \mathcal{D}^{2}}} \sum_{\substack{I^{1} \in \mathcal{D}_{i_{1}}^{1}\left(Q^{1}\right) \\
J^{1} \in \mathcal{D}_{i_{1}+1}^{1}\left(Q^{1}\right) \\
K^{1} \in \mathcal{D}_{k_{1}}^{1}\left(Q^{1}\right)} a_{I^{1}, J^{1}, K^{1}, Q} \\
& \times\left\langle f_{1}, h_{I^{1}} \otimes \bar{h}_{Q^{2}}\right\rangle\left\langle f_{2}, h_{J^{1}}^{0} \otimes \bar{h}_{Q^{2}}\right\rangle\left\langle f_{3}, h_{K^{1}} \otimes h_{Q^{2}}\right\rangle \\
& =C_{0} \sum_{k_{1}=0}^{\infty} 2^{-k_{1} \frac{\delta_{1}}{2}} \sum_{i_{1}=0}^{k_{1}}\left\langle\mathbf{P}_{\mathcal{D}}^{1, i_{1}, i_{1}+1, k_{1}}\left(f_{1}, f_{2}\right), f_{3}\right\rangle
\end{aligned}
$$

where $\bar{h}_{Q^{2}}:=\frac{\mathbf{1}_{Q^{2}}}{\left|Q^{2}\right|}$. By Lemma 4.9, $\mathbf{P}_{\mathcal{D}}^{1, i_{1}, i_{1}+1, k_{1}}$ is a partial paraproduct (cf. Definition 3.10), where

$$
\mathcal{F}^{1}\left(Q^{1}\right):=F_{1}^{1}\left(\ell\left(Q^{1}\right)\right) \widetilde{F}_{2}^{1}\left(2^{-k_{1}} \ell\left(Q^{1}\right)\right) \widetilde{F}_{3}^{1}\left(Q^{1}\right)
$$

- Bilinear dyadic shifts. Let us turn to the estimates for $\mathscr{S}_{3,2}^{1}$ and $\mathscr{S}_{3,3}^{1}$.

Lemma 5.17. For each $k=2,3$, there holds

$$
\left|\mathscr{G}_{I, J, K}^{k}\right| \lesssim\left[\frac{\ell\left(K^{1}\right)}{\ell\left(Q^{1}\right)}\right]^{\frac{\delta_{1}}{2}} F^{1}\left(K^{1}, Q^{1}\right) \frac{\left|I^{1}\right|^{\frac{1}{2}}\left|J^{1}\right|^{\frac{1}{2}}\left|K^{1}\right|^{\frac{1}{2}}}{\left|Q^{1}\right|^{2}}\left[\frac{\ell\left(K^{2}\right)}{\ell\left(J^{2}\right)}\right]^{\frac{\delta_{2}}{2}} F^{2}\left(K^{2}, J^{2}\right) \frac{\left|K^{2}\right|^{\frac{1}{2}}}{\left|J^{2}\right|}
$$

where $F^{i}$ is defined in (4.1).
Proof. First, let us estimate $\mathscr{G}_{I, J, K}^{2}$. In the case $\ell\left(J^{2}\right)>2^{\text {d }} \ell\left(K^{2}\right)$, we have $\mathscr{G}_{I, J, K}^{2}=$ $\mathscr{G}_{I, J, K}^{2,1}+\mathscr{G}_{I, J, K}^{2,2}$, where

$$
\begin{aligned}
& \mathscr{G}_{I, J, K}^{2,1}:=\left\langle h_{I^{2}}\right\rangle_{J^{2}}\left|J^{2}\right|^{-\frac{1}{2}}\left\langle T\left(h_{I^{1}} \otimes \mathbf{1}_{3 K^{2}}, h_{J^{1}}^{0} \otimes \mathbf{1}_{\left(J^{2}\right)^{c}}\right), h_{K^{1}} \otimes h_{K^{2}}\right\rangle \\
& \mathscr{G}_{I, J, K}^{2,2}:=\left\langle h_{I^{2}}\right\rangle_{J^{2}}\left|J^{2}\right|^{-\frac{1}{2}}\left\langle T\left(h_{I^{1}} \otimes \mathbf{1}_{\left(3 K^{2}\right)^{c}}, h_{J^{1}}^{0} \otimes \mathbf{1}_{\left(J^{2}\right)^{c}}\right), h_{K^{1}} \otimes h_{K^{2}}\right\rangle
\end{aligned}
$$

For all $x_{2} \in K^{2}$ and $z_{2} \in\left(J^{2}\right)^{c}$, the goodness of $K^{2}$ gives

$$
\begin{aligned}
\left|x_{2}-z_{2}\right| & \geq \mathrm{d}\left(K^{2},\left(J^{2}\right)^{c}\right)>2 \ell\left(K^{2}\right)^{\gamma_{2}} \ell\left(J^{2}\right)^{1-\gamma_{2}} \\
& \geq \ell\left(K^{2}\right)^{\frac{1}{2}} \ell\left(J^{2}\right)^{\frac{1}{2}} \geq \ell\left(K^{2}\right) \geq 2\left|x_{2}-c_{K^{2}}\right|
\end{aligned}
$$

which, along with the cancellation of $h_{K^{1}}$ and $h_{K^{2}}$, the compact full kernel representation (cf. (H1)), the Hölder condition, Lemma 4.4 and Lemma 4.6 applied to $\ell_{2}=\ell\left(K^{2}\right)^{\frac{1}{2}} \ell\left(J^{2}\right)^{\frac{1}{2}}$, implies

$$
\begin{aligned}
& \left|\mathscr{G}_{I, J, K}^{2, j}\right| \leq \mathscr{P}_{1}\left(I^{1}, J^{1}, K^{1}\right) \mathscr{R}_{2}^{j}\left(J^{2}, K^{2}\right) \prod_{i=1}^{2}\left|I^{i}\right|^{-\frac{1}{2}}\left|J^{i}\right|^{-\frac{1}{2}}\left|K^{i}\right|^{-\frac{1}{2}} \\
& \lesssim\left[\frac{\ell\left(K^{1}\right)}{\ell\left(Q^{1}\right)}\right]^{\frac{\ell_{1}}{2}} F_{1}\left(K^{1}, Q^{1}\right) \frac{\left|I^{1}\right|^{\frac{1}{2}}\left|J^{1}\right|^{\frac{1}{2}}\left|K^{1}\right|^{\frac{1}{2}}}{\left|Q^{1}\right|^{2}}\left[\frac{\ell\left(K^{2}\right)}{\ell\left(J^{2}\right)}\right]^{\frac{\ell_{2}}{2}} F^{2}\left(K^{2}, J^{2}\right) \frac{\left|K^{2}\right|^{\frac{1}{2}}}{\left|J^{2}\right|}
\end{aligned}
$$

for every $j=1,2$.
To treat the case $\ell\left(J^{2}\right) \leq 2^{\vartheta} \ell\left(K^{2}\right)$, we split

$$
\begin{aligned}
\mathscr{G}_{I, J, K}^{2}= & \left\langle h_{I^{2}}\right\rangle_{J^{2}}\left|J^{2}\right|^{-\frac{1}{2}}\left\langle T\left(h_{I^{1}} \otimes \mathbf{1}_{3 K^{2}}, h_{J^{1}}^{0} \otimes \mathbf{1}_{3 J^{2} \backslash J^{2}}\right), h_{K^{1}} \otimes h_{K^{2}}\right\rangle \\
& +\left\langle h_{I^{2}}\right\rangle_{J^{2}}\left|J^{2}\right|^{-\frac{1}{2}}\left\langle T\left(h_{I^{1}} \otimes \mathbf{1}_{3 K^{2}}, h_{J^{1}}^{0} \otimes \mathbf{1}_{\left(3 J^{2}\right)^{c}}\right), h_{K^{1}} \otimes h_{K^{2}}\right\rangle \\
& +\left\langle h_{I^{2}}\right\rangle_{J^{2}}\left|J^{2}\right|^{-\frac{1}{2}}\left\langle T\left(h_{I^{1}} \otimes \mathbf{1}_{\left(3 K^{2}\right)^{c}}, h_{J^{1}}^{0} \otimes \mathbf{1}_{3 J^{2} \backslash J^{2}}\right), h_{K^{1}} \otimes h_{K^{2}}\right\rangle \\
& +\left\langle h_{I^{2}}\right\rangle_{J^{2}}\left|J^{2}\right|^{-\frac{1}{2}}\left\langle T\left(h_{I^{1}} \otimes \mathbf{1}_{\left(3 K^{2}\right)^{c}}, h_{J^{1}}^{0} \otimes \mathbf{1}_{\left(3 J^{2}\right)^{c}}\right), h_{K^{1}} \otimes h_{K^{2}}\right\rangle
\end{aligned}
$$

The first term is similar to $\mathscr{G}_{I, J, K}$ in the case $K^{2} \cap J^{2}=\varnothing$ in Section 5.4, which along with (5.10) yields the desired bound. The second and last terms are analogous to $\mathscr{G}_{I, J, K}^{2,1}$ and $\mathscr{G}_{I, J, K}^{2,2}$ respectively, but now $\ell_{2}=\ell\left(K^{2}\right)$. The third term is symmetric to the second one. Eventually, the last three terms are dominated by

$$
\left[\frac{\ell\left(K^{1}\right)}{\ell\left(Q^{1}\right)}\right]^{\frac{\ell_{1}}{2}} F_{1}\left(K^{1}, Q^{1}\right) \frac{\left|I^{1}\right|^{\frac{1}{2}}\left|J^{1}\right|^{\frac{1}{2}}\left|K^{1}\right|^{\frac{1}{2}}}{\left|Q^{1}\right|^{2}} F^{2}\left(K^{2}, J^{2}\right) \frac{\left|K^{2}\right|^{\frac{1}{2}}}{\left|J^{2}\right|}
$$

which together with $\ell\left(J^{2}\right) \simeq \ell\left(K^{2}\right)$ gives the estimate as desired.
Next, we bound $\mathscr{G}_{I, J, K}^{3}$. If $\ell\left(J^{2}\right)>2^{\vartheta} \ell\left(K^{2}\right)$, then by (5.18), $\mathscr{G}_{I, J, K}^{3}$ is similar to $\mathscr{G}_{I, J, K}^{2,2}$. If $\ell\left(J^{2}\right) \leq 2^{\vartheta} \ell\left(K^{2}\right)$, we split

$$
\begin{aligned}
\mathscr{G}_{I, J, K}^{3}= & \left|J^{2}\right|^{-\frac{1}{2}}\left\langle T\left(h_{I^{1}} \otimes\left(\phi_{J^{2}} \mathbf{1}_{3 J^{2} \backslash J^{2}}\right), h_{J^{1}}^{0} \otimes \mathbf{1}_{J^{2}}\right), h_{K^{1}} \otimes h_{K^{2}}\right\rangle \\
& +\left|J^{2}\right|^{-\frac{1}{2}}\left\langle T\left(h_{I^{1}} \otimes\left(\phi_{J^{2}} \mathbf{1}_{\left(3 J^{2}\right)^{c}}\right), h_{J^{1}}^{0} \otimes \mathbf{1}_{J^{2}}\right), h_{K^{1}} \otimes h_{K^{2}}\right\rangle
\end{aligned}
$$

which are similar to the first two terms in (5.20) respectively.
Recall that $I^{2}=\left(J^{2}\right)^{(1)}$. Now set $Q^{2}=I^{2}$ and

$$
a_{I, J, K, Q}=\frac{\mathscr{G}_{I, J, K}^{2}+\mathscr{G}_{I, J, K}^{3}}{C_{0} \prod_{i=1}^{2}\left[\ell\left(K^{i}\right) / \ell\left(Q^{i}\right)\right]^{b_{i} / 2}}
$$

if $I^{1}, J^{1} \in \mathcal{D}^{1}, K^{1} \in \mathcal{D}_{\text {good }}^{1}, J^{2} \in \mathcal{D}^{2}$, and $K^{2} \in \mathcal{D}_{\text {good }}^{2}$ satisfy $\max \left\{\mathrm{d}\left(K^{1}, I^{1}\right), \mathrm{d}\left(K^{1}, J^{1}\right)\right\}>$ $2 \ell\left(K^{1}\right)^{\gamma_{1}} \ell\left(J^{1}\right)^{1-\gamma_{1}}, \ell\left(K^{1}\right) \leq \ell\left(I^{1}\right)=2 \ell\left(J^{1}\right)$, and $K^{2} \subset J^{2}$, and otherwise set $a_{I, J, K, Q}=$ 0 . For any $k=\left(k_{1}, k_{2}\right) \in \mathbb{N}^{2}$ and $Q=Q^{1} \times Q^{2} \in \mathcal{D}^{1} \times \mathcal{D}^{2}$, denote

$$
\mathcal{F}(Q):=\prod_{i=1}^{2} F_{1}^{i}\left(\ell\left(Q^{i}\right)\right) \widetilde{F}_{2}^{i}\left(2^{-k_{i}} \ell\left(Q^{i}\right)\right) \widetilde{F}_{3}^{i}\left(Q^{i}\right)
$$

Then Lemma 5.17 and that $\left(F_{1}^{i}, F_{2}^{i}, F_{3}^{i}\right) \in \mathscr{F}$ imply both (5.5) and (5.6) hold whenever $C_{0}$ is large. Consequently, by (5.1) and $K^{2} \subset J^{2} \in \operatorname{ch}\left(Q^{2}\right)$, we deduce

$$
\begin{aligned}
& \mathscr{S}_{3,2}^{1}+\mathscr{S}_{3,3}^{1}=C_{0} \sum_{\substack{0 \leq i_{1} \leq k_{1} \\
k_{2} \geq 1}} 2^{-k_{1} \frac{s_{1}}{2}} 2^{-k_{2} \frac{s_{2}}{2}} \sum_{\substack{Q^{1} \in \mathcal{D}^{1} \\
Q^{2} \in \mathcal{D}^{2}}} \sum_{\substack{I^{1} \in \mathcal{D}_{i_{1}}^{1}\left(Q^{1}\right) \\
J^{1} \in \mathcal{D}_{k_{1}+1}^{1}\left(Q^{1}\right) \\
K^{1} \in \mathcal{D}_{k_{1}}^{1}\left(Q^{1}\right) \\
& \times \sum_{K^{2} \in \mathcal{D}_{k_{2}}^{2}\left(Q^{2}\right)} a_{I, J, K, Q} f_{1}^{I} f_{2}^{J} f_{3}^{K} \\
& =C_{0} \sum_{k_{1}=0}^{\infty} \sum_{k_{2}=1}^{\infty} 2^{-k_{1} \frac{s_{1}}{2}} 2^{-k_{2} \frac{s_{2}}{2}} \sum_{i_{1}=0}^{k_{1}}\left\langle\mathbf{S}_{\mathcal{D}}^{\sigma(i, k)}\left(f_{1}, f_{2}\right), f_{3}\right\rangle
\end{aligned}
$$

where $\sigma(i, k):=\left(\left(i_{1}, 0\right),\left(i_{1}+1,1\right),\left(k_{1}, k_{2}\right)\right)$.
5.6. Adjacent/Adjacent. By Lemma 2.1 part (b), for each $i=1,2$, there exists a minimal cube $Q^{i}:=I^{i} \vee J^{i} \vee K^{i} \in \mathcal{D}^{i}$ such that

$$
I^{i} \cup J^{i} \cup K^{i} \subset Q^{i} \quad \text { and } \quad \ell\left(Q^{i}\right) \leq 2^{\vartheta} \ell\left(K^{i}\right)
$$

In the current scenario, we first prove the following estimate.
Lemma 5.22. For each $i=1,2$, let $I^{i}, J^{i} \in \mathcal{D}^{i}$ and $K^{i} \in \mathcal{D}_{\text {good }}^{i}$ satisfy $\ell\left(K^{i}\right) \leq$ $\ell\left(I^{i}\right)=2 \ell\left(J^{i}\right)$ and either $K^{i} \cap I^{i}=\emptyset$ or $K^{i} \cap J^{i}=\varnothing$ or $K^{i}=I^{i}$. Then

$$
\left|\mathscr{G}_{I, J, K}\right| \lesssim \prod_{i=1}^{2}\left[\frac{\ell\left(K^{i}\right)}{\ell\left(Q^{i}\right)}\right]^{\frac{s_{i}}{2}} \mathcal{F}^{i}\left(Q^{i}\right) \frac{\left|I^{i}\right|^{\frac{1}{2}}\left|J^{i}\right|^{\frac{1}{2}}\left|K^{i}\right|^{\frac{1}{2}}}{\left|Q^{i}\right|^{2}}
$$

where

$$
\mathcal{F}^{i}\left(Q^{i}\right):=F^{i}\left(Q^{i}, Q^{i}\right)+\sum_{\substack{0 \leq k_{i} \leq \vartheta \\ J^{i} \in \mathcal{D}_{k_{i}+1}\left(Q^{i}\right)}} F^{i}\left(J^{i}\right)
$$

with $F^{i}(\cdot, \cdot)$ defined in (4.1).
Proof. By similarity and symmetry, it suffices to treat the following cases:
(i) $K^{1} \cap I^{1}=\varnothing$ and $K^{2} \cap I^{2}=\varnothing$;
(ii) $K^{1} \cap I^{1}=\varnothing, K^{2} \cap J^{2} \neq \emptyset$ and $K^{2}=I^{2}$;
(iii) $K^{i} \cap J^{i} \neq \varnothing$ and $K^{i}=I^{i}, \quad i=1,2$.

In case (i), by the cancellation of $h_{K^{1}}$ and $h_{K^{2}}$, the compact full kernel representation (cf. (H1)), the size condition, and Lemma 4.5, we deduce

$$
\begin{aligned}
\left|\mathscr{G}_{I, J, K}\right| & \leq \prod_{i=1}^{2} \mathscr{B}_{i}\left(I^{i}, J^{i}, K^{i}\right)\left|I^{i}\right|^{-\frac{1}{2}}\left|J^{i}\right|^{-\frac{1}{2}}\left|K^{i}\right|^{-\frac{1}{2}} \\
& \lesssim \prod_{i=1}^{2}\left[\frac{\ell\left(K^{i}\right)}{\ell\left(Q^{i}\right)}\right]^{\frac{s_{i}}{2}} F^{i}\left(K^{i}, Q^{i}\right) \frac{\left|I^{i}\right|^{\frac{1}{2}}\left|J^{i}\right|^{\frac{1}{2}}\left|K^{i}\right|^{\frac{1}{2}}}{\left|Q^{i}\right|^{2}}
\end{aligned}
$$

In case (ii), we have $J^{2} \in \operatorname{ch}\left(K^{2}\right)$ and

$$
\mathscr{G}_{I, J, K}=\sum_{K_{1}^{2}, K_{2}^{2} \in \operatorname{ch}\left(K^{2}\right)} \mathscr{G}_{I, J, K}^{K_{1}^{2}, K_{2}^{2}}
$$

where

$$
