\mathscr{G}_{I, J, K}^{K_{1}^{2}, K_{2}^{2}}:=\left|J^{1}\right|^{-\frac{1}{2}}\left|J^{2}\right|^{-\frac{1}{2}}\left\langle h_{K^{2}}\right\rangle_{K_{1}^{2}}\left\langle h_{K^{2}}\right\rangle_{K_{2}^{2}}\left\langle T\left(h_{I^{1}} \otimes \mathbf{1}_{K_{1}^{2}}, \mathbf{1}_{J^{1}} \otimes \mathbf{1}_{J^{2}}\right), h_{K^{1}} \otimes \mathbf{1}_{K_{2}^{2}}\right\rangle
$$

If $K_{1}^{2}=K_{2}^{2}=J^{2}$, then the compact partial kernel representation (cf. (H2)), the size condition, and Lemma 4.5 imply

$$
\begin{aligned}
\left|\mathscr{G}_{I, J, K}^{K_{1}^{2}, K_{2}^{2}}\right| \leq & \mathscr{Q}_{1}\left(I^{1}, J^{1}, K^{1}\right) C\left(\mathbf{1}_{J^{2}}, \mathbf{1}_{J^{2}}, \mathbf{1}_{J^{2}}\right) \prod_{i=1}^{2}\left|I^{i}\right|^{-\frac{1}{2}}\left|J^{i}\right|^{-\frac{1}{2}}\left|K^{i}\right|^{-\frac{1}{2}} \\
\leq & {\left[\frac{\ell\left(K^{1}\right)}{\ell\left(Q^{1}\right)}\right]^{\frac{\delta_{1}}{2}} F^{1}\left(K^{1}, Q^{1}\right) \frac{\left|I^{1}\right|^{\frac{1}{2}}\left|J^{1}\right|^{\frac{1}{2}}\left|K^{1}\right|^{\frac{1}{2}}}{\left|Q^{1}\right|^{2}} \\
& \times\left[\frac{\ell\left(K^{2}\right)}{\ell\left(Q^{2}\right)}\right]^{\frac{\delta_{2}}{2}} F^{2}\left(J^{2}\right) \frac{\left|I^{2}\right|^{\frac{1}{2}}\left|J^{2}\right|^{\frac{1}{2}}\left|K^{2}\right|^{\frac{1}{2}}}{\left|Q^{2}\right|^{2}}
\end{aligned}
$$

provided that $\ell\left(I^{2}\right) \simeq \ell\left(J^{2}\right) \simeq \ell\left(K^{2}\right) \simeq \ell\left(Q^{2}\right)$. If $K_{1}^{2} \neq J^{2}$, then $K_{1}^{2} \subset 3 J^{2} \backslash J^{2}$, which is similar to case (i). Thus, (5.24) gives

$$
\begin{aligned}
\left|\mathscr{G}_{I, J, K}^{K_{1}^{2}, K_{2}^{2}}\right| \lesssim & {\left[\frac{\ell\left(K^{1}\right)}{\ell\left(Q^{1}\right)}\right]^{\frac{\delta_{1}}{2}} F^{1}\left(K^{1}, Q^{1}\right) \frac{\left|I^{1}\right|^{\frac{1}{2}}\left|J^{1}\right|^{\frac{1}{2}}\left|K^{1}\right|^{\frac{1}{2}}}{\left|Q^{1}\right|^{2}} \\
& \times\left[\frac{\ell\left(K_{2}^{2}\right)}{\ell\left(Q^{2}\right)}\right]^{\frac{\delta_{2}}{2}} F^{2}\left(K_{2}^{2}, Q^{2}\right) \frac{\left|K_{1}^{2}\right|^{\frac{1}{2}}\left|J^{2}\right|^{\frac{1}{2}}\left|K_{2}^{2}\right|^{\frac{1}{2}}}{\left|Q^{2}\right|^{2}} \\
& \lesssim \prod_{i=1}^{2}\left[\frac{\ell\left(K^{i}\right)}{\ell\left(Q^{i}\right)}\right]^{\frac{\delta_{i}}{2}} F^{i}\left(K^{i}, Q^{i}\right) \frac{\left|I^{i}\right|^{\frac{1}{2}}\left|J^{i}\right|^{\frac{1}{2}}\left|K^{i}\right|^{\frac{1}{2}}}{\left|Q^{i}\right|^{2}}
\end{aligned}
$$

By symmetry, (5.26) also holds in the case $K_{2}^{2} \neq J^{2}$.
In case (iii), we see that $J^{1} \in \operatorname{ch}\left(K^{1}\right), J^{2} \in \operatorname{ch}\left(K^{2}\right)$, and

$$
\mathscr{G}_{I, J, K}=\sum_{\substack{K_{1}^{1}, K_{2}^{1} \in \operatorname{ch}\left(K^{1}\right) \\ K_{1}^{2}, K_{2}^{2} \in \operatorname{ch}\left(K^{2}\right)}} \mathscr{G}_{I, J, K}^{K}
$$

where $\mathbf{K}=\left(K_{1}^{1}, K_{1}^{2}, K_{2}^{1}, K_{2}^{2}\right)$ and

$$
\begin{aligned}
\mathscr{G}_{I, J, K}^{\mathbf{K}}:= & \left|J^{1}\right|^{-\frac{1}{2}}\left|J^{2}\right|^{-\frac{1}{2}}\left\langle h_{K^{1}}\right\rangle_{K_{1}^{1}}\left\langle h_{K^{1}}\right\rangle_{K_{2}^{1}}\left\langle h_{K^{2}}\right\rangle_{K_{1}^{2}}\left\langle h_{K^{2}}\right\rangle_{K_{2}^{2}} \\
& \times\left\langle T\left(\mathbf{1}_{K_{1}^{1}} \otimes \mathbf{1}_{K_{1}^{2}}, \mathbf{1}_{J^{1}} \otimes \mathbf{1}_{J^{2}}\right), \mathbf{1}_{K_{2}^{1}} \otimes \mathbf{1}_{K_{2}^{2}}\right\rangle
\end{aligned}
$$

If $K_{1}^{1}=K_{2}^{1}=J^{1}$ and $K_{1}^{2}=K_{2}^{2}=J^{2}$, then the hypothesis (H3), namely the weak compactness property, gives

$$
\mathscr{G}_{I, J, K}^{\mathbf{K}} \leq \prod_{i=1}^{2} F_{i}\left(J^{i}\right)\left|J^{i}\right|^{\frac{1}{2}}\left|K^{i}\right|^{-1} \lesssim \prod_{i=1}^{2} F_{i}\left(J^{i}\right)\left|J^{i}\right|^{-\frac{1}{2}}
$$

If $K_{1}^{1}=K_{2}^{1}=J^{1}$ and either $K_{1}^{2} \neq J^{2}$ or $K_{2}^{2} \neq J^{2}$, then by the compact partial kernel representation (cf. (H2)), the size condition, and Lemma 4.5,

$$
\begin{aligned}
\mathscr{G}_{I, J, K}^{\mathbf{K}} & \leq C\left(\mathbf{1}_{J^{1}}, \mathbf{1}_{J^{1}}, \mathbf{1}_{J^{1}}\right) \mathscr{Q}_{2}\left(K_{1}^{2}, J^{2}, K_{2}^{2}\right) \prod_{i=1}^{2}\left|J^{i}\right|^{-\frac{1}{2}}\left|K^{i}\right|^{-1} \\
& \lesssim F_{1}\left(J^{1}\right)\left|J^{1}\right|^{\frac{1}{2}}\left|K^{1}\right|^{-1}\left[\frac{\ell\left(K^{2}\right)}{\ell\left(Q^{2}\right)}\right]^{\frac{\delta_{2}}{2}} F^{2}\left(K^{2}, Q^{2}\right) \frac{\left|I^{2}\right|^{\frac{1}{2}}\left|J^{2}\right|^{\frac{1}{2}}\left|K^{2}\right|^{\frac{1}{2}}}{\left|Q^{2}\right|^{2}}
\end{aligned}
$$

If either $K_{1}^{1} \neq J^{1}$ or $K_{1}^{2} \neq J^{1}$ and $K_{1}^{2}=K_{2}^{2}=J^{2}$, then it is similar to case (ii) with $K_{1}^{2}=J^{2}=K_{2}^{2}$. Thus, (5.25) leads to

$$
\begin{aligned}
\mathscr{G}_{I, J, K}^{\mathbf{K}} & \lesssim\left[\frac{\ell\left(K_{2}^{1}\right)}{\ell\left(Q^{1}\right)}\right]^{\frac{\delta_{1}}{2}} F_{1}\left(K_{2}^{1}, Q^{1}\right) \frac{\left|K_{1}^{1}\right|^{\frac{1}{2}}\left|J^{1}\right|^{\frac{1}{2}}\left|K_{2}^{1}\right|^{\frac{1}{2}}}{\left|Q^{1}\right|^{2}} \\
& \times F_{2}\left(J^{2}\right)\left|I^{2}\right|^{-\frac{1}{2}}\left|J^{2}\right|^{\frac{1}{2}}\left|K^{2}\right|^{-\frac{1}{2}} \\
& \lesssim\left[\frac{\ell\left(K^{1}\right)}{\ell\left(Q^{1}\right)}\right]^{\frac{\delta_{1}}{2}} F_{1}\left(K^{1}, Q^{1}\right) \frac{\left|I^{1}\right|^{\frac{1}{2}}\left|J^{1}\right|^{\frac{1}{2}}\left|K^{1}\right|^{\frac{1}{2}}}{\left|Q^{1}\right|^{2}} \\
& \times F_{2}\left(J^{2}\right)\left|I^{2}\right|^{-\frac{1}{2}}\left|J^{2}\right|^{\frac{1}{2}}\left|K^{2}\right|^{-\frac{1}{2}}
\end{aligned}
$$

Moreover, if either $K_{1}^{1} \neq J^{1}$ or $K_{1}^{2} \neq J^{1}$, and either $K_{1}^{2} \neq J^{2}$ or $K_{2}^{2} \neq J^{2}$, then it is similar to case (i). Hence, by (5.24),

$$
\begin{aligned}
\left|\mathscr{G}_{I, J, K}^{\mathbf{K}}\right| & \leq \prod_{i=1}^{2} \mathscr{Q}_{i}\left(K_{1}^{i}, J^{i}, K_{2}^{i}\right)\left|K_{1}^{i}\right|^{-\frac{1}{2}}\left|J^{i}\right|^{-\frac{1}{2}}\left|K_{2}^{i}\right|^{-\frac{1}{2}} \\
& \lesssim \prod_{i=1}^{2}\left[\frac{\ell\left(K_{2}^{i}\right)}{\ell\left(Q^{i}\right)}\right]^{\frac{\delta_{i}}{2}} F_{i}\left(K_{2}^{i}, Q^{i}\right) \frac{\left|K_{1}^{i}\right|^{\frac{1}{2}}\left|J^{i}\right|^{\frac{1}{2}}\left|K_{2}^{i}\right|^{\frac{1}{2}}}{\left|Q^{i}\right|^{2}} \\
& \lesssim \prod_{i=1}^{2}\left[\frac{\ell\left(K^{i}\right)}{\ell\left(Q^{i}\right)}\right]^{\frac{\delta_{i}}{2}} F_{i}\left(K^{i}, Q^{i}\right) \frac{\left|I^{i}\right|^{\frac{1}{2}}\left|J^{i}\right|^{\frac{1}{2}}\left|K^{i}\right|^{\frac{1}{2}}}{\left|Q^{i}\right|^{2}}
\end{aligned}
$$

Accordingly, the desired inequality follows from these estimates above.
Set

$$
a_{I, J, K, Q}=\frac{\mathscr{G}_{I, J, K}}{C_{0} \prod_{i=1}^{2}\left[\ell\left(K^{i}\right) / \ell\left(Q^{i}\right)\right]^{\delta_{i} / 2}}
$$

if for each $i=1,2, I^{i}, J^{i} \in \mathcal{D}^{i}$ and $K^{i} \in \mathcal{D}_{\text {good }}^{i}$ with $\ell\left(K^{i}\right) \leq \ell\left(I^{i}\right)=2 \ell\left(J^{i}\right)$, satisfy $\max \left\{\mathrm{d}\left(K^{i}, I^{i}\right), \mathrm{d}\left(K^{i}, J^{i}\right)\right\} \leq 2 \ell\left(K^{i}\right)^{\gamma_{i}} \ell\left(J^{i}\right)^{1-\gamma_{i}}$, and either $K^{i} \cap I^{i}=\varnothing$ or $K^{i} \cap J^{i}=\varnothing$ or $K^{i}=I^{i}$, and otherwise set $a_{I, J, K, Q}=0$. Define

$$
\mathcal{F}(Q):=\mathcal{F}^{1}\left(Q^{1}\right) \mathcal{F}^{2}\left(Q^{2}\right), \quad \forall Q=Q^{1} \times Q^{2} \in \mathcal{D}^{1} \times \mathcal{D}^{2}=: \mathcal{D}
$$

By Lemma 5.22 and that $F^{i} \in \mathscr{F}^{i}$ and $\left(F_{1}^{i}, F_{2}^{i}, F_{3}^{i}\right) \in \mathscr{F}$, we see that (5.5) and (5.6) hold whenever $C_{0}$ is large enough. Thus, it follows from (5.21) that

$$
\begin{aligned}
& \mathscr{S}_{4}^{1}=\sum_{\substack{0 \leq i_{1} \leq k_{1} \leq \vartheta \\
0 \leq i_{2} \leq k_{2} \leq \vartheta}} \sum_{\substack{I^{1}, J^{1} \in \mathcal{D}^{1}, K^{1} \in \mathcal{D}_{\text {good }}^{1} \\
\max \left\{\mathrm{d}\left(K^{1}, J^{1}\right), \mathrm{d}\left(K^{1}, J^{1}\right)\right\} \leq 2 \ell\left(K^{1}\right)^{\gamma_{1}} \ell\left(J^{1}\right)^{1-\gamma_{1}}} K^{1} \cap I^{1}=\emptyset \text { or } K^{1} \cap J^{1}=\emptyset \text { or } K^{1}=I^{1}} \\
& \quad \frac{2 \ell\left(J^{1}\right)=\ell\left(I^{1}\right)=2^{-\gamma_{1}} \ell\left(Q^{1}\right)}{\ell\left(K^{1}\right)=2^{-k_{1}} \ell\left(Q^{1}\right), I^{1} \vee J^{1} \vee K^{1}=Q^{1}} \\
& \times \sum_{\substack{I^{2}, J^{2} \in \mathcal{D}^{2}, K^{2} \in \mathcal{D}_{\text {good }}^{2} \\
\max \left\{\mathrm{d}\left(K^{2}, J^{2}\right), \mathrm{d}\left(K^{2}, J^{2}\right)\right\} \leq 2 \ell\left(K^{2}\right)^{\gamma_{2}} \ell\left(J^{2}\right)^{1-\gamma_{2}}} K^{2} \cap I^{2}=\emptyset \text { or } K^{2} \cap J^{2}=\emptyset \text { or } K^{2}=I^{2}} \\
& \quad \frac{2 \ell\left(J^{2}\right)=\ell\left(I^{2}\right)=2^{-\gamma_{2}} \ell\left(Q^{2}\right)}{\ell\left(K^{2}\right)=2^{-k_{2}} \ell\left(Q^{2}\right), I^{2} \vee J^{2} \vee K^{2}=Q^{2}} \\
& =C_{0} \sum_{\substack{0 \leq i_{1} \leq k_{1} \leq \vartheta \\
0 \leq i_{2} \leq k_{2} \leq \vartheta}}^{0 \leq i_{1} \leq \vartheta} 2^{-k_{1} \frac{k_{2}}{2}} \sum_{Q^{1} \in \mathcal{D}^{1}}^{k_{1}} \sum_{\substack{I^{1} \in \mathcal{D}_{i_{1}}^{1}\left(Q^{1}\right) \\
Q^{2} \in \mathcal{D}^{2}} \sum_{\substack{I^{1} \in \mathcal{D}_{i_{1}}^{1}\left(Q^{1}\right) \\
J^{1} \in \mathcal{D}_{i_{1}+1}^{1}\left(Q^{1}\right) J^{2} \in \mathcal{D}_{i_{2}+1}^{2}\left(Q^{2}\right)}} a_{I, J, K, Q} f_{1}^{I} f_{2}^{J} f_{3}^{K} \\
& \quad K^{1} \in \mathcal{D}_{k_{1}}^{1}\left(Q^{1}\right) \quad K^{2} \in \mathcal{D}_{k_{2}}^{2}\left(Q^{2}\right) \\
& =C_{0} \sum_{k_{1}=0}^{\vartheta} \sum_{k_{2}=0}^{\vartheta} 2^{-k_{1} \frac{k_{1}}{2}} 2^{-k_{2} \frac{k_{2}}{2}} \sum_{i_{1}=0}^{k_{1}} \sum_{i_{2}=0}^{k_{2}}\left\langle\mathrm{~S}_{\mathcal{D}}^{\sigma(i, k)}\left(f_{1}, f_{2}\right), f_{3}\right\rangle
\end{aligned}
$$

where $\sigma(i, k):=\left(\left(i_{1}, i_{2}\right),\left(i_{1}+1, i_{2}+1\right),\left(k_{1}, k_{2}\right)\right)$.
5.7. Adjacent/Nested. In this case, denote $I^{2}:=\left(J^{2}\right)^{(1)}$. We perform the decomposition

$$
\mathscr{G}_{I, J, K}=\mathscr{G}_{I, J, K}^{1}+\mathscr{G}_{I, J, K}^{2}+\mathscr{G}_{I, J, K}^{3}
$$

where

$$
\begin{aligned}
& \mathscr{G}_{I, J, K}^{1}:=\left\langle h_{I^{2}}\right\rangle_{J^{2}}\left|J^{2}\right|^{-\frac{1}{2}}\left\langle T\left(h_{I^{1}} \otimes 1, h_{J^{1}}^{0} \otimes 1\right), h_{K^{1}} \otimes h_{K^{2}}\right\rangle, \\
& \mathscr{G}_{I, J, K}^{2}:=\left\langle h_{I^{2}}\right\rangle_{J^{2}}\left|J^{2}\right|^{-\frac{1}{2}}\left\langle T\left(h_{I^{1}} \otimes 1, h_{J^{1}}^{0} \otimes \mathbf{1}_{\left(J^{2}\right)^{c}}\right), h_{K^{1}} \otimes h_{K^{2}}\right\rangle, \\
& \mathscr{G}_{I, J, K}^{3}:=\left|J^{2}\right|^{-\frac{1}{2}}\left\langle T\left(h_{I^{1}} \otimes \phi_{J^{2}}, h_{J^{1}}^{0} \otimes \mathbf{1}_{J^{2}}\right), h_{K^{1}} \otimes h_{K^{2}}\right\rangle,
\end{aligned}
$$

where $\phi_{J^{2}}:=\mathbf{1}_{\left(J^{2}\right)^{c}}\left(h_{I^{2}}-\left\langle h_{I^{2}}\right\rangle_{J^{2}}\right)$. Define the summation $\mathscr{S}_{5, k}^{1}$ corresponding to $\mathscr{G}_{I, J, K}^{k}, k=1,2,3$.

- Partial paraproducts. We rewrite

$$
\begin{aligned}
& \mathscr{S}_{5,1}^{1}= \\
& \sum_{\substack{I^{1}, J^{1} \in \mathcal{D}^{1}, K^{1} \in \mathcal{D}_{\text {good }}^{1} \\
\ell\left(K^{1}\right) \leq \ell\left(I^{1}\right)=2 \ell\left(J^{1}\right) \\
\max \left\{\mathrm{d}\left(K^{1}, J^{1}\right), \mathrm{d}\left(K^{1}, J^{1}\right)\right\} \leq 2 \ell\left(K^{1}\right)^{\gamma_{1}} \ell\left(J^{1}\right)^{1-\gamma_{1}}} K^{1} \cap I^{1}=\emptyset \text { or } K^{1} \cap J^{1}=\emptyset \text { or } K^{1}=I^{1}} \\
& \times\left\langle T\left(h_{I^{1}} \otimes 1, h_{J^{1}}^{0} \otimes 1\right), h_{K^{1}} \otimes h_{K^{2}}\right\rangle\left\langle\left\langle f_{1}, h_{I^{1}}\right\rangle, h_{I^{2}}\right\rangle\left\langle\left\langle f_{2}, h_{J^{2}}^{0}\right\rangle\right\rangle_{J^{2}}\left\langle h_{I^{2}}\right\rangle_{J^{2}} .
\end{aligned}
$$

Much as above, from $\mathscr{S}^{2}$, we obtain the corresponding term

$$
\begin{aligned}
& \mathscr{S}_{5,1}^{2}=\sum_{\substack{I^{1}, J^{1} \in \mathcal{D}^{1}, K^{1} \in \mathcal{D}_{\text {good }}^{1} \\
\ell\left(K^{1}\right) \leq \ell\left(I^{1}\right)=2 \ell\left(J^{1}\right) \\
\max \left\{d\left(K^{1}, J^{1}\right), d\left(K^{1}, J^{1}\right)\right\} \leq 2 \ell\left(K^{1}\right)^{\gamma_{1}} \ell\left(J^{1}\right)^{1-\gamma_{1}}} \\
& \times\left\langle T\left(h_{I^{1}} \otimes 1, h_{J^{1}}^{0} \otimes 1\right), h_{K^{1}} \otimes h_{K^{2}}\right\rangle\left\langle\left\langle f_{1}, h_{I^{1}}\right\rangle\right\rangle_{I^{2}}\left\langle\left\langle f_{2}, h_{J^{1}}^{0}\right\rangle, h_{I^{2}}\right\rangle\left\langle h_{I^{2}}\right\rangle_{J^{2}} .
\end{aligned}
$$

Write $Q=Q^{1} \times Q^{2} \in \mathcal{D}^{1} \times \mathcal{D}^{2}=: \mathcal{D}$. Set

$$
a_{I^{1}, J^{1}, K^{1}, Q}=\frac{\left\langle T\left(h_{I^{1}} \otimes 1, h_{J^{1}}^{0} \otimes 1\right), h_{K^{1}} \otimes h_{Q^{2}}\right\rangle}{C_{0}\left[\ell\left(K^{1}\right) / \ell\left(Q^{1}\right)\right]^{\delta_{1} / 2}}
$$

if $I^{1}, J^{1} \in \mathcal{D}^{1}, K^{1} \in \mathcal{D}_{\text {good }}^{1}$, and $K^{2} \in \mathcal{D}_{\text {good }}^{2}$ satisfy $\ell\left(K^{1}\right) \leq \ell\left(I^{1}\right)=2 \ell\left(J^{1}\right)$, $\max \left\{\mathrm{d}\left(K^{1}, I^{1}\right), \mathrm{d}\left(K^{1}, J^{1}\right)\right\} \leq 2 \ell\left(K^{1}\right)^{\gamma_{1}} \ell\left(J^{1}\right)^{1-\gamma_{1}}$, and either $K^{1} \cap I^{1}=\emptyset$ or $K^{1} \cap J^{1}=$ $\varnothing$ or $K^{1}=I^{1}$, and otherwise set $a_{I^{1}, J^{1}, K^{1}, Q}=0$. As done in (5.16) with $\bar{h}_{Q^{2}}:=\frac{\mathbf{1}_{Q^{2}}}{\left|Q^{2}\right|}$, we have

$$
\begin{aligned}
\mathscr{S}_{5,1}^{1}+\mathscr{S}_{5,1}^{2}= & C_{0} \sum_{0 \leq i_{1} \leq k_{1} \leq \theta} 2^{-k_{1} \frac{\delta_{1}}{2}} \sum_{\substack{Q^{1} \in \mathcal{D}^{1} \\
Q^{2} \in \mathcal{D}^{2}}} \sum_{\substack{I^{1} \in \mathcal{D}_{i_{1}}^{1}\left(Q^{1}\right) \\
J^{1} \in \mathcal{D}_{k_{1}}^{1}\left(Q^{1}\right) \\
K^{1} \in \mathcal{D}_{k_{1}}^{1}\left(Q^{1}\right) \\
& \times\left\langle f_{1}, h_{I^{1}} \otimes \bar{h}_{Q^{2}}\right\rangle\left\langle f_{2}, h_{J^{1}}^{0} \otimes \bar{h}_{Q^{2}}\right\rangle\left\langle f_{3}, h_{K^{1}} \otimes h_{Q^{2}}\right\rangle \\
= & C_{0} \sum_{k_{1}=0}^{\vartheta} 2^{-k_{1} \frac{\delta_{1}}{2}} \sum_{i_{1}=0}^{k_{1}}\left\langle\mathbf{P}_{\mathcal{D}}^{1, i_{1}, i_{1}+1, k_{1}}\left(f_{1}, f_{2}\right), f_{3}\right\rangle
\end{aligned}
$$

Due to Lemma 4.18, $\mathbf{P}_{\mathcal{D}}^{1, i_{1}, i_{1}+1, k_{1}}$ is a partial paraproduct, where $\mathcal{F}^{1}\left(Q^{1}\right)$ is given in (5.23).

- Bilinear dyadic shifts. We then treat $\mathscr{S}_{5,2}^{1}$ and $\mathscr{S}_{5,3}^{1}$.

Lemma 5.27. For each $k=2,3$, there holds

$$
\left|\mathscr{G}_{I, J, K}^{k}\right| \lesssim\left[\frac{\ell\left(K^{1}\right)}{\ell\left(Q^{1}\right)}\right]^{\frac{\delta_{1}}{2}} \widetilde{F}^{1}\left(Q^{1}\right) \frac{\left|I^{1}\right|^{\frac{1}{2}}\left|J^{1}\right|^{\frac{1}{2}}\left|K^{1}\right|^{\frac{1}{2}}}{\left|Q^{1}\right|^{2}}\left[\frac{\ell\left(K^{2}\right)}{\ell\left(J^{2}\right)}\right]^{\frac{\delta_{2}}{2}} F^{2}\left(K^{2}, J^{2}\right) \frac{\left|K^{2}\right|^{\frac{1}{2}}}{\left|J^{2}\right|}
$$

where $\widetilde{F}^{1}$ and $F^{2}(\cdot, \cdot)$ are defined in (5.23) and (4.1) respectively.
Proof. We only focus on $\mathscr{G}_{I, J, K}^{2}$ because the estimate for $\mathscr{G}_{I, J, K}^{3}$ is similar. First, suppose $K^{1} \cap I^{1}=\varnothing$. In the case $\ell\left(J^{2}\right)>2^{\vartheta} \ell\left(K^{2}\right)$, splitting $1=\mathbf{1}_{3 K^{2}}+\mathbf{1}_{\left(3 K^{2}\right)^{c}}$, we have

$$
\mathscr{G}_{I, J, K}^{2}=\mathscr{G}_{I, J, K}^{2,1}+\mathscr{G}_{I, J, K}^{2,2}
$$

In view of (5.18) and Lemmas 4.5 and 4.6 applied to $\ell_{2}=\ell\left(K^{2}\right)^{\frac{1}{2}} \ell\left(J^{2}\right)^{\frac{1}{2}}$, we use the cancellation of $h_{K^{1}}$ and $h_{K^{2}}$, the compact full kernel representation (cf. (H1)), and

the mixed size-Hölder condition to arrive at

$$
\begin{aligned}
& \left|\mathscr{G}_{I, J, K}^{2, j}\right| \leq \mathscr{Q}_{1}\left(I^{1}, J^{1}, K^{1}\right) \mathscr{R}_{2}^{j}\left(J^{2}, K^{2}\right) \prod_{i=1}^{2}\left|I^{i}\right|^{-\frac{1}{2}}\left|J^{i}\right|^{-\frac{1}{2}}\left|K^{i}\right|^{-\frac{1}{2}} \\
& \lesssim\left[\frac{\ell\left(K^{1}\right)}{\ell\left(Q^{1}\right)}\right]^{\frac{\delta_{1}}{2}} F^{1}\left(K^{1}, Q^{1}\right) \frac{\left|I^{1}\right|^{\frac{1}{2}}\left|J^{1}\right|^{\frac{1}{2}}\left|K^{1}\right|^{\frac{1}{2}}}{\left|Q^{1}\right|^{2}}\left[\frac{\ell\left(K^{2}\right)}{\ell\left(J^{2}\right)}\right]^{\frac{\delta_{2}}{2}} F^{2}\left(J^{2}, K^{2}\right) \frac{\left|K^{2}\right|^{\frac{1}{2}}}{\left|J^{2}\right|}
\end{aligned}
$$

for each $j=1,2$.
To treat the case $\ell\left(J^{2}\right) \leq 2^{\vartheta} \ell\left(K^{2}\right)$, we split

$$
\begin{aligned}
\mathscr{G}_{I, J, K}^{2}= & \left\langle h_{I^{2}}\right\rangle_{J^{2}}\left|J^{2}\right|^{-\frac{1}{2}}\left\langle T\left(h_{I^{1}} \otimes \mathbf{1}_{3 K^{2}}, h_{J^{1}}^{0} \otimes \mathbf{1}_{3 J^{2} \backslash J^{2}}\right), h_{K^{1}} \otimes h_{K^{2}}\right\rangle \\
& +\left\langle h_{I^{2}}\right\rangle_{J^{2}}\left|J^{2}\right|^{-\frac{1}{2}}\left\langle T\left(h_{I^{1}} \otimes \mathbf{1}_{3 K^{2}}, h_{J^{1}}^{0} \otimes \mathbf{1}_{\left(3 J^{2}\right)^{c}}\right), h_{K^{1}} \otimes h_{K^{2}}\right\rangle \\
& +\left\langle h_{I^{2}}\right\rangle_{J^{2}}\left|J^{2}\right|^{-\frac{1}{2}}\left\langle T\left(h_{I^{1}} \otimes \mathbf{1}_{\left(3 K^{2}\right)^{c}}, h_{J^{1}}^{0} \otimes \mathbf{1}_{3 J^{2} \backslash J^{2}}\right), h_{K^{1}} \otimes h_{K^{2}}\right\rangle \\
& +\left\langle h_{I^{2}}\right\rangle_{J^{2}}\left|J^{2}\right|^{-\frac{1}{2}}\left\langle T\left(h_{I^{1}} \otimes \mathbf{1}_{\left(3 K^{2}\right)^{c}}, h_{J^{1}}^{0} \otimes \mathbf{1}_{\left(3 J^{2}\right)^{c}}\right), h_{K^{1}} \otimes h_{K^{2}}\right\rangle
\end{aligned}
$$

The first term is similar to $\mathscr{G}_{I, J, K}$ in the case $K^{2} \cap J^{2}=\varnothing$ in Section 5.6, which along with Lemma 5.22 yields the desired bound. The second and last terms are analogous to $\mathscr{G}_{I, J, K}^{2,1}$ and $\mathscr{G}_{I, J, K}^{2,2}$ respectively, but now $\ell_{2}=\ell\left(K^{2}\right)$. The third term is symmetric to the second one. Eventually, the last three terms are dominated by

$$
\left[\frac{\ell\left(K^{1}\right)}{\ell\left(Q^{1}\right)}\right]^{\frac{\delta_{1}}{2}} F_{1}\left(K^{1}, Q^{1}\right) \frac{\left|I^{1}\right|^{\frac{1}{2}}\left|J^{1}\right|^{\frac{1}{2}}\left|K^{1}\right|^{\frac{1}{2}}}{\left|Q^{1}\right|^{2}} F^{2}\left(J^{2}, K^{2}\right) \frac{\left|K^{2}\right|^{\frac{1}{2}}}{\left|J^{2}\right|}
$$

which together with $\ell\left(J^{2}\right) \simeq \ell\left(K^{2}\right)$ gives the estimate as desired.
Similarly, one can handle the case $K^{1} \cap J^{1}=\varnothing$.
Next, suppose $K^{1} \cap J^{1} \neq \varnothing$ and $K^{1}=I^{1}$. Obviously, $J^{1} \in \operatorname{ch}\left(K^{1}\right)$. Then we rewrite

$$
\mathscr{G}_{I, J, K}^{2}=\sum_{K_{1}^{1}, K_{2}^{1} \in \operatorname{ch}\left(K^{1}\right)} \mathscr{G}_{I, J, K}^{K_{1}^{1}, K_{2}^{1}}
$$

where

$$
\mathscr{G}_{I, J, K}^{K_{1}^{1}, K_{2}^{1}}:=\left\langle h_{I^{1}}\right\rangle_{K_{1}^{1}}\left\langle h_{I^{2}}\right\rangle_{J^{2}}\left|J^{1}\right|^{-\frac{1}{2}}\left|J^{2}\right|^{-\frac{1}{2}}\left\langle h_{K^{1}}\right\rangle_{K_{2}^{1}}\left\langle T\left(\mathbf{1}_{K_{1}^{1}} \otimes 1, \mathbf{1}_{J^{1}} \otimes \mathbf{1}_{\left(J^{2}\right)^{c}}\right), \mathbf{1}_{K_{2}^{1}} \otimes h_{K^{2}}\right\rangle
$$

In the case $\ell\left(J^{2}\right)>2^{\vartheta} \ell\left(K^{2}\right)$, we split $1=\mathbf{1}_{3 K^{2}}+\mathbf{1}_{\left(3 K^{2}\right)^{c}}$. If $K_{1}^{1}=J^{1}=K_{2}^{1}$, then the compact partial kernel representation (cf. (H2)) and Lemma 4.6 applied to $\ell_{2}=\ell\left(K^{2}\right)^{\frac{1}{2}} \ell\left(J^{2}\right)^{\frac{1}{2}}$ give

$$
\begin{aligned}
& \left|\mathscr{G}_{I, J, K}^{K_{1}^{1}, K_{2}^{1}}\right| \leq C\left(\mathbf{1}_{J^{1}}, \mathbf{1}_{J^{1}}, \mathbf{1}_{J^{1}}\right)\left[\left(\mathscr{R}_{2}^{1}+\mathscr{R}_{2}^{2}\right)\left(J^{2}, K^{2}\right)\right] \prod_{i=1}^{2}\left|I^{i}\right|^{-\frac{1}{2}}\left|J^{i}\right|^{-\frac{1}{2}}\left|K^{i}\right|^{-\frac{1}{2}} \\
& \lesssim\left[\frac{\ell\left(K^{1}\right)}{\ell\left(Q^{1}\right)}\right]^{\frac{\delta_{1}}{2}} F_{1}\left(J^{1}\right) \frac{\left|I^{1}\right|^{\frac{1}{2}}\left|J^{1}\right|^{\frac{1}{2}}\left|K^{1}\right|^{\frac{1}{2}}}{\left|Q^{1}\right|^{2}}\left[\frac{\ell\left(K^{2}\right)}{\ell\left(J^{2}\right)}\right]^{\frac{\delta_{2}}{2}} F^{2}\left(K^{2}, J^{2}\right) \frac{\left|K^{2}\right|^{\frac{1}{2}}}{\left|J^{2}\right|}
\end{aligned}
$$

provided that $\ell\left(I^{1}\right) \simeq \ell\left(J^{1}\right) \simeq \ell\left(K^{1}\right) \simeq \ell\left(Q^{1}\right)$. If $K_{1}^{1} \neq J^{1}$ or $K_{2}^{1} \neq J^{1}$, then the compact full kernel representation (cf. (H1)) and Lemmas 4.5 and 4.6 applied to

$\ell_{2}=\ell\left(K^{2}\right)^{\frac{1}{2}} \ell\left(J^{2}\right)^{\frac{1}{2}}$ give

$$
\begin{aligned}
& \left|\mathscr{G}_{I, J, K}^{K_{1}^{1}, K_{2}^{1}}\right| \leq \mathscr{Q}_{1}\left(K_{1}^{1}, J^{1}, K_{2}^{1}\right)\left[\left(\mathscr{R}_{2}^{1}+\mathscr{R}_{2}^{2}\right)\left(J^{2}, K^{2}\right)\right] \prod_{i=1}^{2}\left|I^{i}\right|^{-\frac{1}{2}}\left|J^{i}\right|^{-\frac{1}{2}}\left|K^{i}\right|^{-\frac{1}{2}} \\
& \lesssim\left[\frac{\ell\left(K_{2}^{1}\right)}{\ell\left(Q^{1}\right)}\right]^{\frac{\delta_{1}}{2}} F^{1}\left(K_{2}^{1}, Q^{1}\right) \frac{\left|K_{1}^{1}\right|^{\frac{1}{2}}\left|J^{1}\right|^{\frac{1}{2}}\left|K_{2}^{1}\right|^{\frac{1}{2}}}{\left|Q^{1}\right|^{2}}\left[\frac{\ell\left(K^{2}\right)}{\ell\left(J^{2}\right)}\right]^{\frac{\delta_{2}}{2}} F^{2}\left(K^{2}, J^{2}\right) \frac{\left|K^{2}\right|^{\frac{1}{2}}}{\left|J^{2}\right|} \\
& \lesssim\left[\frac{\ell\left(K^{1}\right)}{\ell\left(Q^{1}\right)}\right]^{\frac{\delta_{1}}{2}} F^{1}\left(K^{1}, Q^{1}\right) \frac{\left|I^{1}\right|^{\frac{1}{2}}\left|J^{1}\right|^{\frac{1}{2}}\left|K^{1}\right|^{\frac{1}{2}}}{\left|Q^{1}\right|^{2}}\left[\frac{\ell\left(K^{2}\right)}{\ell\left(J^{2}\right)}\right]^{\frac{\delta_{2}}{2}} F^{2}\left(K^{2}, J^{2}\right) \frac{\left|K^{2}\right|^{\frac{1}{2}}}{\left|J^{2}\right|}
\end{aligned}
$$

In the case $\ell\left(J^{2}\right) \leq 2^{\vartheta} \ell\left(K^{2}\right)$, using the decomposition as in (5.29) and the argument as in (5.30)-(5.31) with $\ell_{2}=\ell\left(K^{2}\right) \simeq \ell\left(J^{2}\right)$, we obtain the desired estimate.

Finally, note that $F^{1}\left(K^{1}, Q^{1}\right) \simeq F^{1}\left(Q^{1}, Q^{1}\right)$ due to $\ell\left(K^{1}\right) \simeq \ell\left(Q^{1}\right)$. Gathering all estimates above, we conclude the proof.

Note that $I^{2}=\left(J^{2}\right)^{(1)}$. Set $Q^{2}=I^{2}$ and

$$
a_{I, J, K, Q}=\frac{\mathscr{G}_{I, J, K}^{2}+\mathscr{G}_{I, J, K}^{3}}{C_{0} \prod_{i=1}^{2}\left[\ell\left(K^{i}\right) / \ell\left(Q^{i}\right)\right]^{\delta_{i} / 2}}
$$

if $I^{1}, J^{1} \in \mathcal{D}^{1}, K^{1} \in \mathcal{D}_{\text {good }}^{1}, J^{2} \in \mathcal{D}^{2}$, and $K^{2} \in \mathcal{D}_{\text {good }}^{2}$ satisfy $\ell\left(K^{1}\right) \leq \ell\left(I^{1}\right)=2 \ell\left(J^{1}\right)$, $\max \left\{\mathrm{d}\left(K^{1}, I^{1}\right), \mathrm{d}\left(K^{1}, J^{1}\right)\right\} \leq 2 \ell\left(K^{1}\right)^{\gamma_{1}} \ell\left(J^{1}\right)^{1-\gamma_{1}}$, either $K^{1} \cap I^{1}=\emptyset$ or $K^{1} \cap J^{1}=\varnothing$ or $K^{1}=I^{1}$, and $K^{2} \subset J^{2} \in \operatorname{ch}\left(Q^{2}\right)$, and otherwise set $a_{I, J, K, Q}=0$. Thus, (5.21) applied to $i=1$ gives

$$
\mathscr{S}_{5,2}^{1}+\mathscr{S}_{5,3}^{1}=C_{0} \sum_{\substack{0 \leq i_{1} \leq k_{1} \leq \vartheta \\ k_{2} \geq 1}} 2^{-k_{1} \frac{\delta_{1}}{2}} 2^{-k_{2} \frac{\delta_{2}}{2}} \sum_{\substack{Q^{1} \in \mathcal{D}^{1} \\ K^{2} \in \mathcal{D}_{k_{2}}^{2}\left(Q^{2}\right)}} a_{I, J, K, Q} f_{1}^{I} f_{2}^{J} f_{3}^{K}
$$

For each $k_{2} \in \mathbb{N}$, if we define

$$
\mathcal{F}(Q):=\widetilde{F}^{1}\left(Q^{1}\right) F_{1}^{2}\left(\ell\left(Q^{2}\right)\right) \widetilde{F}_{2}^{2}\left(2^{-k_{2}} \ell\left(Q^{2}\right)\right) \widetilde{F}_{3}^{2}\left(Q^{2}\right)
$$

for all $Q=Q^{1} \times Q^{2} \in \mathcal{D}^{1} \times \mathcal{D}^{2}=: \mathcal{D}$, then Lemma 5.27 and that $F^{i} \in \mathscr{F}^{i}$ and $\left(F_{1}^{i}, F_{2}^{i}, F_{3}^{i}\right) \in \mathscr{F}$ impliy (5.5) and (5.6) hold whenever $C_{0}$ is large enough. This leads to

$$
\mathscr{S}_{5,2}^{1}+\mathscr{S}_{5,3}^{1}=C_{0} \sum_{k_{1}=0}^{\vartheta} \sum_{k_{2}=1}^{\infty} 2^{-k_{1} \frac{\delta_{1}}{2}} 2^{-k_{2} \frac{\delta_{2}}{2}} \sum_{i_{1}=0}^{k_{1}}\left\langle\mathbf{S}_{\mathcal{D}}^{i, i+1, k}\left(f_{1}, f_{2}\right), f_{3}\right\rangle
$$

where $\sigma(i, k):=\left(\left(i_{1}, 0\right),\left(i_{1}+1,1\right),\left(k_{1}, k_{2}\right)\right)$.
5.8. Nested/Nested. Denote $I^{1}:=\left(J^{1}\right)^{(1)}$ and $I^{2}:=\left(J^{2}\right)^{(1)}$. Set $\phi_{J^{i}}:=\mathbf{1}_{\left(J^{i}\right)^{c}}\left(h_{I^{i}}-\right.$ $\left.\left\langle h_{I^{i}}\right\rangle_{J^{i}}\right), i=1,2$. Splitting $h_{I^{i}}=\left\langle h_{I^{i}}\right\rangle_{J^{i}}+\phi_{J^{i}}, i=1,2$, we obtain four terms, then for the terms containing $\left\langle h_{I^{i}}\right\rangle_{J^{i}}$, we split $\mathbf{1}_{J^{i}}=1-\mathbf{1}_{\left(J^{i}\right)^{c}}$. Thus,

$$
\mathscr{G}_{I, J, K}=\sum_{j=1}^{9} \mathscr{G}_{I, J, K}^{j}
$$

where

$$
\begin{aligned}
& \mathscr{G}_{I, J, K}^{1}:=\left|J^{1}\right|^{-\frac{1}{2}}\left|J^{2}\right|^{-\frac{1}{2}}\left\langle h_{I^{1}}\right\rangle_{J^{1}}\left\langle h_{I^{2}}\right\rangle_{J^{2}}\left\langle T(1,1), h_{K^{1}} \otimes h_{K^{2}}\right\rangle, \\
& \mathscr{G}_{I, J, K}^{2}:=-\left|J^{1}\right|^{-\frac{1}{2}}\left|J^{2}\right|^{-\frac{1}{2}}\left\langle h_{I^{1}}\right\rangle_{J^{1}}\left\langle h_{I^{2}}\right\rangle_{J^{2}}\left\langle T\left(1,1 \otimes \mathbf{1}_{\left(J^{2}\right)^{c}}\right), h_{K^{1}} \otimes h_{K^{2}}\right\rangle, \\
& \mathscr{G}_{I, J, K}^{3}:=-\left|J^{1}\right|^{-\frac{1}{2}}\left|J^{2}\right|^{-\frac{1}{2}}\left\langle h_{I^{1}}\right\rangle_{J^{1}}\left\langle h_{I^{2}}\right\rangle_{J^{2}}\left\langle T\left(1, \mathbf{1}_{\left(J^{1}\right)^{c}} \otimes 1\right), h_{K^{1}} \otimes h_{K^{2}}\right\rangle, \\
& \mathscr{G}_{I, J, K}^{4}:=\left|J^{1}\right|^{-\frac{1}{2}}\left|J^{2}\right|^{-\frac{1}{2}}\left\langle h_{I^{1}}\right\rangle_{J^{1}}\left\langle T\left(1 \otimes \phi_{J^{2}}, 1 \otimes \mathbf{1}_{J^{2}}\right), h_{K^{1}} \otimes h_{K^{2}}\right\rangle, \\
& \mathscr{G}_{I, J, K}^{5}:=\left|J^{1}\right|^{-\frac{1}{2}}\left|J^{2}\right|^{-\frac{1}{2}}\left\langle h_{I^{2}}\right\rangle_{J^{2}}\left\langle T\left(\phi_{J^{1}} \otimes 1, \mathbf{1}_{J^{1}} \otimes 1\right), h_{K^{1}} \otimes h_{K^{2}}\right\rangle, \\
& \mathscr{G}_{I, J, K}^{6}:=\left|J^{1}\right|^{-\frac{1}{2}}\left|J^{2}\right|^{-\frac{1}{2}}\left\langle h_{I^{1}}\right\rangle_{J^{1}}\left\langle h_{I^{2}}\right\rangle_{J^{2}}\left\langle T\left(1, \mathbf{1}_{\left(J^{1}\right)^{c}} \otimes \mathbf{1}_{\left(J^{2}\right)^{c}}\right), h_{K^{1}} \otimes h_{K^{2}}\right\rangle, \\
& \mathscr{G}_{I, J, K}^{7}:=-\left|J^{1}\right|^{-\frac{1}{2}}\left|J^{2}\right|^{-\frac{1}{2}}\left\langle h_{I^{1}}\right\rangle_{J^{1}}\left\langle T\left(1 \otimes \phi_{J^{2}}, \mathbf{1}_{\left(J^{1}\right)^{c}} \otimes \mathbf{1}_{J^{2}}\right), h_{K^{1}} \otimes h_{K^{2}}\right\rangle, \\
& \mathscr{G}_{I, J, K}^{8}:=-\left|J^{1}\right|^{-\frac{1}{2}}\left|J^{2}\right|^{-\frac{1}{2}}\left\langle h_{I^{2}}\right\rangle_{J^{2}}\left\langle T\left(\phi_{J^{1}} \otimes 1, \mathbf{1}_{J^{1}} \otimes \mathbf{1}_{\left(J^{2}\right)^{c}}\right), h_{K^{1}} \otimes h_{K^{2}}\right\rangle, \\
& \mathscr{G}_{I, J, K}^{9}:=\left|J^{1}\right|^{-\frac{1}{2}}\left|J^{2}\right|^{-\frac{1}{2}}\left\langle T\left(\phi_{J^{1}} \otimes \phi_{J^{2}}, \mathbf{1}_{J^{1}} \otimes \mathbf{1}_{J^{2}}\right), h_{K^{1}} \otimes h_{K^{2}}\right\rangle .
\end{aligned}
$$

We define the summation $\mathscr{S}_{6, j}^{1}$ corresponding to $\mathscr{G}_{I, J, K}^{j}, j=1, \ldots, 9$. We will see that $\mathscr{S}_{6,1}^{1}$ produces a full paraproduct; $\mathscr{S}_{6, j}^{1}, j=2,3,4,5$, give partial paraproducts; and $\mathscr{S}_{6, j}^{1}, j=6,7,8,9$, produce bilinear shifts.

- A full paraproduct. The same argument yields $\mathscr{S}_{6,1}^{k}$ from $\mathscr{S}^{k}, k=2,3,4$. More precisely,

$$
\begin{aligned}
& \mathscr{S}_{6,1}^{1}=\sum_{\substack{K^{1} \in \mathcal{D}_{\text {good }}^{1} \\
K^{2} \in \mathcal{D}_{\text {good }}^{2}}} \sum_{\substack{J^{1} \in \mathcal{D}^{1} \\
J^{1} \supset K^{1}}} \sum_{\substack{J^{2} \in \mathcal{D}^{2} \\
J^{2} \supset K^{2}}} \left\langle T(1,1), h_{K^{1}} \otimes h_{K^{2}}\right\rangle \\
& \times\left\langle h_{I^{1}}\right\rangle_{J^{1}}\left\langle h_{I^{2}}\right\rangle_{J^{2}}\left\langle f_{1}, h_{I^{1}} \otimes h_{I^{2}}\right\rangle\left\langle f_{2}\right\rangle_{J^{1} \times J^{2}}\left\langle f_{3}, h_{K^{1}} \otimes h_{K^{2}}\right\rangle, \\
& \mathscr{S}_{6,1}^{2}=\sum_{\substack{K^{1} \in \mathcal{D}_{\text {good }}^{1} \\
K^{2} \in \mathcal{D}_{\text {good }}^{2}}} \sum_{\substack{J^{1} \in \mathcal{D}^{1} \\
J^{1} \supset K^{1}}} \sum_{\substack{J^{2} \in \mathcal{D}^{2} \\
J^{2} \supset K^{2}}} \left\langle T(1,1), h_{K^{1}} \otimes h_{K^{2}}\right\rangle \\
& \times\left\langle h_{I^{1}}\right\rangle_{J^{1}}\left\langle h_{I^{2}}\right\rangle_{J^{2}}\left\langle\left\langle f_{1}, h_{I^{1}}\right\rangle\right\rangle_{J^{2}}\left\langle\left\langle f_{2}\right\rangle_{J^{1}}, h_{I^{2}}\right\rangle\left\langle f_{3}, h_{K^{1}} \otimes h_{K^{2}}\right\rangle, \\
& \mathscr{S}_{6,1}^{3}=\sum_{\substack{K^{1} \in \mathcal{D}_{\text {good }}^{1} \\
K^{2} \in \mathcal{D}_{\text {good }}^{2}}} \sum_{\substack{J^{1} \in \mathcal{D}^{1} \\
J^{1} \supset K^{1}}} \sum_{\substack{J^{2} \in \mathcal{D}^{2} \\
J^{2} \supset K^{2}}} \left\langle T(1,1), h_{K^{1}} \otimes h_{K^{2}}\right\rangle \\
& \times\left\langle h_{I^{1}}\right\rangle_{J^{1}}\left\langle h_{I^{2}}\right\rangle_{J^{2}}\left\langle\left\langle f_{1}\right\rangle_{I^{1}}, h_{I^{2}}\right\rangle\left\langle\left\langle f_{2}, h_{I^{1}}\right\rangle\right\rangle_{J^{2}}\left\langle f_{3}, h_{K^{1}} \otimes h_{K^{2}}\right\rangle, \\
& \mathscr{S}_{6,1}^{4}=\sum_{\substack{K^{1} \in \mathcal{D}_{\text {good }}^{1} \\
K^{2} \in \mathcal{D}_{\text {good }}^{2}}} \sum_{\substack{J^{1} \in \mathcal{D}^{1} \\
J^{1} \supset K^{1}}} \sum_{\substack{J^{2} \in \mathcal{D}^{2} \\
J^{2} \supset K^{2}}} \left\langle T(1,1), h_{K^{1}} \otimes h_{K^{2}}\right\rangle \\
& \times\left\langle h_{I^{1}}\right\rangle_{J^{1}}\left\langle h_{I^{2}}\right\rangle_{J^{2}}\left\langle f_{1}\right\rangle_{I^{1} \times I^{2}}\left\langle f_{2}, h_{I^{1}} \otimes h_{I^{2}}\right\rangle\left\langle f_{3}, h_{K^{1}} \otimes h_{K^{2}}\right\rangle .
\end{aligned}
$$

It follows from (5.15) that

$$
\begin{aligned}
\sum_{k=1}^{4} \mathscr{S}_{6,1}^{k}= & \left(\mathscr{S}_{6,1}^{1}+\mathscr{S}_{6,1}^{2}\right)+\left(\mathscr{S}_{6,1}^{3}+\mathscr{S}_{6,1}^{4}\right) \\
= & \sum_{\substack{K^{1} \in \mathcal{D}_{\text {good }}^{1} \\
K^{2} \in \mathcal{D}_{\text {good }}^{2}}} \sum_{\substack{J^{1} \in \mathcal{D}^{1} \\
J^{1} \supset K^{1}}} \sum_{\substack{J^{2} \in \mathcal{D}^{2} \\
J^{2} \supset K^{2}}} \left\langle T(1,1), h_{K^{1}} \otimes h_{K^{2}}\right\rangle\left\langle f_{3}, h_{K^{1}} \otimes h_{K^{2}}\right\rangle \\
& {\left[\left\langle h_{I^{1}}\right\rangle_{J^{1}}\left(\left\langle\left\langle f_{1}, h_{I^{1}}\right\rangle\right\rangle_{J^{2}}\left\langle\left\langle f_{2}\right\rangle_{J^{1}}\right\rangle_{J^{2}}-\left\langle\left\langle f_{1}, h_{I^{1}}\right\rangle\right\rangle_{I^{2}}\left\langle\left\langle f_{2}\right\rangle_{J^{1}}\right\rangle_{I^{2}}\right) } \\
& +\left\langle h_{I^{1}}\right\rangle_{J^{1}}\left(\left\langle\left\langle f_{1}\right\rangle_{I^{1}}\right\rangle_{J^{2}}\left\langle\left\langle f_{2}, h_{I^{1}}\right\rangle\right\rangle_{J^{2}}-\left\langle\left\langle f_{1}\right\rangle_{I^{1}}\right\rangle_{I^{2}}\left\langle\left\langle f_{2}, h_{I^{1}}\right\rangle\right\rangle_{I^{2}}\right)\right] \\
= & \sum_{\substack{K^{1} \in \mathcal{D}_{\text {good }}^{1} \\
K^{2} \in \mathcal{D}_{\text {good }}^{2}}} \sum_{\substack{J^{1} \in \mathcal{D}^{1} \\
J^{1} \supset K^{1}}} \sum_{\substack{J^{2} \in \mathcal{D}^{2} \\
J^{2} \supset K^{2}}} \left\langle T(1,1), h_{K^{1}} \otimes h_{K^{2}}\right\rangle\left\langle f_{3}, h_{K^{1}} \otimes h_{K^{2}}\right\rangle \\
& {\left[\left\langle h_{I^{1}}\right\rangle_{J^{1}}\left(\left\langle\left\langle f_{1}\right\rangle_{J^{2}}, h_{I^{1}}\right\rangle\left\langle\left\langle f_{2}\right\rangle_{J^{2}}\right\rangle_{J^{1}}+\left\langle\left\langle f_{1}\right\rangle_{J^{2}}\right\rangle_{I^{1}}\left\langle\left\langle f_{2}\right\rangle_{J^{2}}, h_{I^{1}}\right\rangle\right)\right.} \\
& \left.-\left\langle h_{I^{1}}\right\rangle_{J^{1}}\left(\left\langle\left\langle f_{1}\right\rangle_{I^{2}}, h_{I^{1}}\right\rangle\left\langle\left\langle f_{2}\right\rangle_{I^{2}}\right\rangle_{J^{1}}+\left\langle\left\langle f_{1}\right\rangle_{I^{2}}\right\rangle_{I^{1}}\left\langle\left\langle f_{2}\right\rangle_{I^{2}}, h_{I^{1}}\right\rangle\right)\right] \\
= & \sum_{\substack{K^{1} \in \mathcal{D}_{\text {good }}^{1} \\
K^{2} \in \mathcal{D}_{\text {good }}^{2}}} \sum_{\substack{J^{1} \in \mathcal{D}^{1} \\
J^{1} \supset K^{1}}} \sum_{\substack{J^{2} \in \mathcal{D}^{2} \\
J^{2} \supset K^{2}}} \left\langle T(1,1), h_{K^{1}} \otimes h_{K^{2}}\right\rangle\left\langle f_{3}, h_{K^{1}} \otimes h_{K^{2}}\right\rangle \\
& {\left[\left(\left\langle\left\langle f_{1}\right\rangle_{J^{2}}\right\rangle_{J^{1}}\left\langle\left\langle f_{2}\right\rangle_{J^{2}}\right\rangle_{J^{1}}-\left\langle\left\langle f_{1}\right\rangle_{J^{2}}\right\rangle_{I^{1}}\left\langle\left\langle f_{2}\right\rangle_{J^{2}}\right\rangle_{I^{1}}\right)} \\
& -\left(\left\langle\left\langle f_{1}\right\rangle_{I^{2}}\right\rangle_{J^{1}}\left\langle\left\langle f_{2}\right\rangle_{I^{2}}\right\rangle_{J^{1}}-\left\langle\left\langle f_{1}\right\rangle_{I^{2}}\right\rangle_{I^{1}}\left\langle\left\langle f_{2}\right\rangle_{I^{2}}\right\rangle_{I^{1}}\right)\right] \\
= & \sum_{\substack{K^{1} \in \mathcal{D}_{\text {good }}^{1} \\
K^{2} \in \mathcal{D}_{\text {good }}^{2}}} \sum_{\substack{J^{2} \in \mathcal{D}^{2} \\
J^{2} \supset K^{2}}} \left\langle T(1,1), h_{K^{1}} \otimes h_{K^{2}}\right\rangle\left\langle f_{3}, h_{K^{1}} \otimes h_{K^{2}}\right\rangle \\
& {\left[\left\langle\left\langle f_{1}\right\rangle_{J^{2}}\right\rangle_{K^{1}}\left\langle\left\langle f_{2}\right\rangle_{J^{2}}\right\rangle_{K^{1}}-\left\langle\left\langle f_{1}\right\rangle_{I^{2}}\right\rangle_{K^{1}}\left\langle\left\langle f_{2}\right\rangle_{I^{2}}\right\rangle_{K^{1}}\right]} \\
= & \sum_{\substack{K^{1} \in \mathcal{D}_{\text {good }}^{1} \\
K^{2} \in \mathcal{D}_{\text {good }}^{2}}} \left\langle T(1,1), h_{K^{1}} \otimes h_{K^{2}}\right\rangle\left\langle f_{1}\right\rangle_{K^{1} \times K^{2}}\left\langle f_{2}\right\rangle_{K^{1} \times K^{2}}\left\langle f_{3}, h_{K^{1}} \otimes h_{K^{2}}\right\rangle .
\end{aligned}
$$

Set

$$
a_{K}=C_{0}^{-1}\left\langle T(1,1), h_{K^{1}} \otimes h_{K^{2}}\right\rangle, \quad \text { if } K^{1} \in \mathcal{D}_{\text {good }}^{1} \text { and } K^{2} \in \mathcal{D}_{\text {good }}^{2}
$$

otherwise set $a_{K}=0$. The hypothesis (H5) says that $T(1,1) \in \operatorname{CMO}\left(\mathbb{R}^{n_{1}} \times \mathbb{R}^{n_{2}}\right)$, which implies

$$
\sup _{\mathcal{D}} \sup _{U} \frac{1}{|U|} \sum_{I \in \mathcal{D}: I \subset U}\left|a_{I}\right|^{2} \leq 1 \quad \text { and } \quad \lim _{N \rightarrow \infty} \sup _{\mathcal{D}} \sup _{U} \frac{1}{|U|} \sum_{I \notin \mathcal{D}(N): I \subset U}\left|a_{I}\right|^{2}=0
$$

provided $C_{0}>0$ large enough. Hence, we obtain a full paraproduct:

$$
\sum_{k=1}^{4} \mathscr{S}_{6,1}^{k}=C_{0}\left\langle\mathbf{F}_{\mathbf{a}}\left(f_{1}, f_{2}\right), f_{3}\right\rangle
$$

- Partial paraproducts. Since $\mathscr{S}_{6,3}^{1}$ and $\mathscr{S}_{6,5}^{1}$ are symmetrical to $\mathscr{S}_{6,2}^{1}$ and $\mathscr{S}_{6,4}^{1}$ respectively, we only deal with $\mathscr{S}_{6,2}^{1}$ and $\mathscr{S}_{6,4}^{1}$ :

$$
\begin{aligned}
& \mathscr{S}_{6,2}^{1}=-\sum_{\substack{K^{1} \in \mathcal{D}_{\text {good }}^{1} \\
K^{2} \in \mathcal{D}_{\text {good }}^{2}}} \sum_{\substack{J^{1} \in \mathcal{D}^{1} \\
J^{1} \supset K^{1}}} \sum_{\substack{J^{2} \in \mathcal{D}^{2} \\
J^{2} \supset K^{2}}} \left\langle T\left(1,1 \otimes \mathbf{1}_{\left(J^{2}\right)^{c}}\right), h_{K^{1}} \otimes h_{K^{2}}\right\rangle \\
& \times\left\langle h_{I^{1}}\right\rangle_{J^{1}}\left\langle h_{I^{2}}\right\rangle_{J^{2}}\left\langle\left\langle f_{1}, h_{I^{2}}\right\rangle, h_{I^{1}}\right\rangle\left\langle\left\langle f_{2}\right\rangle_{J^{2}}\right\rangle_{J^{1}}\left\langle f_{3}, h_{K^{1}} \otimes h_{K^{2}}\right\rangle, \\
& \mathscr{S}_{6,4}^{1}=\sum_{\substack{K^{1} \in \mathcal{D}_{\text {good }}^{1} \\
K^{2} \in \mathcal{D}_{\text {good }}^{2}}} \sum_{\substack{J^{1} \in \mathcal{D}^{1} \\
J^{1} \supset K^{1}}} \sum_{\substack{J^{2} \in \mathcal{D}^{2} \\
J^{2} \supset K^{2}}} \left\langle T\left(1 \otimes \phi_{J^{2}}, 1 \otimes \mathbf{1}_{J^{2}}\right), h_{K^{1}} \otimes h_{K^{2}}\right\rangle \\
& \times\left\langle h_{I^{1}}\right\rangle_{J^{1}}\left\langle\left\langle f_{1}, h_{I^{2}}\right\rangle, h_{I^{1}}\right\rangle\left\langle\left\langle f_{2}\right\rangle_{J^{2}}\right\rangle_{J^{1}}\left\langle f_{3}, h_{K^{1}} \otimes h_{K^{2}}\right\rangle .
\end{aligned}
$$

The summation $\mathscr{S}^{3}$ gives the corresponding terms

$$
\begin{aligned}
& \mathscr{S}_{6,2}^{3}=-\sum_{\substack{K^{1} \in \mathcal{D}_{\text {good }}^{1} \\
K^{2} \in \mathcal{D}_{\text {good }}^{2}}} \sum_{\substack{J^{1} \in \mathcal{D}^{1} \\
J^{1} \supset K^{1}}} \sum_{\substack{J^{2} \in \mathcal{D}^{2} \\
J^{2} \supset K^{2}}} \left\langle T\left(1,1 \otimes \mathbf{1}_{\left(J^{2}\right)^{c}}\right), h_{K^{1}} \otimes h_{K^{2}}\right\rangle \\
& \times\left\langle h_{I^{1}}\right\rangle_{J^{1}}\left\langle h_{I^{2}}\right\rangle_{J^{2}}\left\langle\left\langle f_{1}, h_{I^{2}}\right\rangle\right\rangle_{I^{1}}\left\langle\left\langle f_{2}\right\rangle_{J^{2}}, h_{I^{1}}\right\rangle\left\langle f_{3}, h_{K^{1}} \otimes h_{K^{2}}\right\rangle, \\
& \mathscr{S}_{6,4}^{3}=\sum_{\substack{K^{1} \in \mathcal{D}_{\text {good }}^{1} \\
K^{2} \in \mathcal{D}_{\text {good }}^{2}}} \sum_{\substack{J^{1} \in \mathcal{D}^{1} \\
J^{1} \supset K^{1}}} \sum_{\substack{J^{2} \in \mathcal{D}^{2} \\
J^{2} \supset K^{2}}} T\left(1 \otimes \phi_{J^{2}}, 1 \otimes \mathbf{1}_{J^{2}}\right), h_{K^{1}} \otimes h_{K^{2}}\rangle \\
& \times\left\langle h_{I^{1}}\right\rangle_{J^{1}}\left\langle\left\langle f_{1}, h_{I^{2}}\right\rangle\right\rangle_{I^{1}}\left\langle\left\langle f_{2}\right\rangle_{J^{2}}, h_{I^{1}}\right\rangle\left\langle f_{3}, h_{K^{1}} \otimes h_{K^{2}}\right\rangle .
\end{aligned}
$$

Then by (5.15),

$$
\begin{aligned}
\mathscr{S}_{6,2}^{1}+\mathscr{S}_{6,2}^{3}= & -\sum_{\substack{K^{1} \in \mathcal{D}_{\text {good }}^{1} \\
K^{2} \in \mathcal{D}_{\text {good }}^{2}}} \sum_{\substack{J^{2} \in \mathcal{D}^{2} \\
J^{2} \supset K^{2}}} \left\langle T\left(1,1 \otimes \mathbf{1}_{\left(J^{2}\right)^{c}}\right), h_{K^{1}} \otimes h_{K^{2}}\right\rangle \\
& \times\left\langle h_{I^{2}}\right\rangle_{J^{2}}\left\langle\left\langle f_{1}, h_{I^{2}}\right\rangle\right\rangle_{K^{1}}\left\langle\left\langle f_{2}\right\rangle_{J^{2}}\right\rangle_{K^{1}}\left\langle f_{3}, h_{K^{1}} \otimes h_{K^{2}}\right\rangle
\end{aligned}
$$

and

$$
\begin{aligned}
\mathscr{S}_{6,4}^{1}+\mathscr{S}_{6,4}^{3}= & \sum_{\substack{K^{1} \in \mathcal{D}_{\text {good }}^{1} \\
K^{2} \in \mathcal{D}_{\text {good }}^{2}}} \sum_{\substack{J^{2} \in \mathcal{D}^{2} \\
J^{2} \supset K^{2}}} T\left(1 \otimes \phi_{J^{2}}, 1 \otimes \mathbf{1}_{J^{2}}\right), h_{K^{1}} \otimes h_{K^{2}}\rangle \\
& \times\left\langle\left\langle f_{1}, h_{I^{2}}\right\rangle\right\rangle_{K^{1}}\left\langle\left\langle f_{2}\right\rangle_{J^{2}}\right\rangle_{K^{1}}\left\langle f_{3}, h_{K^{1}} \otimes h_{K^{2}}\right\rangle
\end{aligned}
$$

Recall that $I^{i}:=\left(J^{i}\right)^{(1)}, i=1,2$. Let $b_{K^{2}, Q}:=-\left\langle h_{\left(Q^{2}\right)^{(1)}}\right\rangle_{Q^{2}}\left\langle T\left(1,1 \otimes \mathbf{1}_{\left(Q^{2}\right)^{c}}\right), h_{Q^{1}} \otimes\right.$ $\left.h_{K^{2}}\right\rangle$ and then set

$$
a_{K^{2}, Q}=\frac{b_{K^{2}, Q}}{C_{0}\left[\ell\left(K^{2}\right) / \ell\left(Q^{2}\right)\right]^{d_{2} / 2}}
$$

if $K^{1} \in \mathcal{D}_{\text {good }}^{1}, Q^{2} \in \mathcal{D}^{2}$ and $K^{2} \in \mathcal{D}_{\text {good }}^{2}$ satisfy $K^{2} \subset Q^{2}$, and otherwise set $a_{K^{2}, Q}=0$. Thus, it follows from Lemma 4.19 that

$$
\begin{aligned}
\mathscr{S}_{6,2}^{1}+\mathscr{S}_{6,2}^{3}= & C_{0} \sum_{k_{2}=0}^{\infty} 2^{-k_{2} \frac{\delta_{2}}{2}} \sum_{\substack{Q^{1} \in \mathcal{D}^{1} \\
Q^{2} \in \mathcal{D}^{2}}} \sum_{K^{2} \in \mathcal{D}_{k_{2}}\left(Q^{2}\right)} a_{K^{2}, Q} \\
& \times\left\langle f_{1}, \bar{h}_{Q^{1}} \otimes h_{\left(Q^{2}\right)(1)}\right\rangle\left\langle f_{2}, \bar{h}_{Q^{1}} \otimes \bar{h}_{Q^{2}}\right\rangle\left\langle f_{3}, h_{Q^{1}} \otimes h_{K^{2}}\right\rangle \\
= & C_{0} \sum_{k_{2}=1}^{\infty} 2^{-k_{2} \frac{\delta_{2}}{2}}\left\langle\mathbf{P}_{\mathcal{D}}^{2,0,1, k_{2}}\left(f_{1}, f_{2}\right), f_{3}\right\rangle
\end{aligned}
$$

where

$$
\mathcal{F}^{2}\left(Q^{2}\right):=F_{1}^{2}\left(\ell\left(Q^{2}\right)\right) \widetilde{F}_{2}^{2}\left(2^{-k_{2}} \ell\left(Q^{2}\right)\right) \widetilde{F}_{3}^{2}\left(Q^{2}\right)
$$

Analogously, replacing $b_{K^{2}, Q}$ above by $b_{K^{2}, Q}:=T\left(1 \otimes \phi_{Q^{2}}, 1 \otimes \mathbf{1}_{Q^{2}}\right), h_{Q^{1}} \otimes h_{K^{2}}\rangle$, we invoke Lemma 4.29 to obtain the same partial paraproduct:

$$
\mathscr{S}_{6,4}^{1}+\mathscr{S}_{6,4}^{3}=C_{0} \sum_{k_{2}=1}^{\infty} 2^{-k_{2} \frac{\delta_{2}}{2}}\left\langle\mathbf{P}_{\mathcal{D}}^{2,0,1, k_{2}}\left(f_{1}, f_{2}\right), f_{3}\right\rangle
$$

- Bilinear dyadic shifts. We present the estimates below in order to analyze the remaining terms $\mathscr{S}_{j}^{1}, j=6,7,8,9$.

Lemma 5.32. For every $j=6,7,8,9$, there holds

$$
\left|\mathscr{G}_{I, J, K}^{j}\right| \lesssim \prod_{i=1}^{2}\left[\frac{\ell\left(K^{i}\right)}{\ell\left(J^{i}\right)}\right]^{\frac{\delta_{i}}{2}} F^{i}\left(K^{i}, J^{i}\right) \frac{\left|K^{i}\right|^{\frac{1}{2}}}{\left|J^{i}\right|}
$$

where $F^{i}$ is defined in (4.1).
Proof. We only consider the most difficult one $\mathscr{G}_{I, J, K}^{6}$. First, treat the case $\ell\left(J^{1}\right)>$ $2^{\theta} \ell\left(K^{1}\right)$ and $\ell\left(J^{2}\right)>2^{\theta} \ell\left(K^{2}\right)$. In view of that $1=\mathbf{1}_{3 K^{i}}+\mathbf{1}_{\left(3 K^{1}\right)^{c}}, i=1,2$, we split

$$
\mathscr{G}_{I, J, K}^{6}=\sum_{j=1}^{4} \mathscr{G}_{I, J, K}^{6, j}
$$

where

$$
\begin{aligned}
& \mathscr{G}_{I, J, K}^{6,1}:=\left|J^{1}\right|^{-\frac{1}{2}}\left|J^{2}\right|^{-\frac{1}{2}}\left\langle h_{I^{1}}\right\rangle_{J^{1}}\left\langle h_{I^{2}}\right\rangle_{J^{2}}\left\langle T\left(\mathbf{1}_{3 K^{1}} \otimes \mathbf{1}_{3 K^{2}}, \mathbf{1}_{\left(J^{1}\right)^{c}} \otimes \mathbf{1}_{\left(J^{2}\right)^{c}}\right), h_{K^{1}} \otimes h_{K^{2}}\right\rangle, \\
& \mathscr{G}_{I, J, K}^{6,2}:=\left|J^{1}\right|^{-\frac{1}{2}}\left|J^{2}\right|^{-\frac{1}{2}}\left\langle h_{I^{1}}\right\rangle_{J^{1}}\left\langle h_{I^{2}}\right\rangle_{J^{2}}\left\langle T\left(\mathbf{1}_{3 K^{1}} \otimes \mathbf{1}_{\left(3 K^{2}\right)^{c}}, \mathbf{1}_{\left(J^{1}\right)^{c}} \otimes \mathbf{1}_{\left(J^{2}\right)^{c}}\right), h_{K^{1}} \otimes h_{K^{2}}\right\rangle, \\
& \mathscr{G}_{I, J, K}^{6,3}:=\left|J^{1}\right|^{-\frac{1}{2}}\left|J^{2}\right|^{-\frac{1}{2}}\left\langle h_{I^{1}}\right\rangle_{J^{1}}\left\langle h_{I^{2}}\right\rangle_{J^{2}}\left\langle T\left(\mathbf{1}_{\left(3 K^{1}\right)^{c}} \otimes \mathbf{1}_{3 K^{2}}, \mathbf{1}_{\left(J^{1}\right)^{c}} \otimes \mathbf{1}_{\left(J^{2}\right)^{c}}\right), h_{K^{1}} \otimes h_{K^{2}}\right\rangle, \\
& \mathscr{G}_{I, J, K}^{6,4}:=\left|J^{1}\right|^{-\frac{1}{2}}\left|J^{2}\right|^{-\frac{1}{2}}\left\langle h_{I^{1}}\right\rangle_{J^{1}}\left\langle h_{I^{2}}\right\rangle_{J^{2}}\left\langle T\left(\mathbf{1}_{\left(3 K^{1}\right)^{c}} \otimes \mathbf{1}_{\left(3 K^{2}\right)^{c}}, \mathbf{1}_{\left(J^{1}\right)^{c}} \otimes \mathbf{1}_{\left(J^{2}\right)^{c}}\right), h_{K^{1}} \otimes h_{K^{2}}\right\rangle .
\end{aligned}
$$

Recall the goodness of $K^{i}$ and the estimate (5.18). Then by the compact full kernel representation (cf. (H1)), the Hölder condition, and Lemma 4.6 applied to $\ell_{i}=$

$\ell\left(K^{i}\right)^{\frac{1}{2}} \ell\left(J^{i}\right)^{\frac{1}{2}}$, there holds

$$
\begin{aligned}
\mathscr{G}_{I, J, K}^{6,1} & \leq \prod_{i=1}^{2} \mathscr{R}_{i}^{1}\left(J^{i}, K^{i}\right)\left|I^{i}\right|^{-\frac{1}{2}}\left|J^{i}\right|^{-\frac{1}{2}}\left|K^{i}\right|^{-\frac{1}{2}} \\
& \lesssim \prod_{i=1}^{2}\left[\frac{\ell\left(K^{i}\right)}{\ell\left(J^{i}\right)}\right]^{\frac{4}{2}} F^{i}\left(K^{i}, J^{i}\right) \frac{\left|K^{i}\right|^{\frac{1}{2}}}{\left|J^{i}\right|}
\end{aligned}
$$

Replacing $\mathscr{R}_{i}^{1}$ in (5.34) by $\mathscr{R}_{i}^{i}$ and $\mathscr{R}_{i}^{2}$ respectively, we obtain

$$
\left|\mathscr{G}_{I, J, K}^{6,2}\right|+\left|\mathscr{G}_{I, J, K}^{6,4}\right| \lesssim \prod_{i=1}^{2}\left[\frac{\ell\left(K^{i}\right)}{\ell\left(J^{i}\right)}\right]^{\frac{3}{2}} F^{i}\left(K^{i}, J^{i}\right) \frac{\left|K^{i}\right|^{\frac{1}{2}}}{\left|J^{i}\right|}
$$

Symmetrically to $\mathscr{G}_{6,2}$, one has

$$
\left|\mathscr{G}_{I, J, K}^{6,3}\right| \lesssim \prod_{i=1}^{2}\left[\frac{\ell\left(K^{i}\right)}{\ell\left(J^{i}\right)}\right]^{\frac{3}{2}} F^{i}\left(K^{i}, J^{i}\right) \frac{\left|K^{i}\right|^{\frac{1}{2}}}{\left|J^{i}\right|}
$$

Next, in the case $\ell\left(J^{1}\right)>2^{\vartheta} \ell\left(K^{1}\right)$ and $\ell\left(J^{2}\right) \leq 2^{\vartheta} \ell\left(K^{2}\right)$, as seen above, it suffices to consider $\mathscr{G}_{I, J, K}^{6,1}$. The fact $\mathbf{1}_{\left(J^{2}\right)^{c}}=\mathbf{1}_{3 J^{2} \backslash J^{2}}+\mathbf{1}_{\left(3 J^{2}\right)^{c}}$ allows us to write

$$
\mathscr{G}_{I, J, K}^{6,1}=\mathscr{G}_{I, J, K}^{6,1,1}+\mathscr{G}_{I, J, K}^{6,1,2}
$$

where

$$
\begin{aligned}
\mathscr{G}_{I, J, K}^{6,1,1} & :=\left|J^{1}\right|^{-\frac{1}{2}}\left|J^{2}\right|^{-\frac{1}{2}}\left\langle h_{I^{1}}\right\rangle_{J^{1}}\left\langle h_{I^{2}}\right\rangle_{J^{2}}\left\langle T\left(\mathbf{1}_{3 K^{1}} \otimes \mathbf{1}_{3 K^{2}}, \mathbf{1}_{\left(J^{1}\right)^{c}} \otimes \mathbf{1}_{3 J^{2} \backslash J^{2}}\right), h_{K^{1}} \otimes h_{K^{2}}\right\rangle \\
\mathscr{G}_{I, J, K}^{6,1,2} & :=\left|J^{1}\right|^{-\frac{1}{2}}\left|J^{2}\right|^{-\frac{1}{2}}\left\langle h_{I^{1}}\right\rangle_{J^{1}}\left\langle h_{I^{2}}\right\rangle_{J^{2}}\left\langle T\left(\mathbf{1}_{3 K^{1}} \otimes \mathbf{1}_{3 K^{2}}, \mathbf{1}_{\left(J^{1}\right)^{c}} \otimes \mathbf{1}_{\left(3 J^{2}\right)^{c}}\right), h_{K^{1}} \otimes h_{K^{2}}\right\rangle
\end{aligned}
$$

From the compact full kernel representation, the mixed size-Hölder condition, Lemmas 4.5 and 4.6 applied to $\ell_{1}=\ell\left(K^{1}\right)^{\frac{1}{2}} \ell\left(J^{1}\right)^{\frac{1}{2}}$, it follows that

$$
\begin{aligned}
\left|\mathscr{G}_{I, J, K}^{6,1,1}\right| & \leq \mathscr{R}_{1}^{1}\left(J^{1}, K^{1}\right) \sum_{j=0}^{3^{n} 2}-1 \sum_{k=1}^{3^{n} 2}-1 \mathscr{Q}_{2}\left(K_{j}^{2}, J_{k}^{2}, K^{2}\right) \prod_{i=1}^{2}\left|I^{i}\right|^{-\frac{1}{2}}\left|J^{i}\right|^{-\frac{1}{2}}\left|K^{i}\right|^{-\frac{1}{2}} \\
& \lesssim \prod_{i=1}^{2}\left[\frac{\ell\left(K^{i}\right)}{\ell\left(J^{i}\right)}\right]^{\frac{4}{2}} F^{i}\left(K^{i}, J^{i}\right) \frac{\left|K^{i}\right|^{\frac{1}{2}}}{\left|J^{i}\right|}
\end{aligned}
$$

Moreover, using the compact full kernel representation, the Hölder condition, and Lemma 4.6 applied to $\ell_{1}=\ell\left(K^{1}\right)^{\frac{1}{2}} \ell\left(J^{1}\right)^{\frac{1}{2}}$ and $\ell_{2}=\ell\left(K^{2}\right)$, we have

$$
\begin{aligned}
\left|\mathscr{G}_{I, J, K}^{6,1,2}\right| & \leq \mathscr{R}_{1}^{1}\left(J^{1}, K^{1}\right) \mathscr{R}_{2}^{1}\left(3 J^{2}, K^{2}\right) \prod_{i=1}^{2}\left|I^{i}\right|^{-\frac{1}{2}}\left|J^{i}\right|^{-\frac{1}{2}}\left|K^{i}\right|^{-\frac{1}{2}} \\
& \lesssim \prod_{i=1}^{2}\left[\frac{\ell\left(K^{i}\right)}{\ell\left(J^{i}\right)}\right]^{\frac{4}{2}} F^{i}\left(K^{i}, J^{i}\right) \frac{\left|K^{i}\right|^{\frac{1}{2}}}{\left|J^{i}\right|}
\end{aligned}
$$

Symmetrically, one can handle the case $\ell\left(J^{1}\right) \leq 2^{\vartheta} \ell\left(K^{1}\right)$ and $\ell\left(J^{2}\right)>2^{\vartheta} \ell\left(K^{2}\right)$.

Finally, to deal with the case $\ell\left(J^{1}\right) \leq 2^{\theta} \ell\left(K^{1}\right)$ and $\ell\left(J^{2}\right) \leq 2^{\theta} \ell\left(K^{2}\right)$, by similarly, it is enough to treat $\mathscr{G}_{I, J, K}^{6,1}$. In light of (5.37) and $\mathbf{1}_{\left(J^{1}\right)^{c}}=\mathbf{1}_{3 J^{1} \backslash J^{1}}+\mathbf{1}_{\left(3 J^{1}\right)^{c}}$, we further split $\mathscr{G}_{I, J, K}^{6,1,1}$ and $\mathscr{G}_{I, J, K}^{6,1,2}$ as

$$
\mathscr{G}_{I, J, K}^{6,1,1}=\mathscr{G}_{I, J, K}^{6,1,1,1}+\mathscr{G}_{I, J, K}^{6,1,1,2} \quad \text { and } \quad \mathscr{G}_{I, J, K}^{6,1,2}=\mathscr{G}_{I, J, K}^{6,1,2,1}+\mathscr{G}_{I, J, K}^{6,1,2,2}
$$

where

$$
\begin{aligned}
& \mathscr{G}_{I, J, K}^{6,1,1}:=\left|J^{1}\right|^{-\frac{1}{2}}\left|J^{2}\right|^{-\frac{1}{2}}\left\langle h_{I^{1}}\right\rangle_{J^{1}}\left\langle h_{I^{2}}\right\rangle_{J^{2}}\left\langle T\left(\mathbf{1}_{3 K^{1}} \otimes \mathbf{1}_{3 K^{2}}, \mathbf{1}_{3 J^{1} \backslash J^{1}} \otimes \mathbf{1}_{3 J^{2} \backslash J^{2}}\right), h_{K^{1}} \otimes h_{K^{2}}\right\rangle, \\
& \mathscr{G}_{I, J, K}^{6,1,1,2}:=\left|J^{1}\right|^{-\frac{1}{2}}\left|J^{2}\right|^{-\frac{1}{2}}\left\langle h_{I^{1}}\right\rangle_{J^{1}}\left\langle h_{I^{2}}\right\rangle_{J^{2}}\left\langle T\left(\mathbf{1}_{3 K^{1}} \otimes \mathbf{1}_{3 K^{2}}, \mathbf{1}_{\left(3 J^{1}\right)^{c}} \otimes \mathbf{1}_{3 J^{2} \backslash J^{2}}\right), h_{K^{1}} \otimes h_{K^{2}}\right\rangle, \\
& \mathscr{G}_{I, J, K}^{6,1,2,1}:=\left|J^{1}\right|^{-\frac{1}{2}}\left|J^{2}\right|^{-\frac{1}{2}}\left\langle h_{I^{1}}\right\rangle_{J^{1}}\left\langle h_{I^{2}}\right\rangle_{J^{2}}\left\langle T\left(\mathbf{1}_{3 K^{1}} \otimes \mathbf{1}_{3 K^{2}}, \mathbf{1}_{\left(3 J^{1}\right)^{c}} \otimes \mathbf{1}_{\left(3 J^{2}\right)^{c}}\right), h_{K^{1}} \otimes h_{K^{2}}\right\rangle, \\
& \mathscr{G}_{I, J, K}^{6,1,2,2}:=\left|J^{1}\right|^{-\frac{1}{2}}\left|J^{2}\right|^{-\frac{1}{2}}\left\langle h_{I^{1}}\right\rangle_{J^{1}}\left\langle h_{I^{2}}\right\rangle_{J^{2}}\left\langle T\left(\mathbf{1}_{3 K^{1}} \otimes \mathbf{1}_{3 K^{2}}, \mathbf{1}_{\left(3 J^{1}\right)^{c}} \otimes \mathbf{1}_{\left(3 J^{2}\right)^{c}}\right), h_{K^{1}} \otimes h_{K^{2}}\right\rangle .
\end{aligned}
$$

Lemma 4.5, along with the compact full kernel representation and the size condition, gives

$$
\begin{aligned}
\left|\mathscr{G}_{I, J, K}^{6,1,1,1}\right| & \leq \prod_{i=1}^{2} \sum_{j=0}^{3^{n_{i}}-1} \sum_{k=1}^{3^{n_{i}}-1} \mathscr{Q}_{i}\left(K_{j}^{i}, J_{k}^{i}, K^{i}\right)\left|I^{i}\right|^{-\frac{1}{2}}\left|J^{i}\right|^{-\frac{1}{2}}\left|K^{i}\right|^{-\frac{1}{2}} \\
& \lesssim \prod_{i=1}^{2}\left[\frac{\ell\left(K^{i}\right)}{\ell\left(J^{i}\right)}\right]^{\frac{\delta_{i}}{2}} F^{i}\left(K^{i}, J^{i}\right) \frac{\left|K^{i}\right|^{\frac{1}{2}}}{\left|J^{i}\right|}
\end{aligned}
$$

In light of the compact full kernel representation and the mixed size-Hölder condition, Lemmas 4.5 and 4.6 applied to $\ell_{1}=\ell\left(K^{1}\right)$ imply

$$
\begin{aligned}
\left|\mathscr{G}_{I, J, K}^{6,1,1,2}\right| & \leq \mathscr{R}_{1}^{1}\left(3 J^{1}, K^{1}\right) \sum_{j=0}^{3^{n_{2}}-1} \sum_{k=1}^{3^{n_{2}}-1} \mathscr{Q}_{2}\left(K_{j}^{2}, J_{k}^{2}, K^{2}\right) \prod_{i=1}^{2}\left|I^{i}\right|^{-\frac{1}{2}}\left|J^{i}\right|^{-\frac{1}{2}}\left|K^{i}\right|^{-\frac{1}{2}} \\
& \lesssim F^{1}\left(K^{1}, J^{1}\right)\left|K^{1}\right|^{-\frac{1}{2}}\left[\frac{\ell\left(K^{2}\right)}{\ell\left(J^{2}\right)}\right]^{\frac{\delta_{2}}{2}} F^{2}\left(K^{2}, J^{2}\right) \frac{\left|K^{2}\right|^{\frac{1}{2}}}{\left|J^{2}\right|} \\
& \lesssim \prod_{i=1}^{2}\left[\frac{\ell\left(K^{i}\right)}{\ell\left(J^{i}\right)}\right]^{\frac{\delta_{i}}{2}} F^{i}\left(K^{i}, J^{i}\right) \frac{\left|K^{i}\right|^{\frac{1}{2}}}{\left|J^{i}\right|}
\end{aligned}
$$

Symmetrically,

$$
\left|\mathscr{G}_{I, J, K}^{6,1,2,1}\right| \lesssim \prod_{i=1}^{2}\left[\frac{\ell\left(K^{i}\right)}{\ell\left(J^{i}\right)}\right]^{\frac{\delta_{i}}{2}} F^{i}\left(K^{i}, J^{i}\right) \frac{\left|K^{i}\right|^{\frac{1}{2}}}{\left|J^{i}\right|}
$$

Additionally, invoking the compact full kernel representation, the Hölder condition, and Lemma 4.6 applied to $\ell_{1}=\ell\left(K^{1}\right)$ and $\ell_{2}=\ell\left(K^{2}\right)$, we arrive at

$$
\begin{aligned}
\left|\mathscr{G}_{I, J, K}^{6,1,2,2}\right| & \leq \prod_{i=1}^{2} \mathscr{R}_{i}^{1}\left(3 J^{i}, K^{i}\right)\left|I^{i}\right|^{-\frac{1}{2}}\left|J^{i}\right|^{-\frac{1}{2}}\left|K^{i}\right|^{-\frac{1}{2}} \\
& \lesssim \prod_{i=1}^{2} F^{i}\left(K^{i}, J^{i}\right)\left|K^{i}\right|^{-\frac{1}{2}} \lesssim \prod_{i=1}^{2}\left[\frac{\ell\left(K^{i}\right)}{\ell\left(J^{i}\right)}\right]^{\frac{\delta_{i}}{2}} F^{i}\left(K^{i}, J^{i}\right) \frac{\left|K^{i}\right|^{\frac{1}{2}}}{\left|J^{i}\right|}
\end{aligned}
$$

The desired estimate for $\mathscr{G}_{I, J, K}^{6}$ is a consequence of (5.33)-(5.44).
Now set

$$
a_{K, J}=\frac{\sum_{j=0}^{9} \mathscr{G}_{I, J, K}^{j}}{C_{0} \prod_{i=1}^{2}\left[\ell\left(K^{i}\right) / \ell\left(J^{i}\right)\right]^{b_{i} / 2}}
$$

if $J^{i} \in \mathcal{D}^{i}$ and $K^{i} \in \mathcal{D}_{\text {good }}^{i}$ satisfy $K^{i} \subset J^{i}$ for each $i=1,2$, and otherwise set $a_{K, J}=0$. If we define $\mathcal{F}(Q)$ as in (5.4), then Lemma 5.32 implies (5.5) and (5.6) hold whenever $C_{0}$ is large. Consequently, we conclude

$$
\begin{aligned}
\sum_{j=6}^{9} \mathscr{S}_{6, j}^{1}= & C_{0} \sum_{k_{1}=0}^{\infty} \sum_{k_{2}=0}^{\infty} 2^{-k_{1} \frac{k_{2}}{2}} 2^{-k_{2} \frac{k_{3}}{2}} \sum_{\substack{Q^{1} \in \mathcal{D}^{1} \\
Q^{2} \in \mathcal{D}^{2}}} \sum_{K^{1} \in \mathcal{D}_{k_{1}}\left(Q^{1}\right)} a_{K, Q} \\
& \times\left\langle f_{1}, h_{\left(Q^{1}\right)(1)} \otimes h_{\left(Q^{2}\right)(1)}\right\rangle\left\langle f_{2}, h_{Q^{1}}^{0} \otimes h_{Q^{2}}^{0}\right\rangle\left\langle f_{3}, h_{K^{1}} \otimes h_{K^{2}}\right\rangle \\
= & C_{0} \sum_{k_{1}=1}^{\infty} \sum_{k_{2}=1}^{\infty} 2^{-k_{1} \frac{k_{2}}{2}} 2^{-k_{2} \frac{k_{3}}{2}}\left\langle\mathbf{S}_{\mathcal{D}}^{\sigma(k)}\left(f_{1}, f_{2}\right), f_{3}\right\rangle
\end{aligned}
$$

where $\sigma(k)=\left((0,0),(1,1),\left(k_{1}, k_{2}\right)\right)$.

# 6. Weighted COMPACTNESS OF DyAdic OPERATORS 

The goal of this section is to show Theorem 1.5, for which we have to first give characterizations of compactness in the bi-parameter setting.
6.1. Compactness criterions. Let $\tau_{v}$ be the translation operator, i.e., $\tau_{v} f(x):=$ $f(x-v)$ for all $x, v \in \mathbb{R}^{n_{1}} \times \mathbb{R}^{n_{2}}$.
Theorem 6.1. Let $w \in A_{p_{0}}\left(\mathbb{R}^{n_{1}} \times \mathbb{R}^{n_{2}}\right)$ for some $p_{0} \in(1, \infty)$. Let $0<p<\infty$ and $\mathcal{K} \subseteq L^{p}(w)$. Let $0<a<\min \left\{p / p_{0}, 1\right\}$. Then $\mathcal{K}$ is precompact in $L^{p}(w)$ if and only if the following are satisfied:
(a) $\sup _{f \in \mathcal{K}}\|f\|_{L^{p}(w)}<\infty$,
(b) $\lim _{A \rightarrow \infty} \sup _{f \in \mathcal{K}}\left\|f \mathbf{1}_{B_{S}(0, A)^{c}}\right\|_{L^{p}(w)}=0$,
(c) $\lim _{r \rightarrow 0} \sup _{f \in \mathcal{K}}\left\|\left(\oint_{B_{S}(0, r)}\left|\tau_{y} f-f\right|^{a} d y\right)^{\frac{1}{a}}\right\|_{L^{p}(w)}=0$.

Proof. The proof is similar to that of [4, Theorem 1.5]. As argued there, by means of a rescaling argument, the core of the proof is Theorem 6.2 below.
Theorem 6.2. Let $p \in(1, \infty), w \in A_{p}\left(\mathbb{R}^{n_{1}} \times \mathbb{R}^{n_{2}}\right)$, and $\mathcal{K} \subset L^{p}(w)$. Then $\mathcal{K}$ is precompact in $L^{p}(w)$ if and only if the following are satisfied:
(a) $\sup _{f \in \mathcal{K}}\|f\|_{L^{p}(w)}<\infty$,

(b) $\lim _{A \rightarrow \infty} \sup _{f \in \mathcal{K}}\left\|f \mathbf{1}_{B_{d}(0, A)^{c}}\right\|_{L^{p}(w)}=0$,
(c) ${ }^{\prime} \lim _{r \rightarrow 0} \sup _{f \in \mathcal{K}}\left\|f-\langle f\rangle_{B_{d}(\cdot, r)}\right\|_{L^{p}(w)}=0$.

Proof. This can be shown as [4, Theorem 4.1] together with the weighted boundedness of strong maximal operators (cf. [20, p. 453]).

Besides, in the unweighted case, the following gives a slightly different characterization of precompactness, which contains quasi-Banach exponents.

Theorem 6.3. Let $p \in(0, \infty)$ and $\mathcal{K} \subset L^{p}\left(\mathbb{R}^{n_{1}} \times \mathbb{R}^{n_{2}}\right)$. Then $\mathcal{K}$ is precompact in $L^{p}\left(\mathbb{R}^{n_{1}} \times \mathbb{R}^{n_{2}}\right)$ if and only if the following are satisfied:
(a) $\sup _{f \in \mathcal{K}}\|f\|_{L^{p}}<\infty$,
(b) $\lim _{A \rightarrow \infty} \sup _{f \in \mathcal{K}}\left\|f \mathbf{1}_{B_{d}(0, A)^{c}}\right\|_{L^{p}}=0$,
(c) ${ }^{\prime \prime} \lim _{\mid v \mid \rightarrow 0} \sup _{f \in \mathcal{K}}\left\|\tau_{v} f-f\right\|_{L^{p}}=0$.

Proof. The proof is almost the same as that of [4, Theorem 1.3].
In terms of quasi-Banach exponents, we present a variation of Theorem 6.1.
Theorem 6.4. Let $w \in A_{p_{0}}\left(\mathbb{R}^{n_{1}} \times \mathbb{R}^{n_{2}}\right)$ for some $p_{0} \in(1, \infty)$. Let $p \in(0, \infty)$, $\mathcal{K} \subseteq L^{p}(w)$, and $0<a \leq p / p_{0}$. If $\mathcal{K}$ is precompact in $L^{p}(w)$, then the following hold:
(a) $\sup _{f \in \mathcal{K}}\|f\|_{L^{p}(w)}<\infty$,
(b) $\lim _{A \rightarrow \infty} \sup _{f \in \mathcal{K}}\left\|f \mathbf{1}_{B_{d}(0, A)^{c}}\right\|_{L^{p}(w)}=0$,
(c) ${ }^{\prime \prime \prime} \lim _{r \rightarrow 0} \sup _{f \in \mathcal{K}}\left\|\left[\oint_{B_{d}(0, r)}\left|\left(\tau_{y}-\tau_{y_{1}}-\tau_{y_{2}}+I\right) f\right|^{a} d y\right]^{\frac{1}{a}}\right\|_{L^{p}(w)}=0$.

Proof. Suppose that $\mathcal{K}$ is precompact in $L^{p}(w)$. Then $\mathcal{K}$ is totally bounded. Given $\varepsilon>0$, there exists a finite number of functions $\left\{f_{k}\right\}_{k=1}^{N} \subset \mathcal{K}$ such that

$$
\mathcal{K} \subseteq \bigcup_{k=1}^{N}\left\{f \in L^{p}(w):\left\|f-f_{k}\right\|_{L^{p}(w)}<\varepsilon\right\}
$$

Let $f \in \mathcal{K}$ be an arbitrary function. Then there exists some $k \in\{1, \ldots, N\}$ so that

$$
\left\|f-f_{k}\right\|_{L^{p}(w)} \leq \varepsilon
$$

which gives

$$
\|f\|_{L^{p}(w)} \leq\left\|f-f_{k}\right\|_{L^{p}(w)}+\left\|f_{k}\right\|_{L^{p}(w)} \leq \varepsilon+\max _{1 \leq k \leq N}\left\|f_{k}\right\|_{L^{p}(w)}
$$

This shows the condition (a). Since $\mathscr{C}_{c}^{\infty}\left(\mathbb{R}^{n_{1}} \times \mathbb{R}^{n_{2}}\right)$ is dense in $L^{p}(w)$, there exists $g_{k} \in \mathscr{C}_{c}^{\infty}\left(\mathbb{R}^{n_{1}} \times \mathbb{R}^{n_{2}}\right)$ such that

$$
\left\|f_{k}-g_{k}\right\|_{L^{p}(w)} \leq \varepsilon
$$

which together with (6.5) implies

$$
\left\|f-g_{k}\right\|_{L^{p}(w)} \leq\left\|f-f_{k}\right\|_{L^{p}(w)}+\left\|f_{k}-g_{k}\right\|_{L^{p}(w)} \lesssim \varepsilon
$$

Let $\operatorname{supp} g_{k} \subset B_{\vec{n}}\left(0, A_{k}\right)$ for each $k=1, \ldots, N$, and $A_{0}:=\max \left\{A_{1}, \ldots, A_{N}\right\}$. Then for any $A \geq A_{0}$, by (6.5) and (6.6),

$$
\left\|f \mathbf{1}_{B_{\vec{n}}(0, A)^{c}}\right\|_{L^{p}(w)} \leq\left\|f-g_{k}\right\|_{L^{p}(w)}+\left\|g_{k} \mathbf{1}_{B_{\vec{n}}(0, A)^{c}}\right\|_{L^{p}(w)} \lesssim \varepsilon
$$

which justifies the condition (b). To proceed, we split

$$
\left\|\left[\oint_{B_{\vec{n}}(0, r)}\left|\left(\tau_{y}-\tau_{y_{1}}-\tau_{y_{2}}+I\right) f\right|^{a} d y\right]^{\frac{1}{a}}\right\|_{L^{p}(w)} \lesssim \sum_{j=1}^{5} \mathscr{I}_{j}
$$

where

$$
\begin{aligned}
\mathscr{I}_{1} & :=\left\|\left[\oint_{B_{\vec{n}}(0, r)}\left|\left(\tau_{y}-\tau_{y_{1}}-\tau_{y_{2}}+I\right) g_{k}\right|^{a} d y\right]^{\frac{1}{a}}\right\|_{L^{p}(w)} \\
\mathscr{I}_{2} & :=\left\|\left[\oint_{B_{\vec{n}}(0, r)}\left|\tau_{y} f-\tau_{y} g_{k}\right|^{a} d y\right]^{\frac{1}{a}}\right\|_{L^{p}(w)} \\
\mathscr{I}_{3} & :=\left\|\left[\oint_{B_{\vec{n}}(0, r)}\left|\tau_{y_{1}} f-\tau_{y_{1}} g_{k}\right|^{a} d y\right]^{\frac{1}{a}}\right\|_{L^{p}(w)} \\
\mathscr{I}_{4} & :=\left\|\left[\oint_{B_{\vec{n}}(0, r)}\left|\tau_{y_{2}} f-\tau_{y_{2}} g_{k}\right|^{a} d y\right]^{\frac{1}{a}}\right\|_{L^{p}(w)} \\
\mathscr{I}_{5} & :=\left\|\left[\oint_{B_{\vec{n}}(0, r)}\left|f-g_{k}\right|^{a} d y\right]^{\frac{1}{a}}\right\|_{L^{p}(w)}
\end{aligned}
$$

The estimate (6.6) gives

$$
\mathscr{I}_{5}=\left\|f-g_{k}\right\|_{L^{p}(w)} \lesssim \varepsilon
$$

Since $g_{k} \in \mathscr{C}_{c}^{\infty}\left(\mathbb{R}^{n_{1}} \times \mathbb{R}^{n_{2}}\right)$, there exists some $r_{0}>0$ so that

$$
\Xi_{0}:=\sup _{\substack{\left|x_{1}-y_{1}\right|<r_{0} \\\left|x_{2}-y_{2}\right|<r_{0}}}\left|g_{k}\left(x_{1}, x_{2}\right)-g_{k}\left(x_{1}, y_{2}\right)-g_{k}\left(x_{2}, y_{1}\right)+g_{k}\left(y_{1}, y_{2}\right)\right| \leq \varepsilon w\left(B_{\vec{n}}\left(0,2 A_{0}\right)\right)^{-\frac{1}{p}}
$$

Hence, for any $0<r_{1}, r_{2}<\min \left\{r_{0}, A_{0}\right\}$, this in turn leads to

$$
\mathscr{I}_{1} \leq \Xi_{0}\left\|\mathbf{1}_{B_{\vec{n}}\left(0,2 A_{0}\right)}\right\|_{L^{p}(w)} \leq \varepsilon
$$

By the fact $w \in A_{p_{0}}\left(\mathbb{R}^{n_{1}} \times \mathbb{R}^{n_{2}}\right) \subset A_{p / a}\left(\mathbb{R}^{n_{1}} \times \mathbb{R}^{n_{2}}\right)$ and the weighted boundedness of strong maximal operators (cf. [20, p. 453]), we have

$$
\mathscr{I}_{2} \leq\left\|M_{\mathcal{R}}\left(\left|f-g_{k}\right|^{a}\right)^{\frac{1}{a}}\right\|_{L^{p}(w)} \lesssim\left\|f-g_{k}\right\|_{L^{p}(w)} \lesssim \varepsilon
$$

Note that for any $q \in(1, \infty)$,

$$
[v]_{A_{q}\left(\mathbb{R}^{n_{1}} \times \mathbb{R}^{n_{2}}\right)} \simeq \max \left\{\underset{x_{1} \in \mathbb{R}^{n_{1}}}{\operatorname{ess} \sup }\left[v\left(x_{1}, \cdot\right)\right]_{A_{q}\left(\mathbb{R}^{n_{2}}\right)}, \underset{x_{2} \in \mathbb{R}^{n_{2}}}{\operatorname{ess} \sup }\left[v\left(\cdot, x_{2}\right)\right]_{A_{q}\left(\mathbb{R}^{n_{1}}\right)}\right\}
$$

For any $x=\left(x_{1}, x_{2}\right) \in \mathbb{R}^{n_{1}} \times \mathbb{R}^{n_{2}}$, simply denote $f_{x_{1}}\left(x_{2}\right):=f\left(x_{1}, x_{2}\right)=: f_{x_{2}}\left(x_{1}\right)$. Let $M_{n_{i}}$ be the Hardy-Littlewood maximal operator on $\mathbb{R}^{n_{i}}, i=1,2$. Then (6.11), along with the weighted boundedness of maximal operator, yields

$$
\begin{aligned}
\mathscr{I}_{3}^{p} & \leq \int_{\mathbb{R}^{n_{2}}}\left[\int_{\mathbb{R}^{n_{1}}} M_{n_{1}}\left(\left|f_{x_{2}}-g_{k, x_{2}}\right|^{a}\right)\left(x_{1}\right)^{\frac{p}{a}} w\left(x_{1}, x_{2}\right) d x_{1}\right] d x_{2} \\
& \lesssim \int_{\mathbb{R}^{n_{2}}}\left[\int_{\mathbb{R}^{n_{1}}}\left(\left|f_{x_{2}}-g_{k, x_{2}}\right|^{a}\right)\left(x_{1}\right)^{\frac{p}{a}} w\left(x_{1}, x_{2}\right) d x_{1}\right] d x_{2} \\
& =\left\|f-g_{k}\right\|_{L^{p}(w)}^{p} \lesssim \varepsilon^{p}
\end{aligned}
$$

Symmetrically,

$$
\mathscr{I}_{4} \lesssim \varepsilon
$$

Thus, the condition $(c)^{\prime \prime \prime}$ follows from (6.7)-(6.13).
6.2. An uniform estimate for shifts. For any $\mathcal{D}_{0}:=\mathcal{D}_{0}^{1} \times \mathcal{D}_{0}^{2} \subset \mathcal{D}^{1} \times \mathcal{D}^{2}=: \mathcal{D}$ and $k=\left(k_{1}, \ldots, k_{m+1}\right)$ with $k_{j}=\left(k_{j}^{1}, k_{j}^{2}\right) \in \mathbb{N}^{2}$, we define

$$
\mathbb{S}_{\mathcal{D}, \mathcal{D}_{0}}^{k}(\vec{f}):=\sum_{Q \in \mathcal{D}_{0}} A_{Q}^{k}(\vec{f}):=\sum_{Q=Q^{1} \times Q^{2} \in \mathcal{D}_{0}} \sum_{\substack{I_{j} \in \mathcal{D}_{k_{j}}(Q) \\ j=1, \ldots, m+1}} a_{\left(I_{j}\right), Q} \prod_{j=1}^{m}\left\langle f_{j}, \widetilde{h}_{I_{j}^{1}} \otimes \widetilde{h}_{I_{j}^{2}}\right\rangle \widetilde{h}_{I_{m+1}^{1}} \otimes \widetilde{h}_{I_{m+1}^{2}}
$$

where for each $i=1,2$, there exist two different indices $j_{0}^{i}, j_{1}^{i} \in\{1, \ldots, m+1\}$ so that $\widetilde{h}_{I_{0}^{i}}^{i}=h_{I_{0}^{i}}^{i}, \widetilde{h}_{I_{1}^{i}}^{i}=h_{I_{1}^{i}}^{i}$, and $\widetilde{h}_{I_{j}^{i}} \in\left\{h_{I_{j}^{i}}^{0}, h_{I_{j}^{i}}\right\}$ for every $j \neq j_{0}^{i}, j_{1}^{i}$. Moreover, the coefficients $a_{\left(I_{j}\right), Q}$ satisfy

$$
\left|a_{\left(I_{j}\right), Q}\right| \leq \mathcal{F}_{0} \frac{\prod_{j=1}^{m+1}\left|I_{j}\right|^{\frac{1}{2}}}{|Q|^{m}}, \quad \forall Q \in \mathcal{D}_{0}
$$

Lemma 6.14. There holds

$$
\sup _{k} \sup _{\mathcal{D}} \sup _{\mathcal{D}_{0} \subset \mathcal{D}}\left\|\mathbb{S}_{\mathcal{D}, \mathcal{D}_{0}}^{k}(\vec{f})\right\|_{L^{r}} \lesssim \mathcal{F}_{0} \prod_{j=1}^{m}\left\|f_{j}\right\|_{L^{r_{j}}}
$$

for all $\frac{1}{r}=\sum_{j=1}^{m} \frac{1}{r_{j}}$ with $r, r_{1}, \ldots, r_{m} \in(1, \infty)$.
Proof. Let $r, r_{1}, \ldots, r_{m} \in(1, \infty)$ such that $\frac{1}{r}=\sum_{j=1}^{m} \frac{1}{r_{j}}$. Since our argument depends on whether $\widetilde{h}_{I_{m+1}^{1}}$ and $\widetilde{h}_{I_{m+1}^{2}}$ are cancellative or not, it suffices to treat two cases:

$$
\begin{array}{lll}
\text { Case 1: } \widetilde{h}_{I_{m+1}^{1}}=h_{I_{m+1}^{1}} & \text { or } \quad \widetilde{h}_{I_{m+1}^{2}}=h_{I_{m+1}^{2}} ; \\
\text { Case 2: } \widetilde{h}_{I_{m+1}^{1}}=h_{I_{m+1}^{1}}^{0} & \text { and } \quad \widetilde{h}_{I_{m+1}^{2}}=h_{I_{m+1}^{2}}^{0} .
\end{array}
$$

First, in Case 1, by symmetry and similarly, we only focus on the case $\widetilde{h}_{I_{m+1}^{1}}=h_{I_{m+1}^{1}}$ and $\widetilde{h}_{I_{1}^{1}}=h_{I_{1}^{1}}$. By the orthogonality of Haar functions, it is easy to check that

$$
\Delta_{Q^{i}}^{k_{i}^{i}} h_{I^{i}}=h_{I^{i}} \mathbf{1}_{\left\{I^{i} \in \mathcal{D}_{k^{i}}^{i}\left(Q^{i}\right)\right\}}=h_{I^{i}} \mathbf{1}_{\left\{Q^{i}=K^{i}\right\}}, \quad \forall I^{i} \in \mathcal{D}_{k^{i}}^{i}\left(K^{i}\right), \quad i=1,2
$$

and then

$$
\Delta_{Q^{1}}^{k_{m+1}^{1}}\left(A_{K}^{k}(\vec{f})\right)=A_{K}^{k}(\vec{f}) \mathbf{1}_{\left\{Q^{1}=K^{1}\right\}}=A_{K}^{k}\left(\Delta_{Q^{1}}^{k_{1}^{1}} f_{1}, f_{2}, \ldots, f_{m}\right)
$$

which gives

$$
\Delta_{Q^{1}}^{k_{m+1}^{1}}\left(\mathbb{S}_{\mathcal{D}, \mathcal{D}_{0}}^{k}(\vec{f})\right)=A_{Q}^{k}(\vec{f}) \mathbf{1}_{\left\{Q \in \mathcal{D}_{0}\right\}}
$$

Additionally, there holds

$$
\left|A_{Q}^{k}(\vec{f})\right| \leq \mathcal{F}_{0} \prod_{j=1}^{m}\left(\left|f_{j}\right|\right\rangle_{Q} \mathbf{1}_{Q}, \quad \text { for all } Q \in \mathcal{D}_{0}
$$

Thus, it follows from (2.10) and (6.16)-(6.18) that

$$
\begin{aligned}
\left\|\mathbb{S}_{\mathcal{D}, \mathcal{D}^{t}}^{k}(\vec{f})\right\|_{L^{r}} & \simeq\left\|\left(\sum_{Q \in \mathcal{D}_{0}}\left|\Delta_{Q^{1}}^{k_{m+1}^{1}}\left(\mathbb{S}_{\mathcal{D}, \mathcal{D}_{0}}^{k}(\vec{f})\right)\right|^{2}\right)^{\frac{1}{2}}\right\|_{L^{r}} \\
& =\left\|\left(\sum_{Q \in \mathcal{D}_{0}}\left|A_{Q}^{k}(\vec{f})\right|^{2}\right)^{\frac{1}{2}}\right\|_{L^{r}} \\
& =\left\|\left(\sum_{Q \in \mathcal{D}_{0}}\left|A_{Q}^{k}\left(\Delta_{Q^{1}}^{k_{1}^{1}} f_{1}, f_{2}, \ldots, f_{m}\right)\right|^{2}\right)^{\frac{1}{2}}\right\|_{L^{r}} \\
& \leq \mathcal{F}_{0}\left\|\left(\sum_{Q \in \mathcal{D}_{0}}\left\langle\left|\Delta_{Q^{1}}^{k_{1}^{1}} f_{1}\right|\right\rangle_{Q}^{2} \prod_{j=2}^{m}\left(\left|f_{j}\right|\right\rangle_{Q}^{2} \mathbf{1}_{Q}\right)^{\frac{1}{2}}\right\|_{L^{r}} \\
& \leq \mathcal{F}_{0}\left\|\left(\sum_{Q \in \mathcal{D}_{0}}\left|\Delta_{Q^{1}}^{k_{1}^{1}} f_{1}\right|^{2}\right)^{\frac{1}{2}} \prod_{j=2}^{m} M_{\mathcal{R}} f_{j}\right\|_{L^{r}} \\
& \leq \mathcal{F}_{0}\left\|\left(\sum_{Q \in \mathcal{D}_{0}}\left|\Delta_{Q^{1}}^{k_{1}^{1}} f_{1}\right|^{2}\right)^{\frac{1}{2}}\right\|_{L^{r_{1}}} \prod_{j=2}^{m}\left\|M_{\mathcal{R}} f_{j}\right\|_{L^{r_{j}}} \\
& \lesssim \mathcal{F}_{0} \prod_{j=1}^{m}\left\|f_{j}\right\|_{L^{r_{j}}}
\end{aligned}
$$

where the implicit constants are independent of $k, \mathcal{D}, \mathcal{D}_{0}$, and $\vec{f}$.
Next, let us handle Case 2. By the assumptions on $\widetilde{h}_{I_{j}^{1}}$, in this case, there must exist $j_{0} \in\{1, \ldots, m\}$ such that $\widetilde{h}_{I_{0}^{1}}=h_{I_{j_{0}}^{1}}$. Set

$$
q=r_{j_{0}}^{\prime}, \quad q_{j_{0}}=2, \quad \text { and } \quad q_{j}=r_{j}, \quad j=\{1, \ldots, m\} \backslash\left\{j_{0}\right\}
$$

Then $\frac{1}{q}=\sum_{j=1}^{m} \frac{1}{q_{j}}$. Recall that $T^{j_{0} \star}$ denotes the full adjoint of $T$ with respect to the $j_{0}$-th slot. Note that the shift $\mathbb{S}_{\mathcal{D}, \mathcal{D}_{0}}^{k, j_{0} \star}$ contains the cancellative Haar function $\widetilde{h}_{I_{m+1}^{1}}=h_{I_{m+1}^{1}}$, which is similar to Case 1. Since (2.10) holds for all exponents $p \in(1, \infty)$, as shown in (6.19), one can obtain

$$
\left\|\mathbb{S}_{\mathcal{D}, \mathcal{D}_{0}}^{k, j_{0} \star}(\vec{f})\right\|_{L^{q}} \lesssim \mathcal{F}_{0} \prod_{j=1}^{m}\left\|f_{j}\right\|_{L^{q_{j}}}
$$

where the implicit constant is independent of $k, \mathcal{D}, \mathcal{D}_{0}$, and $\vec{f}$. By duality, (6.20) and (6.21) imply

$$
\left\|\mathbb{S}_{\mathcal{D}, \mathcal{D}_{0}}^{k}(\vec{f})\right\|_{L^{r}} \lesssim \mathcal{F}_{0} \prod_{j=1}^{m}\left\|f_{j}\right\|_{L^{r_{j}}}
$$

This completes the proof.
6.3. Compact shifts. Let us start the proof of Theorem 1.5 for $\mathbf{T}_{\omega}=\mathbf{S}_{\mathcal{D}_{\omega}}^{k}$. Recall the weighted boundedness of shifts (cf. [46, Theorem 6.2]):

$$
\sup _{\omega}\left\|\mathbb{S}_{\mathcal{D}_{\omega}}^{k}(\vec{f})\right\|_{L^{r}\left(v^{r}\right)} \lesssim \prod_{j=1}^{m}\left\|f_{j}\right\|_{L^{r_{j}}\left(v_{j}^{r_{j}}\right)}
$$

for all $\vec{r}=\left(r_{1}, \ldots, r_{m}\right) \in(1, \infty]^{m}$ and $\vec{v}=\left(v_{1}, \ldots, v_{m}\right) \in A_{\vec{r}}\left(\mathbb{R}^{n_{1}} \times \mathbb{R}^{n_{2}}\right)$, where $\frac{1}{r}=\sum_{j=1}^{m} \frac{1}{r_{j}}>0$ and $v=\prod_{j=1}^{m} v_{j}$. In light of Theorem 1.6 and (6.22), it suffices to show that $\mathbb{E}_{\omega} \mathbf{S}_{\mathcal{D}_{\omega}}^{k}$ is compact from $L^{2 m} \times \cdots \times L^{2 m}$ to $L^{2}$. Then by Theorem 6.3 and Minkowski's inequality, it is enough to prove the following

$$
\sup _{\substack{\left\|f_{j}\right\|_{L^{2 m} \leq 1 \\ j=1, \ldots, m}}} \sup _{\omega}\left\|\mathbf{S}_{\mathcal{D}_{\omega}}^{k}(\vec{f})\right\|_{L^{2}} \lesssim 1
$$

$$
\lim _{A \rightarrow \infty} \sup _{\substack{\left\|f_{j}\right\|_{L^{2 m} \leq 1 \\ j=1, \ldots, m}}} \sup _{\omega}\left\|\mathbf{S}_{\mathcal{D}_{\omega}}^{k}(\vec{f}) \mathbf{1}_{B_{R}(0, A)^{c}}\right\|_{L^{2}}=0
$$

$$
\lim _{\substack{|v| \rightarrow 0}} \sup _{\substack{\left\|f_{j}\right\|_{L^{2 m} \leq 1 \\ j=1, \ldots, m}}} \sup _{\omega}\left\|\tau_{v} \mathbf{S}_{\mathcal{D}_{\omega}}^{k}(\vec{f})-\mathbf{S}_{\mathcal{D}_{\omega}}^{k}(\vec{f})\right\|_{L^{2}}=0
$$

The inequality (6.23) follows from (6.22).
Recall the operator $\mathbb{S}_{\mathcal{D}, \mathcal{D}_{0}}^{k}$ defined in Section 6.2. To demonstrate (6.24), we define

$$
\mathbf{S}_{\mathcal{D}_{\omega}}^{k, N}(\vec{f}):=\sum_{Q \notin \mathcal{D}_{\omega}(N)} A_{Q}^{k}(\vec{f}), \quad N \in \mathbb{N}
$$

Lemma 6.14 applied to $\mathcal{D}_{0}=\mathcal{D} \backslash \mathcal{D}(N)$ gives

$$
\sup _{\omega}\left\|\mathbf{S}_{\mathcal{D}_{\omega}}^{k, N}(\vec{f})\right\|_{L^{2}} \lesssim \mathcal{F}_{N} \prod_{j=1}^{m}\left\|f_{j}\right\|_{L^{2 m}}
$$

where the implicit constants are independent of $k, N$, and $\vec{f}$. Let $A \geq 2^{4}$ and $N:=\left[\frac{1}{2} \log _{2} A\right] \geq 2$. Note that for any $\omega=\left(\omega_{1}, \omega_{2}\right) \in \Omega_{1} \times \Omega_{2}$ and $I^{1} \times I^{2} \in \mathcal{D}_{\omega}(N)$,

$$
I^{i} \subset\left\{x_{i} \in \mathbb{R}^{n_{i}}:\left|x_{i}\right| \leq(N+2) 2^{N}\right\} \subset\left\{\left|x_{i}\right| \leq 2^{2 N}\right\} \subset\left\{\left|x_{i}\right| \leq A\right\}, \quad i=1,2
$$

Hence, applying (6.26) and (6.27), we obtain

$$
\left\|\mathbf{S}_{\mathcal{D}_{\omega}}^{k}(\vec{f}) \mathbf{1}_{B_{R}(0,2 A)^{v}}\right\|_{L^{2}}=\left\|\mathbf{S}_{\mathcal{D}_{\omega}}^{k, N}(\vec{f}) \mathbf{1}_{B_{R}(0,2 A)^{v}}\right\|_{L^{2}} \lesssim \mathcal{F}_{N} \prod_{j=1}^{m}\left\|f_{j}\right\|_{L^{2 m}}
$$

where the implicit constant is independent of $\omega, A$, and $\vec{f}$. This shows (6.24).
It remains to verify (6.25). Let $0<|v|=\left|v_{1}\right|+\left|v_{2}\right| \ll 2^{-10}$ and $\rho \geq 2$ be an integer chosen later. There exists an integer $N=N(v) \geq 2$ such that $2^{-\rho(N+1)} \leq|v|<2^{-\rho N}$. We then split

$$
\left\|\left(\tau_{v} \mathbf{S}_{\mathcal{D}_{\omega}}^{k}-\mathbf{S}_{\mathcal{D}_{\omega}}^{k}\right)(\vec{f})\right\|_{L^{2}} \leq \mathbf{X}_{\omega}^{1}(v ; \vec{f})+\mathbf{X}_{\omega}^{2}(v ; \vec{f})
$$

where

$$
\begin{aligned}
\mathbf{X}_{\omega}^{1}(v ; \vec{f}) & :=\left\|\sum_{Q \in \mathcal{D}_{\omega}(N)} \sum_{\substack{I_{j} \in \mathcal{D}_{\omega, k_{j}}(Q) \\
j=1, \ldots, m+1}} a_{\left(I_{j}\right), Q}\left\langle f_{1}, h_{I_{1}^{1}} \otimes \widetilde{h}_{I_{1}^{2}}\right\rangle \prod_{j=2}^{m}\left\langle f_{j}, \widetilde{h}_{I_{j}^{1}} \otimes \widetilde{h}_{I_{j}^{2}}\right\rangle \phi_{I_{m+1}}^{v}\right\|_{L^{2}} \\
\mathbf{X}_{\omega}^{2}(v ; \vec{f}) & :=\left\|\sum_{Q \notin \mathcal{D}_{\omega}(N)} \sum_{\substack{I_{j} \in \mathcal{D}_{\omega, k_{j}}(Q) \\
j=1, \ldots, m+1}} a_{\left(I_{j}\right), Q}\left\langle f_{1}, h_{I_{1}^{1}} \otimes \widetilde{h}_{I_{1}^{2}}\right\rangle \prod_{j=2}^{m}\left\langle f_{j}, \widetilde{h}_{I_{j}^{1}} \otimes \widetilde{h}_{I_{j}^{2}}\right\rangle \phi_{I_{m+1}}^{v}\right\|_{L^{2}}
\end{aligned}
$$

with $\phi_{I_{m+1}}^{v}:=\tau_{v}\left(h_{I_{m+1}^{1}} \otimes \widetilde{h}_{I_{m+1}^{2}}\right)-h_{I_{m+1}^{1}} \otimes \widetilde{h}_{I_{m+1}^{2}}$. The inequality (6.26) immediately gives

$$
\mathbf{X}_{\omega}^{2}(v ; \vec{f}) \leq\left\|\tau_{v} \mathbf{S}_{\mathcal{D}_{\omega}}^{k, N}(\vec{f})\right\|_{L^{2}}+\left\|\mathbf{S}_{\mathcal{D}_{\omega}}^{k, N}(\vec{f})\right\|_{L^{2}}=2\left\|\mathbf{S}_{\mathcal{D}_{\omega}}^{k, N}(\vec{f})\right\|_{L^{2}} \lesssim \mathcal{F}_{N} \prod_{j=1}^{m}\left\|f_{j}\right\|_{L^{2 m}}
$$

where the implicit constant is independent of $v, \omega$, and $\vec{f}$. Since $|v| \rightarrow 0$ implies $N(v) \rightarrow \infty$, the estimate (6.29), along with the fact $\lim _{N \rightarrow \infty} \mathcal{F}_{N}=0$, implies

$$
\lim _{|v| \rightarrow 0} \sup _{\substack{\left\|f_{j}\right\|_{L^{2 m} \leq 1 \\ j=1, \ldots, m}}} \mathbf{X}_{\omega}^{2}(v ; \vec{f})=0
$$

To analyze $\mathbf{X}_{\omega}^{1}(v ; \vec{f})$, note that for any $N \geq 2$ and $i=1,2$,

$$
\begin{aligned}
& \# \mathcal{D}_{\omega_{i}}^{i}(N) \leq \#\left\{J^{i} \in \mathcal{D}_{\omega_{i}}^{i}: 2^{-N} \leq \ell\left(J^{i}\right) \leq 2^{N}, J^{i} \subset 2^{2 N+1} \mathbb{R}^{i}\right\} \\
& \leq \sum_{-N \leq k \leq N} 2^{(2 N+1) n_{i}} 2^{-k n_{i}} \leq 2^{(2 N+1) n_{i}} 2^{n_{i} N+1}=2^{3 n_{i} N+n_{i}+1}
\end{aligned}
$$

and

$$
\begin{aligned}
\left\|\phi_{J}^{v}\right\|_{L^{2}} & \leq\left\|\tau_{v_{1}} h_{J^{1}}-h_{J^{1}}\right\|_{L^{2}}\left\|\tau_{v_{2}} \widetilde{h}_{J^{2}}\right\|_{L^{2}}+\left\|h_{J^{1}}\right\|_{L^{2}}\left\|\tau_{v_{2}} \widetilde{h}_{J^{2}}-\widetilde{h}_{J^{2}}\right\|_{L^{2}} \\
& \lesssim\left|v_{1}\right|^{\frac{1}{2}} \ell\left(J^{1}\right)^{-\frac{1}{2}}+\left|v_{2}\right|^{\frac{1}{2}} \ell\left(J^{2}\right)^{-\frac{1}{2}}
\end{aligned}
$$

Accordingly, by (6.31) and (6.32),

$$
\begin{aligned}
\mathbf{X}_{\omega}^{1}(v ; \vec{f}) \leq & \sum_{Q \in \mathcal{D}_{\omega}(N)} \prod_{j=1}^{m}\left\langle\left|f_{j}\right|\right\rangle_{Q} \sum_{I_{m+1} \in \mathcal{D}_{\omega, k_{m+1}}(Q)}\left|I_{m+1}\right|^{\frac{1}{2}}\left\|\phi_{I_{m+1}}^{v}\right\|_{L^{2}} \\
& \lesssim \sum_{Q \in \mathcal{D}_{\omega}(N)} \prod_{j=1}^{m}|Q|^{-\frac{1}{2 m}}\left\|f_{j}\right\|_{L^{2 m}} \sum_{I_{m+1} \in \mathcal{D}_{\omega, k_{m+1}}(Q)}\left|I_{m+1}\right|^{\frac{1}{2}} \\
& \times\left[\left|v_{1}\right|^{\frac{1}{2}} \ell\left(I_{m+1}^{1}\right)^{-\frac{1}{2}}+\left|v_{2}\right|^{\frac{1}{2}} \ell\left(I_{m+1}^{2}\right)^{-\frac{1}{2}}\right] \\
& \lesssim \sum_{Q \in \mathcal{D}_{\omega}(N)} 2^{k_{m+1}^{1} n_{1} / 2} 2^{k_{m+1}^{2} n_{2} / 2} \prod_{j=1}^{m}\left\|f_{j}\right\|_{L^{2 m}} \\
& \times\left[\left(\left|v_{1}\right|^{-1} 2^{-k_{m+1}^{1}} \ell\left(Q^{1}\right)\right)^{-\frac{1}{2}}+\left(\left|v_{2}\right|^{-1} 2^{-k_{m+1}^{2}} \ell\left(Q^{2}\right)\right)^{-\frac{1}{2}}\right] \\
& \lesssim 2^{\left(3 n_{1}+3 n_{2}\right) N} 2^{k_{m+1}^{1} n_{1}+k_{m+1}^{2} n_{2}}\left(|v| 2^{k_{m+1}^{1}+k_{m+1}^{2}} 2^{N}\right)^{\frac{1}{2}} \prod_{j=1}^{m}\left\|f_{j}\right\|_{L^{2 m}} \\
& \leq 2^{\left(k_{m+1}^{1}+k_{m+1}^{2}\right)\left(n_{1}+n_{2}+1\right) / 2} 2^{\left(3 n_{1}+3 n_{2}+1-\rho / 2\right) N} \prod_{j=1}^{m}\left\|f_{j}\right\|_{L^{2 m}}
\end{aligned}
$$

Choosing $\rho>2\left(3 n_{1}+3 n_{2}+1\right)$, we conclude

$$
\lim _{|v| \rightarrow 0} \sup _{\omega} \sup _{\substack{\left\|f_{j}\right\|_{L^{2 m}} \leq 1 \\ j=1, \ldots, m}} \mathbf{X}_{\omega}^{1}(v ; \vec{f})=0
$$

Consequently, (6.25) follows from (6.28), (6.30), and (6.33).
6.4. Compact partial paraproducts. Next, we would like to prove Theorem 1.5 for $\mathbf{T}_{\omega}=\mathbf{P}_{\mathcal{D}_{\omega}}^{1, k}$, and the proof for $\mathbf{T}_{\omega}=\mathbf{P}_{\mathcal{D}_{\omega}}^{2, k}$ is symmetric. It was shown in [46, Theorem 6.7] that

$$
\sup _{\omega}\left\|\mathbb{P}_{\mathcal{D}_{\omega}}^{1, k}(\vec{f})\right\|_{L^{r}\left(v^{r}\right)} \lesssim \prod_{j=1}^{m}\left\|f_{j}\right\|_{L^{r_{j}}\left(v_{j}^{r_{j}}\right)}
$$

for all $\vec{r}=\left(r_{1}, \ldots, r_{m}\right) \in(1, \infty]^{m}$ and $\vec{v}=\left(v_{1}, \ldots, v_{m}\right) \in A_{\vec{r}}\left(\mathbb{R}^{n_{1}} \times \mathbb{R}^{n_{2}}\right)$, where $\frac{1}{r}=\sum_{j=1}^{m} \frac{1}{r_{j}}>0$ and $v=\prod_{j=1}^{m} v_{j}$.
