By Theorem 1.6 and (6.34), it is enough to show that $\mathbb{E}_{\omega} \mathbf{P}_{\mathcal{D}_{\omega}}^{1, k}$ is compact from $L^{2 m} \times \cdots \times L^{2 m}$ to $L^{2}$. With Theorem 6.3 in hand, this is reduced to proving that

$$
\sup _{\substack{\left\|f_{j}\right\|_{L^{2 m}} \leq 1 \\ j=1, \ldots, m}} \sup _{\omega}\left\|\mathbf{P}_{\mathcal{D}_{\omega}}^{1, k}(\vec{f})\right\|_{L^{2}} \lesssim 1
$$

$$
\lim _{A \rightarrow \infty} \sup _{\substack{\left\|f_{j}\right\|_{L^{2 m}} \leq 1 \\ j=1, \ldots, m}} \sup _{\omega}\left\|\mathbf{P}_{\mathcal{D}_{\omega}}^{1, k}(\vec{f}) \mathbf{1}_{B_{R}(0, A)^{c}}\right\|_{L^{2}}=0
$$

$$
\lim _{|v| \rightarrow 0} \sup _{\substack{\left\|f_{j}\right\|_{L^{2 m}} \leq 1 \\ j=1, \ldots, m}} \sup _{\omega}\left\|\tau_{v} \mathbf{P}_{\mathcal{D}_{\omega}}^{1, k}(\vec{f})-\mathbf{P}_{\mathcal{D}_{\omega}}^{1, k}(\vec{f})\right\|_{L^{2}}=0
$$

Note that (6.34) implies (6.35).
Without loss of generality, we may assume that $\widetilde{h}_{I_{1}^{1}}=h_{I_{1}^{1}}$ and $\widetilde{h}_{I_{2}^{1}}=h_{I_{2}^{1}}$. The estimate (6.27) gives

$$
\left\|\mathbf{P}_{\mathcal{D}_{\omega}^{1}}^{1, k}(\vec{f}) \mathbf{1}_{B_{S}(0, A)^{c}}\right\|_{L^{2}} \leq\left\|\Xi_{\omega}^{1}(\vec{f})\right\|_{L^{2}}+\left\|\Xi_{\omega}^{2}(\vec{f})\right\|_{L^{2}}
$$

where

$$
\begin{aligned}
& \Xi_{\omega}^{1}(\vec{f}):=\sum_{\substack{Q^{1} \notin \mathcal{D}_{\omega_{1}}^{1}(N) \\
Q^{2} \in \mathcal{D}_{\omega_{2}}^{2}}} \sum_{\substack{I_{j}^{1} \in \mathcal{D}_{k_{j}}^{1}\left(Q^{1}\right) \\
j=1, \ldots, m+1}} a_{\left(I_{j}^{1}\right), Q} \prod_{j=1}^{m}\left\langle f_{j}, \widetilde{h}_{I_{j}^{1}} \otimes \bar{h}_{j, Q^{2}}\right\rangle \widetilde{h}_{I_{m+1}^{1}} \otimes \bar{h}_{m+1, Q^{2}} \\
& \Xi_{\omega}^{2}(\vec{f}):=\sum_{\substack{Q^{1} \in \mathcal{D}_{\omega_{1}}^{1}(N) \\
Q^{2} \notin \mathcal{D}_{\omega_{2}}^{2}(N)}} \sum_{j=1, \ldots, m+1} a_{\left(I_{j}^{1}\right), Q} \prod_{j=1}^{m}\left\langle f_{j}, \widetilde{h}_{I_{j}^{1}} \otimes \bar{h}_{j, Q^{2}}\right\rangle \widetilde{h}_{I_{m+1}^{1}} \otimes \bar{h}_{m+1, Q^{2}}
\end{aligned}
$$

Let $f_{m+1} \in L^{2}\left(\mathbb{R}^{n_{1}} \times \mathbb{R}^{n_{2}}\right)$ with $\left\|f_{m+1}\right\|_{L^{2}} \leq 1$. Denote

$$
\Lambda\left(\vec{f}, f_{m+1}\right):=\sum_{\substack{Q^{1} \in \mathcal{D}_{\omega_{1}}^{1} \\
Q^{1} \in \mathcal{D}_{k_{j}}^{1}\left(Q^{1}\right) \\
j=1, \ldots, m+1}} \sum_{\substack{\prod_{j=1}^{m+1}\left|I_{j}^{1}\right|^{\frac{1}{2}}}}^{\frac{1}{2}}\left|\left|Q^{1}\right|^{m}\right| \|_{Q^{2}\left(\mathbb{R}^{n_{2}\right)}}^{m}\prod_{j=1}^{m+1}\left|\left\langle f_{j}, \widetilde{h}_{I_{j}^{1}} \otimes \bar{h}_{j, Q^{2}}\right\rangle\right|^{2} \frac{\mathbf{1}_{Q^{2}}}{\left|Q^{2}\right|}\right]^{\frac{1}{2}} \|_{L^{1}\left(\mathbb{R}^{n_{2}}\right)}
$$

It was shown in [46, p. 25] that

$$
\Lambda\left(\vec{f}, f_{m+1}\right) \lesssim \prod_{j=1}^{m}\left\|f_{j}\right\|_{L^{2 m}}
$$

which, along with (2.15) and the assumption on partial paraproducts, leads to $(6.40)$

$$
\begin{aligned}
\left|\left\langle\Xi_{\omega}^{1}(\vec{f}), f_{m+1}\right\rangle\right| \lesssim & \sum_{\substack{Q^{1} \notin \mathcal{D}_{\omega_{1}}^{1}(N) \\
Q^{1} \in \mathcal{D}_{k_{j}}^{1}\left(Q^{1}\right) \\
j=1, \ldots, m+1}}\left[\sup _{Q_{0}^{2} \in \mathcal{D}_{\omega_{2}}^{2}} \frac{1}{\left|Q_{0}^{2}\right|} \sum_{\substack{Q^{2} \in \mathcal{D}_{\omega_{2}}^{2} \\
Q^{2} \subset Q_{0}^{2}}}\left|a_{\left(I_{j}^{1}\right), Q}\right|^{2}\right]^{\frac{1}{2}} \\
& \times \int_{\mathbb{R}^{n_{2}}}\left[\sum_{Q^{2} \in \mathcal{D}_{\omega_{2}}^{2}}^{2} \prod_{j=1}^{m+1}\left|\left\langle f_{j}, \widetilde{h}_{I_{j}^{1}} \otimes \bar{h}_{j, Q^{2}}\right\rangle\right|^{2} \frac{\mathbf{1}_{Q^{2}}}{\left|Q^{2}\right|}\right]^{\frac{1}{2}} d x_{2} \\
& \lesssim \sup _{Q^{1} \notin \mathcal{D}_{\omega_{1}}^{1}(N)} \mathcal{F}^{1}\left(Q^{1}\right) \Lambda\left(\vec{f}, f_{m+1}\right) \lesssim \sup _{Q^{1} \notin \mathcal{D}_{\omega_{1}}^{1}(N)} \mathcal{F}^{1}\left(Q^{1}\right) \prod_{j=1}^{m}\left\|f_{j}\right\|_{L^{2 m}}
\end{aligned}
$$

where the implicit constants are independent of $\omega$. Analogously,

$$
\begin{aligned}
\left|\left\langle\Xi_{\omega}^{2}(\vec{f}), f_{m+1}\right\rangle\right| \lesssim & \sum_{\substack{Q^{1} \in \mathcal{D}_{\omega_{1}}^{1}(N) \\
Q^{1} \in \mathcal{D}_{k_{j}}^{1}\left(Q^{1}\right) \\
j=1, \ldots, m+1}}\left[\sup _{Q_{0}^{2} \in \mathcal{D}_{\omega_{2}}^{2}} \frac{1}{\left|Q_{0}^{2}\right|} \sum_{\substack{Q^{2} \notin \mathcal{D}_{\omega_{2}}^{2}(N) \\
Q^{2} \subset Q_{0}^{2}}}\left|a_{\left(I_{j}^{1}\right), Q}\right|^{2}\right]^{\frac{1}{2}} \\
& \times \int_{\mathbb{R}^{n_{2}}}\left[\sum_{Q^{2} \in \mathcal{D}_{\omega_{2}}^{2}}^{2} \prod_{j=1}^{m+1}\left|\left\langle f_{j}, \widetilde{h}_{I_{j}^{1}} \otimes \bar{h}_{j, Q^{2}}\right\rangle\right|^{2} \frac{\mathbf{1}_{Q^{2}}}{\left|Q^{2}\right|}\right]^{\frac{1}{2}} d x_{2}
\end{aligned}
$$

$$
\lesssim \mathcal{F}_{N}^{1} \Lambda\left(\vec{f}, f_{m+1}\right) \lesssim \mathcal{F}_{N}^{1} \prod_{j=1}^{m}\left\|f_{j}\right\|_{L^{2 m}}
$$

where the implicit constants are independent of $\omega$. Since

$$
\lim _{N \rightarrow \infty} \widetilde{\mathcal{F}}_{N}^{1}:=\lim _{N \rightarrow \infty}\left[\sup _{\mathcal{D}^{1}} \sup _{Q^{1} \notin \mathcal{D}^{1}(N)} \mathcal{F}^{1}\left(Q^{1}\right)+\mathcal{F}_{N}^{1}\right]=0
$$

we deduce (6.36) from (6.38), (6.40), and (6.41).
To justify (6.37), let $0<|v|=\left|v_{1}\right|+\left|v_{2}\right| \ll 2^{-8}$ and $\rho \geq 2$ be an integer chosen later. Then there exists an integer $N=N(v) \geq 2$ so that $2^{-\rho(N+1)}<|v| \leq 2^{-\rho N}$. We have

$$
\left\|\tau_{v} \mathbf{P}_{\mathcal{D}_{\omega}}^{1, k}(\vec{f})-\mathbf{P}_{\mathcal{D}_{\omega}}^{1, k}(\vec{f})\right\|_{L^{2}} \leq\left\|\Gamma_{\omega}^{v, 1}(\vec{f})\right\|_{L^{2}}+\left\|\Gamma_{\omega}^{v, 2}(\vec{f})\right\|_{L^{2}}
$$

where

$$
\begin{aligned}
& \Gamma_{\omega}^{v, 1}(\vec{f}):=\sum_{Q \in \mathcal{D}_{\omega}(N)} \sum_{\substack{I_{j}^{1} \in \mathcal{D}_{I_{j}}^{1}\left(Q^{1}\right) \\
j=1, \ldots, m+1}} a_{\left(I_{j}^{1}\right), Q} \prod_{j=1}^{m}\left\langle f_{j}, \widetilde{h}_{I_{j}^{1}} \otimes \bar{h}_{j, Q^{2}}\right\rangle \psi_{Q}^{v} \\
& \Gamma_{\omega}^{v, 2}(\vec{f}):=\sum_{Q \notin \mathcal{D}_{\omega}(N)} \sum_{\substack{I_{j}^{1} \in \mathcal{D}_{I_{j}}^{1}\left(Q^{1}\right) \\
j=1, \ldots, m+1}} a_{\left(I_{j}^{1}\right), Q} \prod_{j=1}^{m}\left\langle f_{j}, \widetilde{h}_{I_{j}^{1}} \otimes \bar{h}_{j, Q^{2}}\right\rangle \psi_{Q}^{v}
\end{aligned}
$$

where $\psi_{Q}^{v}:=\tau_{v}\left(\widetilde{h}_{I_{m+1}^{1}} \otimes \bar{h}_{m+1, Q^{2}}\right)-\widetilde{h}_{I_{m+1}^{1}} \otimes \bar{h}_{m+1, Q^{2}}$. In light of (6.40) and (6.41), we obtain

$$
\left\|\Gamma_{\omega}^{v, 2}(\vec{f})\right\|_{L^{2}} \leq 2\left\|\Xi_{\omega}^{1}(\vec{f})\right\|_{L^{2}}+2\left\|\Xi_{\omega}^{2}(\vec{f})\right\|_{L^{2}} \lesssim \widetilde{\mathcal{F}}_{N}^{1} \prod_{j=1}^{m}\left\|f_{j}\right\|_{L^{2 m}}
$$

which together with (6.42) implies

$$
\lim _{|v| \rightarrow 0} \sup _{\omega} \sup _{\substack{\left\|f_{j}\right\|_{L^{2 m} \leq 1} \\ j=1, \ldots, m}}\left\|\Gamma_{\omega}^{v, 2}(\vec{f})\right\|_{L^{2}}=0
$$

As argued in (6.40), there holds

$$
\left\|\Gamma_{\omega}^{v, 1}(\vec{f})\right\|_{L^{2}} \lesssim \sup _{\left\|f_{m+1}\right\|_{L^{2}} \leq 1} \Lambda_{\omega}^{v}\left(\vec{f}, f_{m+1}\right)
$$

where

$$
\begin{aligned}
\Lambda_{\omega}^{v}\left(\vec{f}, f_{m+1}\right):= & \sum_{Q^{1} \in \mathcal{D}_{\omega_{1}}^{1}(N)} \sum_{\substack{I_{j}^{1} \in \mathcal{D}_{I_{j}}^{1}\left(Q^{1}\right) \\
j=1, \ldots, m+1}} \frac{\prod_{j=1}^{m+1}\left|I_{j}^{1}\right|^{\frac{1}{2}}}{\left|Q^{1}\right|^{m}} \\
& \times\left\|\left[\sum_{Q^{2} \in \mathcal{D}_{\omega_{2}}^{2}(N)} \prod_{j=1}^{m}\left|\left\langle f_{j}, \widetilde{h}_{I_{j}^{1}} \otimes \bar{h}_{j, Q^{2}}\right\rangle\right|^{2}\left|\left\langle f_{m+1}, \psi_{Q}^{v}\right\rangle\right|^{2} \frac{\mathbf{1}_{Q^{2}}}{\left|Q^{2}\right|}\right]^{\frac{1}{2}}\right\|_{L^{1}\left(\mathbb{R}^{n_{2}}\right)}
\end{aligned}
$$

$$
\leq \sum_{Q \in \mathcal{D}_{\omega}(N)} \sum_{\substack{I_{j}^{1} \in \mathcal{D}_{I_{j}}^{1}\left(Q^{1}\right) \\ j=1, \ldots, m+1}} \frac{\prod_{j=1}^{m+1}\left|I_{j}^{1}\right|^{\frac{1}{2}}}{\left|Q^{1}\right|^{m}}\left|Q^{2}\right|^{\frac{1}{2}} \prod_{j=1}^{m}\left|\left\langle f_{j}, \widetilde{h}_{I_{j}^{1}} \otimes \bar{h}_{j, Q^{2}}\right\rangle\left\|\left\langle f_{m+1}, \psi_{Q}^{v}\right\rangle\right.\right|
$$

To estimate the last term, one has to know the exact form of $\bar{h}_{m+1, Q^{2}}$. If $\bar{h}_{m+1, Q^{2}}=$ $h_{Q^{2}}$, then

$$
\begin{aligned}
\left\|\psi_{Q}^{v}\right\|_{L^{2}} \leq & \left\|\tau_{v_{1}} \widetilde{h}_{I_{m+1}^{1}}-\widetilde{h}_{I_{m+1}^{1}}\right\|_{L^{2}}\left\|\tau_{v_{2}} \bar{h}_{m+1, Q^{2}}\right\|_{L^{2}} \\
& +\left\|\widetilde{h}_{I_{m+1}^{1}}\right\|_{L^{2}}\left\|\tau_{v_{2}} \bar{h}_{m+1, Q^{2}}-\bar{h}_{m+1, Q^{2}}\right\|_{L^{2}} \\
\leq & \left|v_{1}\right|^{\frac{1}{2}} \ell\left(I_{m+1}^{1}\right)^{-\frac{1}{2}}+\left|v_{2}\right|^{\frac{1}{2}} \ell\left(Q^{2}\right)^{-\frac{1}{2}}
\end{aligned}
$$

If $\bar{h}_{m+1, Q^{2}}=\frac{\mathbf{1}_{Q^{2}}}{\left|Q^{2}\right|}$, then

$$
\left\|\psi_{Q}^{v}\right\|_{L^{2}} \lesssim\left|v_{1}\right|^{\frac{1}{2}} \ell\left(I_{m+1}^{1}\right)^{-\frac{1}{2}}\left|Q^{2}\right|^{-\frac{1}{2}}+\left|v_{2}\right|^{\frac{1}{2}} \ell\left(Q^{2}\right)^{-\frac{1}{2}}\left|Q^{2}\right|^{-\frac{1}{2}}
$$

By the assumption, there exists only one function in $\left\{\bar{h}_{j, Q^{2}}\right\}_{j=1}^{m+1}$ being cancellative Haar function. This, along with (6.46)-(6.48), gives

$$
\begin{aligned}
\Lambda_{\omega}^{v}\left(\vec{f}, f_{m+1}\right) \lesssim & \sum_{Q \in \mathcal{D}_{\omega}(N)} \sum_{\substack{I_{m+1}^{1} \in \mathcal{D}_{k_{m+1}}^{1}\left(Q^{1}\right)}}\left|Q^{2}\right|^{\frac{1}{2}} \prod_{j=1}^{m}\left\langle\left|f_{j}\right|\right\rangle_{Q}\left|I_{m+1}^{1}\right|^{\frac{1}{2}}\left\|f_{m+1}\right\|_{L^{2}} \\
& \times\left[\left|v_{1}\right|^{\frac{1}{2}} \ell\left(I_{m+1}^{1}\right)^{-\frac{1}{2}}+\left|v_{2}\right|^{\frac{1}{2}} \ell\left(Q^{2}\right)^{-\frac{1}{2}}\right] \\
& \lesssim|v|^{\frac{1}{2}} \# \mathcal{D}_{\omega}(N) 2^{k_{m+1} \frac{v_{1}}{2}} 2^{N \frac{v_{1}}{2}}\left(2^{k_{m+1}} 2^{N}\right)^{\frac{1}{2}} \prod_{j=1}^{m}\left\|f_{j}\right\|_{L^{2 m}} \\
& \lesssim 2^{k_{m+1}\left(n_{1}+1\right) / 2} 2^{\left(4 n_{1}+4 n_{2}-\rho / 2\right) N} \prod_{j=1}^{m}\left\|f_{j}\right\|_{L^{2 m}}
\end{aligned}
$$

where the implicit constants are independent of $v$ and $\omega$. Then taking $\rho>8 n_{1}+8 n_{2}$ and using (6.45) and (6.49), we deduce

$$
\lim _{|v| \rightarrow 0} \sup _{\omega} \sup _{\substack{\left\|f_{j}\right\|_{L^{2 m} \leq 1} \\ j=1, \ldots, m}}\left\|\Gamma_{\omega}^{v, 1}(\vec{f})\right\|_{L^{2}}=0
$$

Hence, (6.37) follows from (6.43), (6.44), and (6.50).
6.5. Compact full paraproducts. Finally, let us turn to the proof of Theorem 1.5 for $\mathbf{T}_{\omega}=\mathbf{F}_{\mathbf{a}_{\omega}}$. A careful checking of the proof of [46, Theorem 6.21] yields

$$
\sup _{\omega}\left\|\mathbb{F}_{\mathbf{a}_{\omega}}\right\|_{L^{r_{1}}\left(v_{1}^{r_{1}}\right) \times \cdots \times L^{r_{m}}\left(v_{m}^{r_{m}}\right) \rightarrow L^{r}\left(v^{r}\right)} \lesssim \sup _{\omega}\left\|\mathbf{a}_{\omega}\right\|_{\mathrm{BMO}\left(\mathcal{D}_{\omega}\right)} \leq 1
$$

for all $\vec{r}=\left(r_{1}, \ldots, r_{m}\right) \in(1, \infty]^{m}$ and $\vec{v}=\left(v_{1}, \ldots, v_{m}\right) \in A_{\vec{r}}\left(\mathbb{R}^{n_{1}} \times \mathbb{R}^{n_{2}}\right)$, where $\frac{1}{r}=\sum_{j=1}^{m} \frac{1}{\vec{r}_{j}}>0$ and $v=\prod_{j=1}^{m} v_{j}$. By Theorem 1.6 and (6.51), it is enough to show

that $\mathbb{E}_{\omega} \mathbf{F}_{\mathbf{a}_{\omega}}$ is compact from $L^{2 m} \times \cdots \times L^{2 m}$ to $L^{2}$. With Theorem 6.3 in hand, this is reduced to proving that

$$
\sup _{\substack{\left\|f_{j}\right\|_{L^{2 m} \leq 1 \\ j=1, \ldots, m}}} \sup _{\omega}}\left\|\mathbf{F}_{\mathbf{a}_{\omega}}(\vec{f})\right\|_{L^{2}} \lesssim 1
$$

$$
\lim _{A \rightarrow \infty} \sup _{\substack{\left\|f_{j}\right\|_{L^{2 m} \leq 1 \\ j=1, \ldots, m}}} \sup _{\omega}}\left\|\mathbf{F}_{\mathbf{a}_{\omega}}(\vec{f}) \mathbf{1}_{B_{R}(0, A)^{c}}\right\|_{L^{2}}=0
$$

$$
\lim _{|v|-n \mid} \sup _{\substack{\left\|f_{j}\right\|_{L^{2 m} \leq 1 \\ j=1, \ldots, m}}} \sup _{\omega}}\left\|\tau_{v} \mathbf{F}_{\mathbf{a}_{\omega}}(\vec{f})-\mathbf{F}_{\mathbf{a}_{\omega}}(\vec{f})\right\|_{L^{2}}=0
$$

Since it no longer needs the cancellation of Haar functions, it suffices to consider the case

$$
\mathbf{F}_{\mathbf{a}_{\omega}}(\vec{f})=\sum_{I=I^{1} \times I^{2} \in \mathcal{D}_{\omega}} a_{I}\left\langle f_{1}, h_{I^{1}} \otimes \bar{h}_{I^{2}}\right\rangle\left\langle f_{2}, \bar{h}_{I^{1}} \otimes h_{I^{2}}\right\rangle \prod_{j=3}^{m}\left\langle f_{j}\right\rangle_{I^{1} \times I^{2}} \bar{h}_{I^{1}} \otimes \bar{h}_{I^{2}}
$$

where $\bar{h}_{I^{i}}=\frac{\mathbf{1}_{I^{i}}}{|I^{i}|}, i=1,2$.
The estimate (6.52) follows from (6.51). To show (6.53), let $\mathbf{a}_{\omega}^{N}:=\left\{a_{I} \mathbf{1}_{\left\{I \notin \mathcal{D}_{\omega}(N)\right\}}\right\}_{I \in \mathcal{D}_{\omega}}$. The assumption gives

$$
\lim _{N \rightarrow \infty} \sup _{\omega}\left\|\mathbf{a}_{\omega}^{N}\right\|_{\mathrm{BMO}\left(\mathcal{D}_{\omega}\right)}=0
$$

By (6.27) and (6.51), there holds

$$
\begin{aligned}
\left\|\mathbf{F}_{\mathbf{a}_{\omega}}(\vec{f}) \mathbf{1}_{B_{R}(0, A)^{c}}\right\|_{L^{2}} & =\left\|\mathbf{F}_{\mathbf{a}_{\omega}^{N}}(\vec{f}) \mathbf{1}_{B_{R}(0, A)^{c}}\right\|_{L^{2}} \leq\left\|\mathbf{F}_{\mathbf{a}_{\omega}^{N}}(\vec{f})\right\|_{L^{2}} \\
& \lesssim \sup _{\omega}\left\|\mathbf{a}_{\omega}^{N}\right\|_{\mathrm{BMO}\left(\mathcal{D}_{\omega}\right)} \prod_{j=1}^{m}\left\|f_{j}\right\|_{L^{2 m}}
\end{aligned}
$$

which along with (6.55) yields (6.53).
Let $0<|v|=\left|v_{1}\right|+\left|v_{2}\right| \ll 2^{-4}$ and $\rho \geq 2$ be an integer chosen later. Then there exists an integer $N=N(v) \geq 2$ so that $2^{-\rho(N+1)}<|v| \leq 2^{-\rho N}$. We split

$$
\left\|\left(\tau_{v} \mathbf{F}_{\mathbf{a}_{\omega}}-\mathbf{F}_{\mathbf{a}_{\omega}}\right)(\vec{f})\right\|_{L^{2}} \leq \Upsilon_{\omega}^{1}(v ; \vec{f})+\Upsilon_{\omega}^{2}(v ; \vec{f})
$$

where

$$
\begin{aligned}
& \Upsilon_{\omega}^{1}(v ; \vec{f}):=\left\|\sum_{I \in \mathcal{D}_{\omega}(N)} a_{I}\left\langle f_{1}, h_{I^{1}} \otimes \bar{h}_{I^{2}}\right\rangle\left\langle f_{2}, \bar{h}_{I^{1}} \otimes h_{I^{2}}\right\rangle \prod_{j=3}^{m}\left\langle f_{j}\right\rangle_{I^{1} \times I^{2}} \phi_{I}^{v}\right\|_{L^{2}} \\
& \Upsilon_{\omega}^{2}(v ; \vec{f}):=\left\|\sum_{I \notin \mathcal{D}_{\omega}(N)} a_{I}\left\langle f_{1}, h_{I^{1}} \otimes \bar{h}_{I^{2}}\right\rangle\left\langle f_{2}, \bar{h}_{I^{1}} \otimes h_{I^{2}}\right\rangle \prod_{j=3}^{m}\left\langle f_{j}\right\rangle_{I^{1} \times I^{2}} \phi_{I}^{v}\right\|_{L^{2}}
\end{aligned}
$$

with $\phi_{I}^{v}:=\tau_{v}\left(\bar{h}_{I^{1}} \otimes \bar{h}_{I^{2}}\right)-\bar{h}_{I^{1}} \otimes \bar{h}_{I^{2}}$. Invoking (6.51), we arrive at

$$
\Upsilon_{\omega}^{2}(v ; \vec{f}) \leq 2\left\|\sum_{I \notin \mathcal{D}_{\omega}(N)} a_{I}\left\langle f_{1}, h_{I^{1}} \otimes \bar{h}_{I^{2}}\right\rangle\left\langle f_{2}, \bar{h}_{I^{1}} \otimes h_{I^{2}}\right\rangle \prod_{j=3}^{m}\left\langle f_{j}\right\rangle_{I^{1} \times I^{2}} \bar{h}_{I^{1}} \otimes \bar{h}_{I^{2}}\right\|_{L^{2}}
$$

$$
=2\left\|\mathbf{F}_{\mathbf{a}_{\omega}^{N}}(\vec{f})\right\|_{L^{2}} \lesssim \sup _{\omega \in \Omega}\left\|\mathbf{a}_{\omega}^{N}\right\|_{\operatorname{BMO}\left(\mathcal{D}_{\omega}\right)} \prod_{j=1}^{m}\left\|f_{j}\right\|_{L^{2 m}}
$$

where the implicit constant does not depend on $\omega$. Thus, (6.55) and (6.57) imply

$$
\lim _{|v| \rightarrow 0} \sup _{\omega} \sup _{\substack{\left\|f_{j}\right\|_{L^{2 m}} \leq 1 \\ j=1, \ldots, m}} \Upsilon_{\omega}^{2}(v ; \vec{f})=0
$$

To proceed, note that

$$
\sum_{I \in \mathcal{D}_{\omega}: I \subset U}\left|a_{I}\right|^{2} \leq\left\|\mathbf{a}_{\omega}\right\|_{\mathrm{BMO}\left(\mathcal{D}_{\omega}\right)}^{2}|U| \leq|U|
$$

for all open sets $U \subset \mathbb{R}^{n_{1}} \times \mathbb{R}^{n_{2}}$ with $0<|U|<\infty$, and

$$
\begin{aligned}
\left\|\phi_{I}^{v}\right\|_{L^{2}} & \leq\left\|\tau_{v_{1}} \bar{h}_{I^{1}}-\bar{h}_{I^{1}}\right\|_{L^{2}}\left\|\tau_{v_{2}} \bar{h}_{I^{2}}\right\|_{L^{2}}+\left\|\bar{h}_{I^{1}}\right\|_{L^{2}}\left\|\tau_{v_{2}} \bar{h}_{I^{2}}-\bar{h}_{I^{2}}\right\|_{L^{2}} \\
& \lesssim\left|v_{1}\right|^{\frac{1}{2}} \ell\left(I^{1}\right)^{-\frac{n_{1}}{2}-\frac{1}{2}} \ell\left(I^{1}\right)^{\frac{n_{1}}{2}}+\left|v_{2}\right|^{\frac{1}{2}} \ell\left(I^{2}\right)^{-\frac{n_{2}}{2}-\frac{1}{2}} \ell\left(I^{2}\right)^{\frac{n_{2}}{2}}
\end{aligned}
$$

Hence, it follows from the Cauchy-Schwarz inequality, (6.31), (6.59), and Lemma 2.16 that

$$
\begin{aligned}
\Upsilon_{\omega}^{1}(v ; \vec{f}) & \leq \sum_{I \in \mathcal{D}_{\omega}(N)}\left|a_{I}\right||I|^{\frac{1}{2}} \prod_{j=1}^{m}\left\langle\left|f_{j}\right|\right\rangle_{I}\left\|\phi_{I}^{v}\right\|_{L^{2}} \\
& \lesssim|v|^{\frac{1}{2}} 2^{\frac{N}{2}\left(n_{1}+n_{2}+1\right)} \sum_{I \in \mathcal{D}_{\omega}(N)}\left|a_{I}\right| \prod_{j=1}^{m}\left\langle\left|f_{j}\right|\right\rangle_{I} \\
& \lesssim|v|^{\frac{1}{2}} 2^{\frac{N}{2}\left(n_{1}+n_{2}+1\right)}\left[\# \mathcal{D}_{\omega}(N)\right]^{\frac{1}{2}}\left[\sum_{I \in \mathcal{D}} \prod_{j=1}^{m}\left|a_{I}\right|^{\frac{2}{m}}\left\langle\left|f_{j}\right|^{m}\right\rangle_{I}^{\frac{2}{2}}\right]^{\frac{1}{2}} \\
& \lesssim|v|^{\frac{1}{2}} 2^{\frac{N}{2}\left(n_{1}+n_{2}+1\right)} 2^{\frac{N}{2}\left(3 n_{1}+3 n_{2}\right)} \prod_{j=1}^{m}\left[\sum_{I \in \mathcal{D}}\left|a_{I}\right|^{2}\left\langle\left|f_{j}\right|^{m}\right\rangle_{I}^{2}\right]^{\frac{1}{2 m}} \\
& \lesssim 2^{\frac{N}{2}\left(4 n_{1}+4 n_{2}+1-\rho\right)} \prod_{j=1}^{m}\left\|M_{\mathcal{R}}\left(\left|f_{j}\right|^{m}\right)\right\|_{L^{2}}^{\frac{1}{2}} \\
& \lesssim 2^{\frac{N}{2}\left(4 n_{1}+4 n_{2}+1-\rho\right)} \prod_{j=1}^{m}\left\|f_{j}\right\|_{L^{2 m}}
\end{aligned}
$$

where we have used that $M_{\mathcal{R}}$ is bounded on $L^{p}\left(\mathbb{R}^{n_{1}} \times \mathbb{R}^{n_{2}}\right)$ for any $p \in(1, \infty)$. Picking $\rho>4 n_{1}+4 n_{2}+1$, the above leads to

$$
\lim _{|v| \rightarrow 0} \sup _{\omega} \sup _{\substack{\left\|f_{j}\right\|_{L^{2 m}} \leq 1 \\ j=1, \ldots, m}} \Upsilon_{\omega}^{1}(v ; \vec{f})=0
$$

Therefore, (6.54) is a consequence of (6.56)-(6.61). This completes the proof.

# 7. MEAN CONTINUITY OF COMMUTATORS 

In this section we aim to demonstrate Theorem 1.7. Our analysis is based on the size of dyadic cubes and the cancellation of Haar functions.
7.1. Commutators of shifts. First, let us show the mean continuity of $\left[\boldsymbol{b}, \mathbb{E}_{\omega} \mathbb{S}_{\mathcal{D}_{\omega}}^{k}\right]_{\boldsymbol{\alpha}}$. Let $\boldsymbol{\alpha} \in \mathbb{N}^{m} \backslash\{0\}^{m}$ and $\boldsymbol{b}=\left(b_{1}, \ldots, b_{m}\right) \in \operatorname{cmo}\left(\mathbb{R}^{n_{1}} \times \mathbb{R}^{n_{2}}\right)^{m}$. It follows from (6.22) and Theorem 8.21 that

$$
\sup _{\omega}\left\|\left[\boldsymbol{b}, \mathbb{S}_{\mathcal{D}_{\omega}}^{k}\right]_{\boldsymbol{\alpha}}(\vec{f})\right\|_{L^{r}\left(v^{r}\right)} \lesssim \prod_{j=1}^{m}\left\|b_{j}\right\|_{\mathrm{tmo}}^{\alpha_{j}}\left\|f_{j}\right\|_{L^{r_{j}}\left(v_{j}^{r_{j}}\right)}
$$

for all $\vec{r}=\left(r_{1}, \ldots, r_{m}\right) \in(1, \infty]^{m}$ and $\vec{v}=\left(v_{1}, \ldots, v_{m}\right) \in A_{\vec{r}}\left(\mathbb{R}^{n_{1}} \times \mathbb{R}^{n_{2}}\right)$, where $\frac{1}{r}=\sum_{j=1}^{m} \frac{1}{r_{j}}>0$ and $v=\prod_{j=1}^{m} v_{j}$. In view of (6.22) and Theorem 1.8, it suffices to prove

$$
\left[\boldsymbol{b}, \mathbb{E}_{\omega} \mathbb{S}_{\mathcal{D}_{\omega}}^{k}\right]_{\boldsymbol{\alpha}} \text { is mean continuous from }
$$

$$
L^{p_{1}}\left(\mathbb{R}^{n_{1}} \times \mathbb{R}^{n_{2}}\right) \times \cdots \times L^{p_{m}}\left(\mathbb{R}^{n_{1}} \times \mathbb{R}^{n_{2}}\right) \text { to } L^{p}\left(\mathbb{R}^{n_{1}} \times \mathbb{R}^{n_{2}}\right)
$$

for some $\vec{p}=\left(p_{1}, \ldots, p_{m}\right) \in(1, \infty)^{m}$ with $\frac{1}{p}=\sum_{j=1}^{m} \frac{1}{p_{j}} \in(0,1)$.
In light of (7.1) and that $\operatorname{cmo}\left(\mathbb{R}^{n_{1}} \times \mathbb{R}^{n_{2}}\right)=\overline{\mathscr{C}_{c}^{\infty}\left(\mathbb{R}^{n_{1}} \times \mathbb{R}^{n_{2}}\right)^{\mathrm{tmo}}}$, we may assume that $\boldsymbol{b} \in \mathscr{C}_{c}^{\infty}\left(\mathbb{R}^{n_{1}} \times \mathbb{R}^{n_{2}}\right)^{m}$.

We claim that for each $i \in\{1, \ldots, m\}$,

$$
\lim _{\|v\| \rightarrow 0} \sup _{\substack{\|f_{j}\|_{L^{p_{j}} \leq 1 \\ j=1, \ldots, m}}} \sup _{\omega}\left\|\left(\tau_{v}-\tau_{v_{1}}-\tau_{v_{2}}+I\right)\left[\boldsymbol{b}, \mathbb{S}_{\mathcal{D}_{\omega}}^{k}\right]_{e_{i}}(\vec{f})\right\|_{L^{p}}=0
$$

for some $p, p_{1}, \ldots, p_{m} \in(1, \infty)$ satisfying $\frac{1}{p}=\sum_{j=1}^{m} \frac{1}{p_{j}}$. Assuming (7.3) holds momentarily, let us conclude (7.2) as follows. For any $i_{1}, i_{2} \in\{1, \ldots, m\}$, there holds

$$
\left[\boldsymbol{b},\left[\boldsymbol{b}, \mathbb{S}_{\mathcal{D}_{\omega}}^{k}\right]_{e_{i_{1}}}\right]_{e_{i_{2}}}(\vec{f})=b_{i_{2}}\left[\boldsymbol{b}, \mathbb{S}_{\mathcal{D}_{\omega}}^{k}\right]_{e_{i_{1}}}(\vec{f})-\left[\boldsymbol{b}, \mathbb{S}_{\mathcal{D}_{\omega}}^{k}\right]_{e_{i_{1}}}\left(f_{1}, \ldots, b_{i_{2}} f_{i_{2}}, \ldots, f_{m}\right)
$$

which gives

$$
\left(\tau_{v}-\tau_{v_{1}}-\tau_{v_{2}}+I\right)\left[\boldsymbol{b},\left[\boldsymbol{b}, \mathbb{S}_{\mathcal{D}_{\omega}}^{k}\right]_{e_{i_{1}}}\right]_{e_{i_{2}}}(\vec{f})=\mathscr{L}_{1}(\vec{f})+\mathscr{L}_{2}(\vec{f})-\mathscr{L}_{3}(\vec{f})
$$

where

$$
\begin{aligned}
\mathscr{L}_{1}(\vec{f}):= & \tau_{v} b_{i_{2}}\left(\tau_{v}-\tau_{v_{1}}-\tau_{v_{2}}+I\right)\left[\boldsymbol{b}, \mathbb{S}_{\mathcal{D}_{\omega}}^{k}\right]_{e_{i_{1}}}(\vec{f}) \\
\mathscr{L}_{2}(\vec{f}):= & \left(\tau_{v} b_{i_{2}}-\tau_{v_{1}} b_{i_{2}}\right) \tau_{v_{1}}\left[\boldsymbol{b}, \mathbb{S}_{\mathcal{D}_{\omega}}^{k}\right]_{e_{i_{1}}}(\vec{f}) \\
& +\left(\tau_{v} b_{i_{2}}-\tau_{v_{2}} b_{i_{2}}\right) \tau_{v_{2}}\left[\boldsymbol{b}, \mathbb{S}_{\mathcal{D}_{\omega}}^{k}\right]_{e_{i_{1}}}(\vec{f})-\left(\tau_{v} b_{i_{2}}-b_{i_{2}}\right)\left[\boldsymbol{b}, \mathbb{S}_{\mathcal{D}_{\omega}}^{k}\right]_{e_{i_{1}}}(\vec{f}) \\
\mathscr{L}_{3}(\vec{f}):= & \left(\tau_{v}-\tau_{v_{1}}-\tau_{v_{2}}+I\right)\left[\boldsymbol{b}, \mathbb{S}_{\mathcal{D}_{\omega}}^{k}\right]_{e_{i_{1}}}\left(f_{1}, \ldots, b_{i_{2}} f_{i_{2}}, \ldots, f_{m}\right)
\end{aligned}
$$

Then given $\varepsilon>0$, by (7.1) and (7.3), there exists some $\delta_{0}=\delta_{0}(\varepsilon)>0$ such that for any $0<|v|<\delta_{0}$,

$$
\left\|\mathscr{L}_{1}(\vec{f})\right\|_{L^{p}} \leq\left\|b_{i_{2}}\right\|_{L^{\infty}}\left\|\left(\tau_{v}-\tau_{v_{1}}-\tau_{v_{2}}+I\right)\left[\boldsymbol{b}, \mathbb{S}_{\mathcal{D}_{\omega}}^{k}\right]_{e_{i_{1}}}(\vec{f})\right\|_{L^{p}} \lesssim \varepsilon \prod_{j=1}^{m}\left\|f_{j}\right\|_{L^{p_{j}}}
$$

$$
\left\|\mathscr{L}_{2}(\vec{f})\right\|_{L^{p}} \leq 3|v|\left\|\nabla b_{i_{2}}\right\|_{L^{\infty}}\left\|\left[\boldsymbol{b}, \mathbb{S}_{\mathcal{D}_{\omega}}^{k}\right]_{e_{i_{1}}}(\vec{f})\right\|_{L^{p}} \lesssim \varepsilon \prod_{j=1}^{m}\left\|f_{j}\right\|_{L^{p_{j}}}
$$

and

$$
\left\|\mathscr{L}_{3}(\vec{f})\right\|_{L^{p}} \lesssim \varepsilon\left\|b_{i_{2}} f_{i_{2}}\right\|_{L^{p_{i_{2}}}} \prod_{j \neq i_{2}}\left\|f_{j}\right\|_{L^{p_{j}}} \lesssim \varepsilon \prod_{j=1}^{m}\left\|f_{j}\right\|_{L^{p_{j}}}
$$

where the implicit constants are independent of $\varepsilon, v, \omega$, and $\vec{f}$. Hence, by (7.4)-(7.7),

$$
\lim _{\substack{|v| \rightarrow 0}} \sup _{\substack{\left\|f_{j}\right\|_{L^{p_{j}} \leq 1 \\ j=1, \ldots, m}}} \sup _{\omega}}\left\|\left(\tau_{v}-\tau_{v_{1}}-\tau_{v_{2}}+I\right)\left[\boldsymbol{b},\left[\boldsymbol{b}, \mathbb{S}_{\mathcal{D}_{\omega}}^{k}\right]_{e_{i_{1}}}\right]_{e_{i_{2}}}(\vec{f})\right\|_{L^{p}}=0
$$

By induction and the same technique as above, we eventually obtain that for any $\boldsymbol{\alpha} \in \mathbb{N}^{m} \backslash\{0\}^{m}$,

$$
\lim _{\substack{|v| \rightarrow 0}} \sup _{\substack{\left\|f_{j}\right\|_{L^{p_{j}} \leq 1 \\ j=1, \ldots, m}}} \sup _{\omega}}\left\|\left(\tau_{v}-\tau_{v_{1}}-\tau_{v_{2}}+I\right)\left[\boldsymbol{b}, \mathbb{S}_{\mathcal{D}_{\omega}}^{k}\right]_{\boldsymbol{\alpha}}\right\|(\vec{f})\right\|_{L^{p}}=0
$$

which along with (7.1) and Minkowski's inequality implies (7.2) as desired.
It remains to verify (7.3). By symmetry, it is enough to show the case $i=1$. Let $\operatorname{supp}\left(b_{1}\right) \subset B_{\vec{n}}\left(0,2^{N_{0}}\right)$ for some $N_{0} \geq 4$. Choose

$$
\begin{aligned}
& 1<p<p_{1}<\min \left\{\frac{n_{1}}{n_{1}-1}, \frac{n_{2}}{n_{2}-1}\right\} \quad \text { and } \\
& 0<\gamma<\min \left\{1, p\left(1-n_{1} / p_{1}^{\prime}\right), p\left(1-n_{2} / p_{2}^{\prime}\right)\right\}
\end{aligned}
$$

Then pick $p_{2}, \ldots, p_{m} \in(1, \infty)$ such that $\frac{1}{p}=\sum_{j=1}^{m} \frac{1}{p_{j}}$. Observe that there exists a finite collection of dyadic rectangles $\left\{P_{\kappa}=P_{\kappa}^{1} \times P_{\kappa}^{2}\right\}_{\kappa=1}^{\kappa_{0}} \subset \mathcal{D}_{\omega}$ such that $\ell\left(P_{\kappa}^{1}\right)=$ $\ell\left(P_{\kappa}^{2}\right)=2^{N_{0}}, P_{\kappa} \cap B_{\vec{n}}\left(0,2^{N_{0}}\right) \neq \varnothing, \kappa=1, \ldots, \kappa_{0}$, and

$$
\operatorname{supp}\left(b_{1}\right) \subset B_{\vec{n}}\left(0,2^{N_{0}}\right) \subset \bigcup_{\kappa=1}^{\kappa_{0}} P_{\kappa} \subset B_{\vec{n}}(0, A / 2)
$$

where $\kappa_{0}$ is a universal integer.
Let $v=\left(v_{1}, v_{2}\right) \in \mathbb{R}^{n_{1}} \times \mathbb{R}^{n_{2}}$ with $0<|v|=\left|v_{1}\right|+\left|v_{2}\right|<1$. Note that

$$
\begin{aligned}
& \left(\tau_{v}-\tau_{v_{1}}-\tau_{v_{2}}+I\right)\left(b_{1} \cdot \widetilde{h}_{I^{1}} \otimes \widetilde{h}_{I^{2}}\right) \\
& =b_{1} \cdot\left(\tau_{v_{1}} \widetilde{h}_{I^{1}}-\widetilde{h}_{I^{1}}\right) \otimes\left(\tau_{v_{2}} \widetilde{h}_{I^{2}}-\widetilde{h}_{I^{2}}\right)-\left(b_{1}-\tau_{v} b_{1}\right) \cdot \tau_{v}\left(\widetilde{h}_{I^{1}} \otimes \widetilde{h}_{I^{2}}\right) \\
& \quad+\left(b_{1}-\tau_{v_{1}} b_{1}\right) \cdot \tau_{v_{1}} \widetilde{h}_{I^{1}} \otimes \widetilde{h}_{I^{2}}+\left(b_{1}-\tau_{v_{2}} b_{1}\right) \cdot \tau_{v_{2}} \widetilde{h}_{I^{1}} \otimes \widetilde{h}_{I^{2}}
\end{aligned}
$$

and

$$
\left(\tau_{v}-\tau_{v_{1}}-\tau_{v_{2}}+I\right)\left(\widetilde{h}_{I^{1}} \otimes \widetilde{h}_{I^{2}}\right)=\left(\tau_{v_{1}} \widetilde{h}_{I^{1}}-\widetilde{h}_{I^{1}}\right) \otimes\left(\tau_{v_{2}} \widetilde{h}_{I^{2}}-\widetilde{h}_{I^{2}}\right)
$$

For convenience, simply denote

$$
\widetilde{a}_{\left(I_{j}\right), Q}:=a_{\left(I_{j}\right), Q} \prod_{j=2}^{m}\left\langle f_{j}, \widetilde{h}_{I_{j}^{1}} \otimes \widetilde{h}_{I_{j}^{2}}\right\rangle \quad \text { and } \quad \sum_{Q}:=\sum_{Q \in \mathcal{D}_{\omega}} \sum_{\substack{I_{j} \in \mathcal{D}_{\omega, k_{j}}(Q) \\ j=1, \ldots, m+1}} .
$$

Then we arrive at

$$
\left(\tau_{v}-\tau_{v_{1}}-\tau_{v_{2}}+I\right)\left[\boldsymbol{b}, \mathbb{S}_{\mathcal{D}_{\omega}}^{k}\right](\vec{f})=\Gamma^{0}(\vec{f})+\Gamma^{1}(\vec{f})-\Gamma^{2}(\vec{f})
$$

where

$$
\begin{aligned}
& \Gamma^{0}(\vec{f}):=-\left(b_{1}-\tau_{v} b_{1}\right) \tau_{v} \mathbb{S}_{\mathcal{D}_{\omega}}^{k}(\vec{f})+\left(b_{1}-\tau_{v_{1}} b_{1}\right) \tau_{v_{1}} \mathbb{S}_{\mathcal{D}_{\omega}}^{k}(\vec{f})+\left(b_{1}-\tau_{v_{2}} b_{1}\right) \tau_{v_{2}} \mathbb{S}_{\mathcal{D}_{\omega}}^{k}(\vec{f}) \\
& \Gamma^{1}(\vec{f}):=\sum_{Q} \widetilde{a}_{\left(I_{j}\right), Q} b_{1}\left\langle f_{1}, \widetilde{h}_{I_{1}^{1}} \otimes \widetilde{h}_{I_{1}^{2}}\right\rangle\left(\tau_{v_{1}} \widetilde{h}_{I_{m+1}^{1}}-\widetilde{h}_{I_{m+1}^{1}}\right) \otimes\left(\tau_{v_{2}} \widetilde{h}_{I_{m+1}^{2}}-\widetilde{h}_{I_{m+1}^{2}}\right) \\
& \Gamma^{2}(\vec{f}):=\sum_{Q} \widetilde{a}_{\left(I_{j}\right), Q}\left\langle b_{1} f_{1}, \widetilde{h}_{I_{1}^{1}} \otimes \widetilde{h}_{I_{1}^{2}}\right\rangle\left(\tau_{v_{1}} \widetilde{h}_{I_{m+1}^{1}}-\widetilde{h}_{I_{m+1}^{1}}\right) \otimes\left(\tau_{v_{2}} \widetilde{h}_{I_{m+1}^{2}}-\widetilde{h}_{I_{m+1}^{2}}\right)
\end{aligned}
$$

The inequality (6.22) implies

$$
\left\|\Gamma^{0}(\vec{f})\right\|_{L^{p}} \leq\left(|v|+\left|v_{1}\right|+\left|v_{2}\right|\right)\left\|\nabla b_{1}\right\|_{L^{\infty}}\left\|\mathbb{S}_{\mathcal{D}_{\omega}}^{k}(\vec{f})\right\|_{L^{p}} \lesssim|v| \prod_{j=1}^{m}\left\|f_{j}\right\|_{L^{p_{j}}}
$$

where the implicit constant is independent of $\omega, v$, and $\vec{f}$.
To bound $\Gamma^{1}$ and $\Gamma^{2}$, for any $x=\left(x_{1}, x_{2}\right) \in \mathbb{R}^{n_{1}} \times \mathbb{R}^{n_{2}}$, define

$$
\begin{aligned}
b_{Q}^{1}\left(x_{1}\right) & :=b_{1}\left(x_{1}, c_{Q^{2}}\right)-b_{1}\left(c_{Q^{1}}, c_{Q^{2}}\right) \\
b_{Q}^{2}\left(x_{2}\right) & :=b_{1}\left(c_{Q^{1}}, x_{2}\right)-b_{1}\left(c_{Q^{1}}, c_{Q^{2}}\right) \\
b_{Q}\left(x_{1}, x_{2}\right) & :=b_{1}\left(x_{1}, x_{2}\right)-b_{1}\left(x_{1}, c_{Q^{2}}\right)-b_{1}\left(c_{Q^{1}}, x_{2}\right)+b_{1}\left(c_{Q^{1}}, c_{Q^{2}}\right)
\end{aligned}
$$

Perform the decomposition

$$
\Gamma^{1}-\Gamma^{2}=\widetilde{\Gamma}^{1}-\widetilde{\Gamma}^{2}+\widetilde{\Gamma}^{3}-\widetilde{\Gamma}^{4}+\widetilde{\Gamma}^{5}-\widetilde{\Gamma}^{6}
$$

where

$$
\begin{aligned}
& \widetilde{\Gamma}^{1}(\vec{f}):=\sum_{Q} \widetilde{a}_{\left(I_{j}\right), Q} b_{Q}\left\langle f_{1}, \widetilde{h}_{I_{1}^{1}} \otimes \widetilde{h}_{I_{1}^{2}}\right\rangle\left(\tau_{v_{1}} \widetilde{h}_{I_{m+1}^{1}}-\widetilde{h}_{I_{m+1}^{1}}\right) \otimes\left(\tau_{v_{2}} \widetilde{h}_{I_{m+1}^{2}}-\widetilde{h}_{I_{m+1}^{2}}\right) \\
& \widetilde{\Gamma}^{2}(\vec{f}):=\sum_{Q} \widetilde{a}_{\left(I_{j}\right), Q}\left\langle b_{Q} f_{1}, \widetilde{h}_{I_{1}^{1}} \otimes \widetilde{h}_{I_{1}^{2}}\right\rangle\left(\tau_{v_{1}} \widetilde{h}_{I_{m+1}^{1}}-\widetilde{h}_{I_{m+1}^{1}}\right) \otimes\left(\tau_{v_{2}} \widetilde{h}_{I_{m+1}^{2}}-\widetilde{h}_{I_{m+1}^{2}}\right) \\
& \widetilde{\Gamma}^{3}(\vec{f}):=\sum_{Q} \widetilde{a}_{\left(I_{j}\right), Q} b_{Q}^{1}\left\langle f_{1}, \widetilde{h}_{I_{1}^{1}} \otimes \widetilde{h}_{I_{1}^{2}}\right\rangle\left(\tau_{v_{1}} \widetilde{h}_{I_{m+1}^{1}}-\widetilde{h}_{I_{m+1}^{1}}\right) \otimes\left(\tau_{v_{2}} \widetilde{h}_{I_{m+1}^{2}}-\widetilde{h}_{I_{m+1}^{2}}\right) \\
& \widetilde{\Gamma}^{4}(\vec{f}):=\sum_{Q} \widetilde{a}_{\left(I_{j}\right), Q}\left\langle b_{Q}^{1} f_{1}, \widetilde{h}_{I_{1}^{1}} \otimes \widetilde{h}_{I_{1}^{2}}\right\rangle\left(\tau_{v_{1}} \widetilde{h}_{I_{m+1}^{1}}-\widetilde{h}_{I_{m+1}^{1}}\right) \otimes\left(\tau_{v_{2}} \widetilde{h}_{I_{m+1}^{2}}-\widetilde{h}_{I_{m+1}^{2}}\right) \\
& \widetilde{\Gamma}^{5}(\vec{f}):=\sum_{Q} \widetilde{a}_{\left(I_{j}\right), Q} b_{Q}^{2}\left\langle f_{1}, \widetilde{h}_{I_{1}^{1}} \otimes \widetilde{h}_{I_{1}^{2}}\right\rangle\left(\tau_{v_{1}} \widetilde{h}_{I_{m+1}^{1}}-\widetilde{h}_{I_{m+1}^{1}}\right) \otimes\left(\tau_{v_{2}} \widetilde{h}_{I_{m+1}^{2}}-\widetilde{h}_{I_{m+1}^{2}}\right) \\
& \widetilde{\Gamma}^{6}(\vec{f}):=\sum_{Q} \widetilde{a}_{\left(I_{j}\right), Q}\left\langle b_{Q}^{2} f_{1}, \widetilde{h}_{I_{1}^{1}} \otimes \widetilde{h}_{I_{1}^{2}}\right\rangle\left(\tau_{v_{1}} \widetilde{h}_{I_{m+1}^{1}}-\widetilde{h}_{I_{m+1}^{1}}\right) \otimes\left(\tau_{v_{2}} \widetilde{h}_{I_{m+1}^{2}}-\widetilde{h}_{I_{m+1}^{2}}\right) .
\end{aligned}
$$

In what follows, we will demonstrate

$$
\left\|\widetilde{\Gamma}^{i}(\vec{f})\right\|_{L^{p}} \lesssim|v|^{\frac{\gamma}{p}} \prod_{j=1}^{m}\left\|f_{j}\right\|_{L^{p_{j}}}, \quad i=1, \ldots, 6
$$

where the implicit constant is independent of $\omega, v$, and $\vec{f}$. Thus, (7.3) is a consequence of $(7.10)-(7.12)$.

- Estimates for $\widetilde{\Gamma}^{2}$. We split

$$
\widetilde{\Gamma}^{2}=\widetilde{\Gamma}_{1}^{2}+\widetilde{\Gamma}_{2}^{2}+\widetilde{\Gamma}_{3}^{2}+\widetilde{\Gamma}_{4}^{2}
$$

where

$$
\begin{aligned}
& \widetilde{\Gamma}_{1}^{2}(\vec{f}):=\sum_{\substack{Q \cap \operatorname{supp}\left(b_{1}\right) \neq \emptyset \\
\ell\left(Q^{1}\right) \leq 2^{N_{0}}} \widetilde{a}_{\left(I_{j}\right), Q}\left\langle b_{Q} f_{1}, \widetilde{h}_{I_{1}^{1}} \otimes \widetilde{h}_{I_{1}^{2}}\right\rangle\left(\tau_{v_{1}} \widetilde{h}_{I_{m+1}^{1}}-\widetilde{h}_{I_{m+1}^{1}}\right) \otimes\left(\tau_{v_{2}} \widetilde{h}_{I_{m+1}^{2}}-\widetilde{h}_{I_{m+1}^{2}}\right), \\
& \widetilde{\Gamma}_{2}^{2}(\vec{f}):=\sum_{\substack{Q \cap \operatorname{supp}\left(b_{1}\right) \neq \emptyset \\
\ell\left(Q^{1}\right) \leq 2^{N_{0}}} \widetilde{a}_{\left(I_{j}\right), Q}\left\langle b_{Q} f_{1}, \widetilde{h}_{I_{1}^{1}} \otimes \widetilde{h}_{I_{1}^{2}}\right\rangle\left(\tau_{v_{1}} \widetilde{h}_{I_{m+1}^{1}}-\widetilde{h}_{I_{m+1}^{1}}\right) \otimes\left(\tau_{v_{2}} \widetilde{h}_{I_{m+1}^{2}}-\widetilde{h}_{I_{m+1}^{2}}\right), \\
& \widetilde{\Gamma}_{3}^{2}(\vec{f}):=\sum_{\substack{Q \cap \operatorname{supp}\left(b_{1}\right) \neq \emptyset \\
\ell\left(Q^{1}\right)>2^{N_{0}}} \widetilde{a}_{\left(I_{j}\right), Q}\left\langle b_{Q} f_{1}, \widetilde{h}_{I_{1}^{1}} \otimes \widetilde{h}_{I_{1}^{2}}\right\rangle\left(\tau_{v_{1}} \widetilde{h}_{I_{m+1}^{1}}-\widetilde{h}_{I_{m+1}^{1}}\right) \otimes\left(\tau_{v_{2}} \widetilde{h}_{I_{m+1}^{2}}-\widetilde{h}_{I_{m+1}^{2}}\right), \\
& \widetilde{\Gamma}_{4}^{2}(\vec{f}):=\sum_{\substack{Q \cap \operatorname{supp}\left(b_{1}\right) \neq \emptyset \\
\ell\left(Q^{1}\right)>2^{N_{0}}} \widetilde{a}_{\left(I_{j}\right), Q}\left\langle b_{Q} f_{1}, \widetilde{h}_{I_{1}^{1}} \otimes \widetilde{h}_{I_{1}^{2}}\right\rangle\left(\tau_{v_{1}} \widetilde{h}_{I_{m+1}^{1}}-\widetilde{h}_{I_{m+1}^{1}}\right) \otimes\left(\tau_{v_{2}} \widetilde{h}_{I_{m+1}^{2}}-\widetilde{h}_{I_{m+1}^{2}}\right) .
\end{aligned}
$$

An elementary estimate gives

$$
\left|\widetilde{a}_{\left(I_{j}\right), Q}\right| \lesssim|Q|^{\frac{1}{p_{1}}-\frac{1}{p}} \prod_{j=2}^{m}\left\|f_{j}\right\|_{L^{p_{j}}}
$$

and

$$
\left\|\tau_{v_{i}} \widetilde{h}_{I^{i}}-\widetilde{h}_{I^{i}}\right\|_{L^{s}\left(\mathbb{R}^{n_{i}}\right)} \lesssim\left|I^{i}\right|^{\frac{1}{s}-\frac{1}{2}}\left[\left|v_{i}\right| / \ell\left(I^{i}\right)\right]^{\frac{\gamma}{s}}, \quad 0<\gamma \leq 1<s<\infty
$$

Then by (7.8)-(7.9) and (7.13)-(7.14),

$$
\begin{aligned}
& \left\|\widetilde{\Gamma}_{1}^{2}(\vec{f})\right\|_{L^{p}} \lesssim \sum_{\kappa=1}^{n_{0}} \sum_{Q \subset P_{\kappa}}|Q|^{-\frac{1}{p}+\frac{1}{p_{1}}}\left\|\nabla b_{1}\right\|_{L^{\infty}} \ell\left(Q^{1}\right) \ell\left(Q^{2}\right)\left\|f_{1} \mathbf{1}_{Q}\right\|_{L^{p_{1}}}|Q|^{\frac{1}{2}-\frac{1}{p_{1}}} \\
& \times|Q|^{\frac{1}{p}-\frac{1}{2}}\left[\left|v_{1}\right| / \ell\left(Q^{1}\right)\right]^{\frac{\gamma}{p}}\left[\left|v_{2}\right| / \ell\left(Q^{2}\right)\right]^{\frac{\gamma}{p}} \prod_{j=2}^{m}\left\|f_{j}\right\|_{L^{p_{j}}} \\
& \lesssim|v|^{\frac{\gamma}{p}} \sum_{\kappa=1}^{\kappa_{0}} \sum_{\substack{s_{1}, s_{2} \geq 0 \\
\left(Q^{1}\right) \cap \tau_{1} \mid=P_{\kappa}^{1}}\left(Q^{2}\right)^{|s_{2}|}=P_{\kappa}^{2}} \ell\left(Q^{1}\right)^{1-\frac{\gamma}{p}} \ell\left(Q^{2}\right)^{1-\frac{\gamma}{p}}\left\|f_{1} \mathbf{1}_{Q}\right\|_{L^{p_{1}}} \prod_{j=2}^{m}\left\|f_{j}\right\|_{L^{p_{j}}}
\end{aligned}
$$

$$
\begin{aligned}
& \lesssim|v|^{\frac{\gamma}{p}} \sum_{s_{1}, s_{2} \geq 0} 2^{-s_{1}\left(1-\frac{\gamma}{p}-\frac{n_{1}}{p_{1}}\right)} 2^{-s_{2}\left(1-\frac{\gamma}{p}-\frac{n_{2}}{p_{1}}\right)} \prod_{j=1}^{m}\left\|f_{j}\right\|_{L^{p_{j}}} \\
& \lesssim|v|^{\frac{\gamma}{p}} \prod_{j=1}^{m}\left\|f_{j}\right\|_{L^{p_{j}}}
\end{aligned}
$$

Similarly,

$$
\begin{aligned}
& \left\|\widetilde{\Gamma}_{2}^{2}(\vec{f})\right\|_{L^{p}} \lesssim \sum_{\kappa=1}^{n_{0}} \sum_{\substack{Q^{1} \subset P_{n}^{1} \\
Q^{2} \supset P_{n}^{2}}}\left\|\nabla b_{1}\right\|_{L^{\infty}} \ell\left(Q^{1}\right)\left\|f_{1} \mathbf{1}_{Q^{1}}\right\|_{L^{p_{1}}}\left[\left|v_{1}\right| / \ell\left(Q^{1}\right)\right]^{\frac{\gamma}{\rho}}\left[\left|v_{2}\right| / \ell\left(Q^{2}\right)\right]^{\frac{\gamma}{\rho}} \prod_{j=2}^{m}\left\|f_{j}\right\|_{L^{p_{j}}} \\
& \lesssim|v|^{\frac{\gamma}{p}} \sum_{\kappa=1}^{n_{0}} \sum_{s_{1}, s_{2} \geq 0} \sum_{\substack{\left(Q^{1}\right)\left(v_{1}\right)=P_{n}^{1} \\
Q^{2}=\left(P_{n}^{2}\right)\left(v_{2}\right)}} \ell\left(Q^{1}\right)^{1-\frac{\gamma}{\rho}} \ell\left(Q^{2}\right)^{-\frac{\gamma}{\rho}}\left\|f_{1} \mathbf{1}_{Q^{1}}\right\|_{L^{p_{1}}} \prod_{j=2}^{m}\left\|f_{j}\right\|_{L^{p_{j}}} \\
& \lesssim|v|^{\frac{\gamma}{\rho}} \sum_{s_{1}, s_{2} \geq 0} 2^{-s_{1}\left(1-\frac{\gamma}{\rho}-\frac{n_{1}}{p_{1}}\right)} 2^{-s_{2} \frac{\gamma}{\rho}} \prod_{j=1}^{m}\left\|f_{j}\right\|_{L^{p_{j}}} \\
& \lesssim|v|^{\frac{\gamma}{\rho}} \prod_{j=1}^{m}\left\|f_{j}\right\|_{L^{p_{j}}}
\end{aligned}
$$

Symmetrically, one has

$$
\left\|\widetilde{\Gamma}_{3}^{2}(\vec{f})\right\|_{L^{p}} \lesssim|v|^{\frac{\gamma}{\rho}} \prod_{j=1}^{m}\left\|f_{j}\right\|_{L^{p_{j}}}
$$

Moreover,

$$
\begin{aligned}
\left\|\widetilde{\Gamma}_{4}^{2}(\vec{f})\right\|_{L^{p}} & \lesssim \sum_{\kappa=1}^{\kappa_{0}} \sum_{\substack{Q^{1} \supset P_{n}^{1} \\
Q^{2} \supset P_{n}^{2}}}\left\|b_{1}\right\|_{L^{\infty}}\left[\left|v_{1}\right| / \ell\left(Q^{1}\right)\right]^{\frac{\gamma}{\rho}}\left[\left|v_{2}\right| / \ell\left(Q^{2}\right)\right]^{\frac{\gamma}{\rho}} \prod_{j=1}^{m}\left\|f_{j}\right\|_{L^{p_{j}}} \\
& \lesssim|v|^{\frac{\gamma}{\rho}} \sum_{s_{1}, s_{2} \geq 0} 2^{-s_{1} \frac{\gamma}{\rho}} 2^{-s_{2} \frac{\gamma}{\rho}} \prod_{j=1}^{m}\left\|f_{j}\right\|_{L^{p_{j}}} \lesssim|v|^{\frac{\gamma}{\rho}} \prod_{j=1}^{m}\left\|f_{j}\right\|_{L^{p_{j}}}
\end{aligned}
$$

Then gathering these estimates above, we obtain

$$
\left\|\widetilde{\Gamma}^{2}(\vec{f})\right\|_{L^{p}} \lesssim|v|^{\frac{\gamma}{\rho}} \prod_{j=1}^{m}\left\|f_{j}\right\|_{L^{p_{j}}}
$$

- Estimates for $\widetilde{\Gamma}^{1}$. Rewrite

$$
\widetilde{\Gamma}^{1}=\widetilde{\Gamma}_{1}^{1}+\widetilde{\Gamma}_{2}^{1}+\widetilde{\Gamma}_{3}^{1}
$$

where

$$
\widetilde{\Gamma}_{1}^{1}(\vec{f}):=\sum_{\substack{\ell\left(Q^{1}\right)>\left|v_{1}\right| \\\ell\left(Q^{2}\right)>\left|v_{2}\right|}} \widetilde{a}_{\left(I_{j}\right), Q} b_{Q}\left\langle f_{1}, \widetilde{h}_{I_{1}^{1}} \otimes \widetilde{h}_{I_{1}^{2}}\right\rangle\left(\tau_{v_{1}} \widetilde{h}_{I_{m+1}^{1}}-\widetilde{h}_{I_{m+1}^{1}}\right) \otimes\left(\tau_{v_{2}} \widetilde{h}_{I_{m+1}^{2}}-\widetilde{h}_{I_{m+1}^{2}}\right)
$$

$$
\begin{aligned}
& \widetilde{\Gamma}_{2}^{1}(\vec{f}):=\sum_{\substack{Q^{1} \in \mathcal{D}^{1} \\
\ell\left(Q^{2}\right) \leq\left|v_{2}\right|} \widetilde{a}_{\left(I_{j}\right), Q} b_{Q}\left\langle f_{1}, \widetilde{h}_{I_{1}^{1}} \otimes \widetilde{h}_{I_{1}^{2}}\right\rangle\left(\tau_{v_{1}} \widetilde{h}_{I_{m+1}^{1}}-\widetilde{h}_{I_{m+1}^{1}}\right) \otimes\left(\tau_{v_{2}} \widetilde{h}_{I_{m+1}^{2}}-\widetilde{h}_{I_{m+1}^{2}}\right), \\
& \widetilde{\Gamma}_{3}^{1}(\vec{f}):=\sum_{\substack{\left.\ell\left(Q^{1}\right) \leq\left|v_{1}\right|\right. \\
\ell\left(Q^{2}\right)>\left|v_{2}\right|} \widetilde{a}_{\left(I_{j}\right), Q} b_{Q}\left\langle f_{1}, \widetilde{h}_{I_{1}^{1}} \otimes \widetilde{h}_{I_{1}^{2}}\right\rangle\left(\tau_{v_{1}} \widetilde{h}_{I_{m+1}^{1}}-\widetilde{h}_{I_{m+1}^{1}}\right) \otimes\left(\tau_{v_{2}} \widetilde{h}_{I_{m+1}^{2}}-\widetilde{h}_{I_{m+1}^{2}}\right) .
\end{aligned}
$$

Observe that $\operatorname{supp}\left(\left(\tau_{v_{1}} \widetilde{h}_{I_{m+1}^{1}}-\widetilde{h}_{I_{m+1}^{1}}\right) \otimes\left(\tau_{v_{2}} \widetilde{h}_{I_{m+1}^{2}}-\widetilde{h}_{I_{m+1}^{2}}\right)\right) \subset 3 Q$ whenever $I_{m+1}^{1} \times$ $I_{m+1}^{2} \subset Q^{1} \times Q^{2}=Q, \ell\left(Q^{1}\right)>\left|v_{1}\right|$, and $\ell\left(Q^{2}\right)>\left|v_{2}\right|$. Thus, as shown for $\widetilde{\Gamma}^{2}$ above,

$$
\|\widetilde{\Gamma}_{1}^{1}(\vec{f})\|_{L^{p}} \lesssim|v|^{\frac{p}{p}} \prod_{j=1}^{m}\left\|f_{j}\right\|_{L^{p_{j}}}
$$

To treat $\widetilde{\Gamma}_{2}^{1}$, we split

$$
\widetilde{\Gamma}_{2}^{1}=\widetilde{\Gamma}_{2,1}^{1}-\widetilde{\Gamma}_{2,2}^{1}-\widetilde{\Gamma}_{2,3}^{1}+\widetilde{\Gamma}_{2,4}^{1}
$$

where

$$
\begin{aligned}
& \widetilde{\Gamma}_{2,1}^{1}(\vec{f}):=\sum_{\substack{Q^{1} \in \mathcal{D}^{1} \\
\ell\left(Q^{2}\right) \leq\left|v_{2}\right|} \widetilde{a}_{\left(I_{j}\right), Q} b_{Q}\left\langle f_{1}, \widetilde{h}_{I_{1}^{1}} \otimes \widetilde{h}_{I_{1}^{2}}\right\rangle \tau_{v}\left(\widetilde{h}_{I_{m+1}^{1}} \otimes \widetilde{h}_{I_{m+1}^{2}}\right), \\
& \widetilde{\Gamma}_{2,2}^{1}(\vec{f}):=\sum_{\substack{Q^{1} \in \mathcal{D}^{1} \\
\ell\left(Q^{2}\right) \leq\left|v_{2}\right|} \widetilde{a}_{\left(I_{j}\right), Q} b_{Q}\left\langle f_{1}, \widetilde{h}_{I_{1}^{1}} \otimes \widetilde{h}_{I_{1}^{2}}\right\rangle \tau_{v_{1}} \widetilde{h}_{I_{m+1}^{1}} \otimes \widetilde{h}_{I_{m+1}^{2}}, \\
& \widetilde{\Gamma}_{2,3}^{1}(\vec{f}):=\sum_{\substack{Q^{1} \in \mathcal{D}^{1} \\
\ell\left(Q^{2}\right) \leq\left|v_{2}\right|} \widetilde{a}_{\left(I_{j}\right), Q} b_{Q}\left\langle f_{1}, \widetilde{h}_{I_{1}^{1}} \otimes \widetilde{h}_{I_{1}^{2}}\right\rangle \widetilde{h}_{I_{m+1}^{1}} \otimes \tau_{v_{2}} \widetilde{h}_{I_{m+1}^{2}}, \\
& \widetilde{\Gamma}_{2,4}^{1}(\vec{f}):=\sum_{\substack{Q^{1} \in \mathcal{D}^{1} \\
\ell\left(Q^{2}\right) \leq\left|v_{2}\right|} \widetilde{a}_{\left(I_{j}\right), Q} b_{Q}\left\langle f_{1}, \widetilde{h}_{I_{1}^{1}} \otimes \widetilde{h}_{I_{1}^{2}}\right\rangle \widetilde{h}_{I_{m+1}^{1}} \otimes \widetilde{h}_{I_{m+1}^{2}} .
\end{aligned}
$$

First, consider $\widetilde{\Gamma}_{2,4}^{1}$ :

$$
\widetilde{\Gamma}_{2,4}^{1}=\widetilde{\Gamma}_{2,4}^{1,1}-\widetilde{\Gamma}_{2,4}^{1,2}
$$

where

$$
\begin{aligned}
& \widetilde{\Gamma}_{2,4}^{1,1}(\vec{f}):=\sum_{\substack{Q^{1} \in \mathcal{D}^{1} \\
\ell\left(Q^{2}\right) \leq\left|v_{2}\right|} \widetilde{a}_{\left(I_{j}\right), Q}\left[b_{1}\left(x_{1}, x_{2}\right)-b_{1}\left(x_{1}, c_{Q^{2}}\right)\right]\left\langle f_{1}, \widetilde{h}_{I_{1}^{1}} \otimes \widetilde{h}_{I_{1}^{2}}\right\rangle \widetilde{h}_{I_{m+1}^{1}} \otimes \widetilde{h}_{I_{m+1}^{2}}, \\
& \widetilde{\Gamma}_{2,4}^{1,2}(\vec{f}):=\sum_{\substack{Q^{1} \in \mathcal{D}^{1} \\
\ell\left(Q^{2}\right) \leq\left|v_{2}\right|} \widetilde{a}_{\left(I_{j}\right), Q}\left[b_{1}\left(c_{Q^{1}}, x_{2}\right)-b_{1}\left(c_{Q^{1}}, c_{Q^{2}}\right)\right]\left\langle f_{1}, \widetilde{h}_{I_{1}^{1}} \otimes \widetilde{h}_{I_{1}^{2}}\right\rangle \widetilde{h}_{I_{m+1}^{1}} \otimes \widetilde{h}_{I_{m+1}^{2}} .
\end{aligned}
$$

Note that

$$
\left|b_{1}^{\prime}(x)\right|:=\left|b_{1}\left(x_{1}, x_{2}\right)-b_{1}\left(x_{1}, c_{Q^{2}}\right)\right| \leq\left\|\nabla b_{1}\right\|_{L^{\infty}} \ell\left(Q^{2}\right)
$$

for all $x_{1} \in \mathbb{R}^{n_{1}}$ and $x_{2} \in Q^{2}$. By (7.18) and the boundedness of $m$-linear oneparameter shift (cf. [4, Theorem 5.3] in the bilinear case), there holds

$$
\begin{aligned}
& \left\|\widetilde{\Gamma}_{2,4}^{1,1}(\vec{f})\right\|_{L^{p}} \leq \sum_{\kappa=1}^{\kappa_{0}} \sum_{\substack{I\left(Q^{2}\right) \leq\left|v_{2}\right| \\
Q^{2} \subset P_{\kappa}^{2}}}\left\|\left\|b_{1}^{\prime} \sum_{Q^{1} \in \mathcal{D}^{1}} a_{\left(I_{j}\right), Q} \prod_{j=1}^{m}\left\langle\left\langle f_{j}, \widetilde{h}_{I_{j}^{2}}\right\rangle, \widetilde{h}_{I_{j}^{1}}\right\rangle \widetilde{h}_{I_{m+1}^{1}}\right\|_{L^{p}\left(\mathbb{R}^{n_{1}}\right)} \widetilde{h}_{I_{m+1}^{2}}\right\|_{L^{p}\left(\mathbb{R}^{n_{2}}\right)} \\
& \lesssim \sum_{\kappa=1}^{\kappa_{0}} \sum_{\substack{I\left(Q^{2}\right) \leq\left|v_{2}\right| \\
Q^{2} \subset P_{\kappa}^{2}}} \ell\left(Q^{2}\right)\left[\left|Q^{2}\right|^{-m} \prod_{j=1}^{m+1}\left|I_{j}^{2}\right|^{\frac{1}{2}}\right] \prod_{j=1}^{m}\left\|\left\langle f_{j}, \widetilde{h}_{I_{j}^{2}}\right\rangle\left\|_{L^{p}\left(\mathbb{R}^{n_{1}}\right)}\right\| \widetilde{h}_{I_{m+1}^{2}}\right\|_{L^{p}\left(\mathbb{R}^{n_{2}}\right)} \\
& \lesssim|v|^{\frac{\gamma}{p}} \sum_{\kappa=1}^{\kappa_{0}} \sum_{Q^{2} \subset P_{\kappa}^{2}} \ell\left(Q^{2}\right)^{1-\frac{\gamma}{p}}\left\|f_{1} \mathbf{1}_{Q^{2}}\right\|_{L^{p_{1}}} \prod_{j=2}^{m}\left\|f_{j}\right\|_{L^{p_{j}}} \\
& \lesssim|v|^{\frac{\gamma}{p}} \sum_{\kappa=1}^{\kappa_{0}} \sum_{s_{2} \geq 0} \sum_{\left(Q^{2}\right)^{1 / 2} \mid=P_{\kappa}^{2}} \ell\left(Q^{2}\right)^{1-\frac{\gamma}{p}}\left\|f_{1} \mathbf{1}_{Q^{2}}\right\|_{L^{p_{1}}} \prod_{j=2}^{m}\left\|f_{j}\right\|_{L^{p_{j}}} \\
& \lesssim|v|^{\frac{\gamma}{p}} \sum_{s_{2} \geq 0} 2^{-s_{2}\left(1-\frac{\gamma}{p}-\frac{n_{2}}{p_{1}}\right)} \prod_{j=1}^{m}\left\|f_{j}\right\|_{L^{p_{j}}} \\
& \lesssim|v|^{\frac{\gamma}{p}} \prod_{j=1}^{m}\left\|f_{j}\right\|_{L^{p_{j}}}
\end{aligned}
$$

provided (7.8). If we denote

$$
a_{\left(I_{j}\right), Q}^{x_{2}}:=a_{\left(I_{j}\right), Q}\left[b_{1}\left(c_{Q^{1}}, x_{2}\right)-b_{1}\left(c_{Q^{1}}, c_{Q^{2}}\right)\right]
$$

then

$$
\sup _{x_{2} \in Q^{2}}\left|a_{\left(I_{j}\right), Q}^{x_{2}}\right| \leq\left\|\nabla b_{1}\right\|_{L^{\infty}} \ell\left(Q^{2}\right) \frac{\prod_{j=1}^{m+1}\left|I_{j}\right|^{\frac{1}{2}}}{|Q|^{m}}
$$

Using (7.19) and the same argument as above, we obtain

$$
\left\|\widetilde{\Gamma}_{2,4}^{1,2}(\vec{f})\right\|_{L^{p}} \lesssim|v|^{\frac{\gamma}{p}} \prod_{j=1}^{m}\left\|f_{j}\right\|_{L^{p_{j}}}
$$

Hence,

$$
\left\|\widetilde{\Gamma}_{2,4}^{1}(\vec{f})\right\|_{L^{p}} \leq\left\|\widetilde{\Gamma}_{2,4}^{1,1}(\vec{f})\right\|_{L^{p}}+\left\|\widetilde{\Gamma}_{2,4}^{1,2}(\vec{f})\right\|_{L^{p}} \lesssim|v|^{\frac{\gamma}{p}} \prod_{j=1}^{m}\left\|f_{j}\right\|_{L^{p_{j}}}
$$

Next, to treat $\widetilde{\Gamma}_{2,1}^{1}$, rewrite

$$
\widetilde{\Gamma}_{2,1}^{1}=\widetilde{\Gamma}_{2,1}^{1,1}+\widetilde{\Gamma}_{2,1}^{1,2}
$$

where

$$
\widetilde{\Gamma}_{2,1}^{1,1}(\vec{f}):=\sum_{\substack{Q^{1} \in \mathcal{D}^{1} \\\ell\left(Q^{2}\right) \leq\left|v_{2}\right|}} \widetilde{a}_{\left(I_{j}\right), Q} \tau_{v} b_{Q}\left\langle f_{1}, \widetilde{h}_{I_{1}^{1}} \otimes \widetilde{h}_{I_{1}^{2}}\right\rangle \tau_{v}\left(\widetilde{h}_{I_{m+1}^{1}} \otimes \widetilde{h}_{I_{m+1}^{2}}\right)
$$

$$
\widetilde{\Gamma}_{2,1}^{1,2}(\vec{f}):=\sum_{\substack{Q^{1} \in \mathcal{D}^{1} \\\ell\left(Q^{2}\right) \leq\left|v_{2}\right|}} \widetilde{a}_{\left(I_{j}\right), Q}\left(b_{Q}-\tau_{v} b_{Q}\right)\left\langle f_{1}, \widetilde{h}_{I_{1}^{1}} \otimes \widetilde{h}_{I_{1}^{2}}\right\rangle \tau_{v}\left(\widetilde{h}_{I_{m+1}^{1}} \otimes \widetilde{h}_{I_{m+1}^{2}}\right)
$$

The inequality (7.20) gives

$$
\|\widetilde{\Gamma}_{2,1}^{1,1}(\vec{f})\|_{L^{p}}=\left\|\tau_{v}\left(\widetilde{\Gamma}_{2,4}^{1}(\vec{f})\right)\right\|_{L^{p}}=\left\|\widetilde{\Gamma}_{2,4}^{1}(\vec{f})\right\|_{L^{p}} \lesssim|v|^{\frac{p}{p}} \prod_{j=1}^{m}\left\|f_{j}\right\|_{L^{p_{j}}}
$$

For $\widetilde{\Gamma}_{2,1}^{1,2}$, there holds

$$
\widetilde{\Gamma}_{2,1}^{1,2}=\widetilde{\Gamma}_{2,1}^{1,2,1}-\widetilde{\Gamma}_{2,1}^{1,2,2}-\widetilde{\Gamma}_{2,1}^{1,2,3}
$$

where

$$
\begin{aligned}
& \widetilde{\Gamma}_{2,1}^{1,2,1}(\vec{f}):=\left[b_{1}(x)-\tau_{v} b_{1}(x)\right] \sum_{\substack{Q^{1} \in \mathcal{D}^{1} \\
\ell\left(Q^{2}\right) \leq\left|v_{2}\right|}} \widetilde{a}_{\left(I_{j}\right), Q}\left\langle f_{1}, \widetilde{h}_{I_{1}^{1}} \otimes \widetilde{h}_{I_{1}^{2}}\right\rangle \tau_{v}\left(\widetilde{h}_{I_{m+1}^{1}} \otimes \widetilde{h}_{I_{m+1}^{2}}\right) \\
& \widetilde{\Gamma}_{2,1}^{1,2,2}(\vec{f}):=\sum_{\substack{Q^{1} \in \mathcal{D}^{1} \\
\ell\left(Q^{2}\right) \leq\left|v_{2}\right|}} \widetilde{a}_{\left(I_{j}\right), Q}\left[b_{1}\left(x_{1}, c_{Q^{2}}\right)-b_{1}\left(x_{1}-v_{1}, c_{Q^{2}}\right)\right]\left\langle f_{1}, \widetilde{h}_{I_{1}^{1}} \otimes \widetilde{h}_{I_{1}^{2}}\right\rangle \tau_{v}\left(\widetilde{h}_{I_{m+1}^{1}} \otimes \widetilde{h}_{I_{m+1}^{2}}\right) \\
& \widetilde{\Gamma}_{2,1}^{1,2,3}(\vec{f}):=\sum_{\substack{Q^{1} \in \mathcal{D}^{1} \\
\ell\left(Q^{2}\right) \leq\left|v_{2}\right|}} \widetilde{a}_{\left(I_{j}\right), Q}\left[b_{1}\left(c_{Q^{1}}, x_{2}\right)-b_{1}\left(c_{Q^{1}}, x_{2}-v_{2}\right)\right]\left\langle f_{1}, \widetilde{h}_{I_{1}^{1}} \otimes \widetilde{h}_{I_{1}^{2}}\right\rangle \tau_{v}\left(\widetilde{h}_{I_{m+1}^{1}} \otimes \widetilde{h}_{I_{m+1}^{2}}\right)
\end{aligned}
$$

Lemma 6.14 gives

$$
\left\|\widetilde{\Gamma}_{2,1}^{1,2,1}(\vec{f})\right\|_{L^{p}} \leq|v|\left\|\nabla b_{1}\right\|_{L^{\infty}}\left\|\sum_{\substack{Q^{1} \in \mathcal{D}^{1} \\
\ell\left(Q^{2}\right) \leq\left|v_{2}\right|}} a_{\left(I_{j}\right), Q} \prod_{j=1}^{m}\left\langle f_{j}, \widetilde{h}_{I_{j}^{1}} \otimes \widetilde{h}_{I_{j}^{2}}\right\rangle \widetilde{h}_{I_{m+1}^{1}} \otimes \widetilde{h}_{I_{m+1}^{2}}\right\|_{L^{p}} \lesssim|v| \prod_{j=1}^{m}\left\|f_{j}\right\|_{L^{p_{j}}}
$$

If we let

$$
a_{\left(I_{j}\right), Q}^{x_{2}}:=a_{\left(I_{j}\right), Q}\left[b_{1}\left(c_{Q^{1}}, x_{2}+v_{2}\right)-b_{1}\left(c_{Q^{1}}, x_{2}\right)\right]
$$

then

$$
\sup _{x_{2} \in \mathbb{R}^{n_{2}}}\left|a_{\left(I_{j}\right), Q}^{x_{2}}\right| \leq|v|\left\|\nabla b_{1}\right\|_{L^{\infty}} \frac{\prod_{j=1}^{m+1}\left|I_{j}\right|^{\frac{1}{2}}}{|Q|^{m}}
$$

Invoking (7.25) and following the proof of Lemma 6.14, we have

$$
\|\widetilde{\Gamma}_{2,1}^{1,2,3}(\vec{f})\|_{L^{p}}=\left\|\sum_{\substack{Q^{1} \in \mathcal{D}^{1} \\
\ell\left(Q^{2}\right) \leq\left|v_{2}\right|}} a_{\left(I_{j}\right), Q}^{x_{2}} \prod_{j=1}^{m}\left\langle f_{j}, \widetilde{h}_{I_{j}^{1}} \otimes \widetilde{h}_{I_{j}^{2}}\right\rangle \widetilde{h}_{I_{m+1}^{1}} \otimes \widetilde{h}_{I_{m+1}^{2}}\right\|_{L^{p}} \lesssim|v| \prod_{j=1}^{m}\left\|f_{j}\right\|_{L^{p_{j}}}
$$

Symmetrically, there holds

$$
\|\widetilde{\Gamma}_{2,1}^{1,2,2}(\vec{f})\|_{L^{p}} \lesssim|v| \prod_{j=1}^{m}\left\|f_{j}\right\|_{L^{p_{j}}}
$$

which along with (7.23), (7.24), and (7.26) gives

$$
\left\|\widetilde{\Gamma}_{2,1}^{1,2}(\vec{f})\right\|_{L^{p}} \lesssim|v| \prod_{j=1}^{m}\left\|f_{j}\right\|_{L^{p_{j}}}
$$

Then it follows from (7.21), (7.22), and (7.27) that

$$
\left\|\widetilde{\Gamma}_{2,1}^{1}(\vec{f})\right\|_{L^{p}} \lesssim|v|^{\frac{p}{p}} \prod_{j=1}^{m}\left\|f_{j}\right\|_{L^{p_{j}}}
$$

Similarly, one can show

$$
\left\|\widetilde{\Gamma}_{2,2}^{1}(\vec{f})\right\|_{L^{p}}+\left\|\widetilde{\Gamma}_{2,3}^{1}(\vec{f})\right\|_{L^{p}} \lesssim|v|^{\frac{p}{p}} \prod_{j=1}^{m}\left\|f_{j}\right\|_{L^{p_{j}}}
$$

Consequently, by (7.17), (7.20), (7.28), and (7.29),

$$
\left\|\widetilde{\Gamma}_{2}^{1}(\vec{f})\right\|_{L^{p}} \lesssim|v|^{\frac{p}{p}} \prod_{j=1}^{m}\left\|f_{j}\right\|_{L^{p_{j}}}
$$

Note that $\widetilde{\Gamma}_{3}^{1}$ is essentially symmetrical to $\widetilde{\Gamma}_{2}^{1}$ because the restriction $\ell\left(Q^{2}\right)>\left|v_{2}\right|$ contributes nothing. Hence, a similar argument as above yields

$$
\left\|\widetilde{\Gamma}_{3}^{1}(\vec{f})\right\|_{L^{p}} \lesssim|v|^{\frac{p}{p}} \prod_{j=1}^{m}\left\|f_{j}\right\|_{L^{p_{j}}}
$$

Collecting (7.15), (7.16), (7.30), and (7.31), we conclude

$$
\left\|\widetilde{\Gamma}^{1}(\vec{f})\right\|_{L^{p}} \lesssim|v|^{\frac{p}{p}} \prod_{j=1}^{m}\left\|f_{j}\right\|_{L^{p_{j}}}
$$

- Estimates for $\widetilde{\Gamma}^{3}$ and $\widetilde{\Gamma}^{4}$. Observe that

$$
\begin{aligned}
\left|\left\langle b_{Q}^{1} f_{1}, \widetilde{h}_{I_{1}^{1}}\right\rangle\right| & \leq 2\left\|b_{1}\right\|_{L^{\infty}}\left\|f_{1}\right\|_{L^{p_{1}}\left(\mathbb{R}^{n_{1}}\right)}\left\|\widetilde{h}_{I_{1}^{1}}\right\|_{L^{p_{1}^{1}}\left(\mathbb{R}^{n_{1}}\right)} \\
\left|\left\langle b_{Q}^{1} f_{1}, \widetilde{h}_{I_{1}^{1}}\right\rangle\right| & \leq \ell\left(Q^{1}\right)\left\|\nabla b_{1}\right\|_{L^{\infty}}\left\|f_{1} \mathbf{1}_{Q^{1}}\right\|_{L^{p_{1}}\left(\mathbb{R}^{n_{1}}\right)}\left\|\widetilde{h}_{I_{1}^{1}}\right\|_{L^{p_{1}^{1}}\left(\mathbb{R}^{n_{1}}\right)}
\end{aligned}
$$

Set

$$
H_{Q^{1}}:=\sum_{Q^{2}: Q \cap \operatorname{supp}\left(b_{1}\right) \neq \varnothing} a_{\left\langle I_{j}\right\rangle, Q}\left\langle\left\langle b_{Q}^{1} f_{1}, \widetilde{h}_{I_{1}^{1}}\right\rangle, \widetilde{h}_{I_{1}^{2}}\right\rangle \prod_{j=2}^{m}\left\langle\left\langle f_{j}, \widetilde{h}_{I_{1}^{1}}\right\rangle, \widetilde{h}_{I_{1}^{2}}\right\rangle \widetilde{h}_{I_{m+1}^{2}}
$$

In view of (7.8), (7.14), and (7.32)-(7.33), we follow the proof of [4, Theorem 5.3] to arrive at

$$
\begin{aligned}
\left\|\widetilde{\Gamma}^{4}(\vec{f})\right\|_{L^{p}} & \lesssim\left\|\sum_{Q} \widetilde{a}_{\left(I_{j}\right), Q}\left\langle b_{Q}^{1} f_{1}, \widetilde{h}_{I_{1}^{1}} \otimes \widetilde{h}_{I_{1}^{2}}\right\rangle\left(\tau_{v_{1}} \widetilde{h}_{I_{m+1}^{1}}-\widetilde{h}_{I_{m+1}^{1}}\right) \otimes \widetilde{h}_{I_{m+1}^{2}}\right\|_{L^{p}} \\
& \leq \sum_{Q^{1}}\left\|H_{Q^{1}}\right\|_{L^{p}\left(\mathbb{R}^{n_{2}}\right)}\left\|\tau_{v_{1}} \widetilde{h}_{I_{m+1}^{1}}-\widetilde{h}_{I_{m+1}^{1}}\right\|_{L^{p}\left(\mathbb{R}^{n_{1}}\right)}
\end{aligned}
$$

$$
\begin{aligned}
& \lesssim \sum_{\kappa=1}^{\kappa_{0}} \sum_{\substack{\ell\left(Q^{1}\right)>2^{N_{0}} \\
Q^{1} \cap P_{\kappa}^{1} \neq \emptyset}}\left|Q^{1}\right|^{\frac{1-m}{2}}\left\|\left\|f_{1}\right\|_{L^{p_{1}}\left(\mathbb{R}^{n_{1}}\right)}\right\|_{L^{p_{1}}\left(\mathbb{R}^{n_{2}}\right)}\left\|\widetilde{h}_{I_{1}^{1}}\right\|_{L^{p_{1}^{1}}\left(\mathbb{R}^{n_{1}}\right)} \\
& \times \prod_{j=2}^{m}\left\|\left\langle f_{j}, \widetilde{h}_{I_{j}^{1}}\right\rangle\right\|_{L^{p_{j}}\left(\mathbb{R}^{n_{2}}\right)}\left\|\tau_{v_{1}} \widetilde{h}_{I_{m+1}^{1}}-\widetilde{h}_{I_{m+1}^{1}}\right\|_{L^{p}\left(\mathbb{R}^{n_{1}}\right)} \\
& +\sum_{\kappa=1}^{\kappa_{0}} \sum_{\substack{\ell\left(Q^{1}\right) \leq 2^{N_{0}} \\
Q^{1} \cap P_{\kappa}^{1} \neq \emptyset}}\left|Q^{1}\right|^{\frac{1-m}{2}} \ell\left(Q^{1}\right)\left\|\left\|f_{1} \mathbf{1}_{Q^{1}}\right\|_{L^{p_{1}}\left(\mathbb{R}^{n_{1}}\right)}\right\|_{L^{p_{1}}\left(\mathbb{R}^{n_{2}}\right)}\left\|\widetilde{h}_{I_{1}^{1}}\right\|_{L^{p_{1}^{1}}\left(\mathbb{R}^{n_{1}}\right)} \\
& \times \prod_{j=2}^{m}\left\|\left\langle f_{j}, \widetilde{h}_{I_{j}^{1}}\right\rangle\right\|_{L^{p_{j}}\left(\mathbb{R}^{n_{2}}\right)}\left\|\tau_{v_{1}} \widetilde{h}_{I_{m+1}^{1}}-\widetilde{h}_{I_{m+1}^{1}}\right\|_{L^{p}\left(\mathbb{R}^{n_{1}}\right)} \\
& \lesssim\left|v_{1}\right|^{\frac{\gamma}{p}} \sum_{\kappa=1}^{\kappa_{0}} \sum_{Q^{1} \supset P_{\kappa}^{1}} \ell\left(Q^{1}\right)^{-\frac{\gamma}{p}} \prod_{j=1}^{m}\left\|f_{j}\right\|_{L^{p_{j}}} \\
& +\left|v_{1}\right|^{\frac{\gamma}{p}} \sum_{\kappa=1}^{\kappa_{0}} \sum_{Q^{1} \subset P_{\kappa}^{1}} \ell\left(Q^{1}\right)^{1-\frac{\gamma}{p}}\left\|f_{1} \mathbf{1}_{Q^{1}}\right\|_{L^{p_{1}}} \prod_{j=2}^{m}\left\|f_{j}\right\|_{L^{p_{j}}} \\
& \lesssim|v|^{\frac{\gamma}{p}}\left[\sum_{s_{1} \geq 0} 2^{-s_{1} \frac{\gamma}{p}}+\sum_{s_{1} \geq 0} 2^{-s_{1}\left(1-\frac{\gamma}{p}-\frac{n_{1}}{p_{1}}\right)}\right] \prod_{j=1}^{m}\left\|f_{j}\right\|_{L^{p_{j}}} \\
& \lesssim|v|^{\frac{\gamma}{p}} \prod_{j=1}^{m}\left\|f_{j}\right\|_{L^{p_{j}}}
\end{aligned}
$$

where the implicit constants are independent of $\omega, v$, and $\vec{f}$.
In order to dominate $\widetilde{\Gamma}^{3}$, it suffices to treat

$$
\widetilde{\Gamma}_{0}^{3}(\vec{f}):=\sum_{Q} \widetilde{a}_{\left(I_{j}\right), Q} b_{Q}^{1}\left\langle f_{1}, \widetilde{h}_{I_{1}^{1}} \otimes \widetilde{h}_{I_{1}^{2}}\right\rangle\left(\tau_{v_{1}} \widetilde{h}_{I_{m+1}^{1}}-\widetilde{h}_{I_{m+1}^{1}}\right) \otimes \widetilde{h}_{I_{m+1}^{2}}
$$

which can be split into

$$
\widetilde{\Gamma}_{0}^{3}=\widetilde{\Gamma}_{1}^{3}+\widetilde{\Gamma}_{2}^{3}+\widetilde{\Gamma}_{3}^{3}-\widetilde{\Gamma}_{4}^{3}
$$

where
$\widetilde{\Gamma}_{1}^{3}(\vec{f}):=\sum_{\substack{\ell\left(Q^{1}\right)>\left|v_{1}\right| \\ Q^{2} \in \mathcal{D}^{2}}} \widetilde{a}_{\left(I_{j}\right), Q} b_{Q}^{1}\left\langle f_{1}, \widetilde{h}_{I_{1}^{1}} \otimes \widetilde{h}_{I_{1}^{2}}\right\rangle\left(\tau_{v_{1}} \widetilde{h}_{I_{m+1}^{1}}-\widetilde{h}_{I_{m+1}^{1}}\right) \otimes \widetilde{h}_{I_{m+1}^{2}}$,
$\widetilde{\Gamma}_{2}^{3}(\vec{f}):=\sum_{\substack{\ell\left(Q^{1}\right) \leq\left|v_{1}\right| \\ Q^{2} \in \mathcal{D}^{2}}} \widetilde{a}_{\left(I_{j}\right), Q} \tau_{v_{1}} b_{Q}^{1}\left\langle f_{1}, \widetilde{h}_{I_{1}^{1}} \otimes \widetilde{h}_{I_{1}^{2}}\right\rangle \tau_{v_{1}} \widetilde{h}_{I_{m+1}^{1}} \otimes \widetilde{h}_{I_{m+1}^{2}}$,
$\widetilde{\Gamma}_{3}^{3}(\vec{f}):=\sum_{\substack{\ell\left(Q^{1}\right) \leq\left|v_{1}\right| \\ Q^{2} \in \mathcal{D}^{2}}} \widetilde{a}_{\left(I_{j}\right), Q}\left[b_{1}\left(x_{1}, c_{Q^{2}}\right)-b_{1}\left(x_{1}-v_{1}, c_{Q^{2}}\right)\right]\left\langle f_{1}, \widetilde{h}_{I_{1}^{1}} \otimes \widetilde{h}_{I_{1}^{2}}\right\rangle \tau_{v_{1}} \widetilde{h}_{I_{m+1}^{1}} \otimes \widetilde{h}_{I_{m+1}^{2}}$,

$\widetilde{\Gamma}_{4}^{3}(\vec{f}):=\sum_{\substack{\ell\left(Q^{1}\right) \leq \mid v_{1} \\ Q^{2} \in \mathcal{D}^{2}}} \widetilde{a}_{\left(I_{j}\right), Q} b_{Q}^{1}\left\langle f_{1}, \widetilde{h}_{I_{j}^{1}} \otimes \widetilde{h}_{I_{j}^{2}}\right\rangle \widetilde{h}_{I_{m+1}^{1}} \otimes \widetilde{h}_{I_{m+1}^{2}}$.
Since $\operatorname{supp}\left(\tau_{v_{1}} \widetilde{h}_{I_{m+1}^{1}}-\widetilde{h}_{I_{m+1}^{1}}\right) \subset 3 Q^{1}$ for any $I_{m+1}^{1} \subset Q^{1}$ and $\ell\left(Q^{1}\right)>\left|v_{1}\right|$, a similar argument as for $\widetilde{\Gamma}^{4}$ gives

$$
\left\|\widetilde{\Gamma}_{1}^{3}(\vec{f})\right\|_{L^{p}} \lesssim|v|^{\frac{2}{p}} \prod_{j=1}^{m}\left\|f_{j}\right\|_{L^{p_{j}}}
$$

Applying the same strategy as for $\widetilde{\Gamma}_{2,1}^{1,2,2}$ in (7.26), we have

$$
\left\|\widetilde{\Gamma}_{2}^{3}(\vec{f})\right\|_{L^{p}}=\left\|\widetilde{\Gamma}_{4}^{3}(\vec{f})\right\|_{L^{p}} \lesssim|v| \prod_{j=1}^{m}\left\|f_{j}\right\|_{L^{p_{j}}} \quad \text { and } \quad\left\|\widetilde{\Gamma}_{3}^{3}(\vec{f})\right\|_{L^{p}} \lesssim|v| \prod_{j=1}^{m}\left\|f_{j}\right\|_{L^{p_{j}}}
$$

Therefore, it follows from (7.34)-(7.36) that

$$
\left\|\widetilde{\Gamma}^{3}(\vec{f})\right\|_{L^{p}} \leq 2\left\|\widetilde{\Gamma}_{0}^{3}(\vec{f})\right\|_{L^{p}} \lesssim|v|^{\frac{2}{p}} \prod_{j=1}^{m}\left\|f_{j}\right\|_{L^{p_{j}}}
$$

- Estimates for $\widetilde{\Gamma}^{5}$ and $\widetilde{\Gamma}^{6}$. Since $\widetilde{\Gamma}^{5}$ and $\widetilde{\Gamma}^{6}$ are essentially symmetrical to $\widetilde{\Gamma}^{3}$ and $\widetilde{\Gamma}^{4}$ respectively, one can follow the argument above to deduce

$$
\left\|\widetilde{\Gamma}^{5}(\vec{f})\right\|_{L^{p}}+\left\|\widetilde{\Gamma}^{6}(\vec{f})\right\|_{L^{p}} \lesssim|v|^{\frac{2}{p}} \prod_{j=1}^{m}\left\|f_{j}\right\|_{L^{p_{j}}}
$$

So far, we have completed the proof of (7.12).
7.2. Commutators of partial paraproducts. Next, we prove the mean continuity of $\left[\boldsymbol{b}, \mathbb{E}_{\omega} \mathbb{P}_{\mathcal{D}_{\omega}}^{1, k}\right] \boldsymbol{\alpha}$, and a symmetrical proof holds for $\left[\boldsymbol{b}, \mathbb{E}_{\omega} \mathbb{P}_{\mathcal{D}_{\omega}}^{2, k}\right] \boldsymbol{\alpha}$. We will adopt the same strategy as in Section 7.1, and also clarify the similarities and differences in the current scenario.

For any $k=\left(k_{1}, \ldots, k_{m+1}\right) \in \mathbb{N}^{m+1}$, a partial paraproduct $\mathbb{P}_{\mathcal{D}}^{1, k}$ can be viewed as a shift $\mathbb{S}_{\mathcal{D}}^{\mathbf{k}}$ of complexity $\mathbf{k}=\left(\left(k_{1}, 0\right), \ldots,\left(k_{m+1}, 0\right)\right)$. Indeed, by definition of partial paraproducts, there holds

$$
\left|a_{\left(I_{j}\right), Q}\right|:=\left|a_{\left(I_{j}^{1}\right), Q}\right| Q^{2}\left|^{-\frac{m}{2}}\right| \leq \frac{\prod_{j=1}^{m+1}\left|I_{j}^{1}\right|^{\frac{1}{2}}}{\left|Q^{1}\right|^{m}} \frac{\prod_{j=1}^{m+1}\left|Q^{2}\right|^{\frac{1}{2}}}{\left|Q^{2}\right|^{m}}
$$

and

$$
\mathbb{P}_{\mathcal{D}}^{1, k}(\vec{f})=\sum_{\substack{Q=Q^{1} \times Q^{2} \in \mathcal{D} \\ I_{j}^{1} \in \mathcal{D}_{k_{j}}^{1}\left(Q^{1}\right) \\ j=1, \ldots, m+1}} a_{\left(I_{j}\right), Q} \prod_{j=1}^{m}\left\langle f_{j}, \widetilde{h}_{I_{j}^{1}} \otimes \widetilde{h}_{j, Q^{2}}\right\rangle \widetilde{h}_{I_{m+1}^{1}} \otimes \widetilde{h}_{m+1, Q^{2}}
$$

where the functions $\widetilde{h}_{I_{j}^{1}}$ and $\widetilde{h}_{j, Q^{2}}$ satisfy the following: there exist two different indices $j_{0}, j_{1} \in\{1, \ldots, m+1\}$ so that $\widetilde{h}_{I_{j_{0}}^{1}}=h_{I_{j_{0}}^{1}}, \widetilde{h}_{I_{j_{1}}^{1}}=h_{I_{j_{1}}^{1}}$, and $\widetilde{h}_{I_{j}^{1}} \in\left\{h_{I_{j}^{1}}^{0}, h_{I_{j}^{1}}\right\}$ for every

$j \neq j_{0}, j_{1}$; there exists $j_{2} \in\{1, \ldots, m+1\}$ so that $\widetilde{h}_{j_{2}, Q^{2}}=h_{Q^{2}}$ and $\widetilde{h}_{j, Q^{2}}=h_{Q^{2}}^{0}$ for every $j \neq j_{2}$. Thus, $\mathbb{P}_{\mathcal{D}}^{1, k}$ coincides with a shift $\mathbb{S}_{\mathcal{D}}^{\mathbf{k}}$ with $\mathbf{k}=\left(\left(k_{1}, 0\right), \ldots,\left(k_{m+1}, 0\right)\right)$.

In view of (7.37) and (7.38), we utilize (6.34) instead of (6.22) to reduce the mean continuity to the estimate (7.3). To this end, we perform the decomposition (7.10). The term $\Gamma_{0}$ can be handled by means of (6.34). Due to (7.37), the estimates for $\widetilde{\Gamma}_{2}$ and $\widetilde{\Gamma}_{4}$ are the same as in Section 7.1. Note that $\widetilde{\Gamma}^{5}$ and $\widetilde{\Gamma}^{6}$ are essentially symmetrical to $\widetilde{\Gamma}^{3}$ and $\widetilde{\Gamma}^{4}$ respectively. Thus, it is enough to analyze $\widetilde{\Gamma}^{1}$ and $\widetilde{\Gamma}^{3}$.

Observe that $\left\|\widetilde{\Gamma}^{3} f\right\|_{L^{p}} \leq 2\left\|\widetilde{\Gamma}_{0}^{3} f\right\|_{L^{p}}$ and $\widetilde{\Gamma}_{0}^{3}=\widetilde{\Gamma}_{1}^{3}+\widetilde{\Gamma}_{2}^{3}+\widetilde{\Gamma}_{3}^{3}-\widetilde{\Gamma}_{4}^{3}$, where $\widetilde{\Gamma}_{1}^{3}$ is similar to $\widetilde{\Gamma}^{4}$, and $\widetilde{\Gamma}_{j}^{3}$ is similar to $\widetilde{\Gamma}_{2,1}^{1,2,3}$ for each $j=2,3,4$.

Since $\widetilde{\Gamma}^{1}=\widetilde{\Gamma}_{1}^{1}+\widetilde{\Gamma}_{2}^{1}+\widetilde{\Gamma}_{3}^{1}$, where $\widetilde{\Gamma}_{1}^{1}$ is similar to $\widetilde{\Gamma}^{2}$, and $\widetilde{\Gamma}_{3}^{1}$ is symmetrical to $\widetilde{\Gamma}_{2}^{1}$, in order to bound $\widetilde{\Gamma}^{1}$, it suffices to treat $\widetilde{\Gamma}_{2}^{1}=\widetilde{\Gamma}_{2,1}^{1}-\widetilde{\Gamma}_{2,2}^{1}-\widetilde{\Gamma}_{2,3}^{1}+\widetilde{\Gamma}_{2,4}^{1}$. By (7.37), the estimate for $\widetilde{\Gamma}_{2,4}^{1}=\widetilde{\Gamma}_{2,4}^{1,1}-\widetilde{\Gamma}_{2,4}^{1,2}$ remain unchanged. Since $\widetilde{\Gamma}_{2,2}^{1}$ and $\widetilde{\Gamma}_{2,3}^{1}$ are similar to $\widetilde{\Gamma}_{2,1}^{1}$, the estimate for $\widetilde{\Gamma}_{2}^{1}$ is reduced to that for $\widetilde{\Gamma}_{2,1}^{1}=\widetilde{\Gamma}_{2,1}^{1,1}+\widetilde{\Gamma}_{2,1}^{1,2}$. Note that $\widetilde{\Gamma}_{2,1}^{1,1}=\tau_{\mathrm{v}} \widetilde{\Gamma}_{2,4}^{1}$ and $\widetilde{\Gamma}_{2,1}^{1,2}=\widetilde{\Gamma}_{2,1}^{1,2,1}-\widetilde{\Gamma}_{2,1}^{1,2,2}-\widetilde{\Gamma}_{2,1}^{1,2,3}$, where $\widetilde{\Gamma}_{2,1}^{1,2,2}$ is identical to that in Section 7.1 because of the size estimate for $a_{\left(I_{j}\right), Q}(7.37)$, and $\widetilde{\Gamma}_{2,1}^{1,2,2}$ is symmetrical to $\widetilde{\Gamma}_{2,1}^{1,2,3}$. Consequently, it remains to dominate $\widetilde{\Gamma}_{2,1}^{1,2,3}$.

By changing variables, it just needs to consider

$$
\Xi(\vec{f})(x):=\sum_{\substack{Q^{1} \in \mathcal{D}^{1} \\\ell\left(Q^{2}\right) \leq\left|v_{2}\right|}} a_{\left(I_{j}^{1}\right), Q} b_{Q^{1}}\left(x_{2}\right) \prod_{j=1}^{m}\left\langle f_{j}, \widetilde{h}_{I_{j}^{1}} \otimes \bar{h}_{j, Q^{2}}\right\rangle \bar{h}_{I_{m+1}^{1}} \otimes \bar{h}_{m+1, Q^{2}}(x)
$$

where $b_{Q^{1}}\left(x_{2}\right):=b\left(c_{Q^{1}}, x_{2}+v_{2}\right)-b\left(c_{Q^{1}}, x_{2}\right)$.

- Case 1: $\bar{h}_{m+1, Q^{2}}=\frac{\mathbf{1}_{Q^{2}}}{\left|Q^{2}\right|}$. Let $f_{m+1} \in L^{p^{\prime}}\left(\mathbb{R}^{n_{1}} \times \mathbb{R}^{n_{2}}\right)$ with $\left\|f_{m+1}\right\|_{L^{p}} \leq 1$. Following the proof of [46, Theorem 6.7], we treat the quantity $\left|\left\langle\Xi(\vec{f}), f_{m+1}\right\rangle\right|$, which contains the term

$$
\left|\left\langle b_{Q^{1}} f_{m+1}, h_{Q^{1}}^{0} \otimes \frac{\mathbf{1}_{Q^{2}}}{\left|Q^{2}\right|}\right\rangle\right| \leq|v|\left\|\nabla b_{1}\right\|_{L^{\infty}}\left|Q^{1}\right|^{\frac{1}{2}} M_{\mathcal{D}} f_{m+1}(x), \quad \forall x \in Q
$$

In light of (7.39), the rest of the proof is the same as there. Thus,

$$
\|\Xi(\vec{f})\|_{L^{p}} \lesssim|v| \prod_{j=1}^{m}\left\|f_{j}\right\|_{L^{p_{j}}}
$$

where the implicit constant is independent of $\mathcal{D}, v$, and $\vec{f}$.

- Case 2: $\bar{h}_{m+1, Q^{2}}=h_{Q^{2}}$. By the assumption on partial paraproducts, we may assume $\widetilde{h}_{I_{1}^{1}}=h_{I_{1}^{1}}$. Then we see that

$$
\Xi^{1 *}(\vec{f})=\sum_{\substack{Q^{1} \in \mathcal{D}^{1} \\ I_{j}^{1} \in \mathcal{D}_{k_{j}}^{1}\left(Q^{1}\right) \\ j=1, \ldots, m+1}} h_{I_{1}^{1}} \otimes\left[\sum_{\ell\left(Q^{2}\right) \leq\left|v_{2}\right|} a_{\left(I_{j}^{1}\right), Q}\left\langle b_{Q^{1}}\left\langle f_{1}, \bar{h}_{I_{m+1}^{1}}\right\rangle, h_{Q^{2}}\right\rangle \prod_{j=2}^{m}\left\langle\left\langle f_{j}, \bar{h}_{I_{j}^{1}}\right\rangle, \bar{h}_{j, Q^{2}}\right\rangle \bar{h}_{1, Q^{2}}\right]
$$

By duality, it suffices to show

$$
\left\|\Xi^{1 *}(\vec{f})\right\|_{L^{r}} \lesssim|v| \prod_{j=1}^{m}\left\|f_{j}\right\|_{L^{r_{j}}}
$$

for all $r, r_{1}, \ldots, r_{m} \in(1, \infty)$ satisfying $\frac{1}{r}=\sum_{j=1}^{m} \frac{1}{r_{j}}$, where the implicit constant is independent of $\mathcal{D}, v$, and $\vec{f}$.

To proceed, we define an $m$-linear one-parameter paraproduct on $\mathbb{R}^{n_{2}}$ :

$$
\Pi_{a}(\vec{g}):=\sum_{Q^{2} \in \mathcal{D}^{2}} a_{Q^{2}} \prod_{j=1}^{m}\left(g_{j}, \bar{h}_{j, Q^{2}}\right\rangle_{I} \bar{h}_{m+1, Q^{2}}
$$

where there exists a unique $j_{0} \in\{1, \ldots, m+1\}$ so that $\bar{h}_{j_{0}, Q^{2}}=h_{Q^{2}}$ and $\bar{h}_{j, Q^{2}}=\frac{\mathbf{1}_{Q^{2}}}{\left\|Q^{2}\right\|}$ for each $j \neq j_{0}$, and $\sup _{\mathcal{D}^{2}}\|a\|_{\mathrm{BMO}\left(\mathcal{D}^{2}\right)} \lesssim 1$. As shown in [4, Theorem 5.24],

$$
\left\|\Pi_{a}(\vec{g})\right\|_{L^{p}} \lesssim \sup _{\mathcal{D}^{2}}\|a\|_{\mathrm{BMO}\left(\mathcal{D}^{2}\right)} \prod_{j=1}^{m}\left\|f_{j}\right\|_{L^{p_{j}}}
$$

which along with [45, eq. (6.10)] gives

$$
\left\|\left(\sum_{j \in \mathbb{Z}}\left|\sum_{k \in \mathbb{Z}} \Pi_{a_{k, j}}\left(\vec{g}_{k, j}\right)\right|^{q}\right)^{\frac{1}{q}}\right\|_{L^{p}\left(\mathbb{R}^{n_{2}}\right)} \lesssim \sup _{k, j \in \mathbb{Z}}\left\|a_{k, j}\right\|_{\mathrm{BMO}}\left\|\left(\sum_{j \in \mathbb{Z}}\left|\sum_{k \in \mathbb{Z}} \prod_{i=1}^{m}\left(M_{\mathcal{D}} g_{k, j}^{i}\right)\right|^{q}\right)^{\frac{1}{q}}\right\|_{L^{p}\left(\mathbb{R}^{n_{2}}\right)}
$$

for all $p, q \in(0, \infty)$. Recall that

$$
\left\|\left(a_{\left(I_{j}^{1}\right), Q}\right)\right\|_{\mathrm{BMO}\left(\mathcal{D}^{2}\right)} \lesssim \frac{\prod_{j=1}^{m+1}\left|I_{j}^{1}\right|^{\frac{1}{q}}}{\left|Q^{1}\right|}=: a_{\left(I_{j}^{1}\right), Q^{1}}
$$

Denote

$$
\varphi(f):=\sum_{I^{1} \in \mathcal{D}^{1}} h_{I^{1}} \otimes M_{\mathcal{D}^{2}}\left(\left\langle f, h_{I^{1}}\right\rangle\right)
$$

Then

$$
M_{\mathcal{D}^{2}}\left(\left\langle f, h_{I^{1}}\right\rangle\right)=\left\langle\varphi(f), h_{I^{1}}\right\rangle \quad \text { and } \quad M_{\mathcal{D}^{2}}\left(\left\langle f, h_{I^{1}}^{0}\right\rangle\right) \leq\left\langle M_{\mathcal{D}} f, h_{I^{1}}^{0}\right\rangle
$$

For convenience of notation, suppose that $\widetilde{h}_{I_{m+1}^{1}}=h_{I_{m+1}^{1}}$ and $\widetilde{h}_{I_{j}^{1}}=h_{I_{j}^{1}}^{0}$ for every $j=2, \ldots, m$. Then by (2.10) and (7.41)-(7.43), we deduce

$$
\begin{aligned}
& \left\|\Xi^{1 *}(\vec{f})\right\|_{L^{r}} \lesssim\left\|\left(\sum_{Q^{1} \in \mathcal{D}^{1}}\left|\sum_{\left(I_{j}^{1}\right)} h_{I_{j}^{1}}\right.\right.\right.\left.\left.\otimes\left(\sum_{\ell\left(Q^{2}\right) \leq\left|v_{2}\right|} a_{\left(I_{j}\right), Q} \cdots \cdots \bar{h}_{1, Q^{2}}\right)\right|^{2}\right)^{\frac{1}{2}}\right\|_{L^{r}} \\
& \lesssim \sup _{Q^{1} \in \mathcal{D}^{1}}\left\|b_{Q^{1}}\right\|_{L^{m}}\left\|\left(\sum_{Q^{1} \in \mathcal{D}^{1}}\left|\sum_{\left(I_{j}^{1}\right)} a_{\left(I_{j}^{1}\right), Q^{1}} h_{I_{j}^{1}} \otimes\left[M_{\mathcal{D}^{2}}\left(\left\langle f_{1}, \bar{h}_{I_{m+1}^{1}}\right\rangle\right) \prod_{j=2}^{m} M_{\mathcal{D}^{2}}\left(\left\langle f_{j}, \bar{h}_{I_{j}^{1}}\right\rangle\right)\right]\right|^{2}\right)^{\frac{1}{2}}\right\|_{L^{r}} \\
& \lesssim|v|\left\|\left(\sum_{Q^{1} \in \mathcal{D}^{1}}\left|\sum_{\left(I_{j}^{1}\right)} a_{\left(I_{j}^{1}\right), Q^{1}} h_{I_{j}^{1}} \otimes\left[\left\langle\varphi\left(f_{1}\right), h_{I_{m+1}^{1}}\right\rangle \prod_{j=2}^{m}\left(M_{\mathcal{D}} f_{j}, h_{I_{j}^{1}}^{0}\right\rangle\right]\right|^{2}\right)^{\frac{1}{2}}\right\|_{L^{r}}
\end{aligned}
$$

$$
\begin{aligned}
& =|v|\|\left\|\left(\sum_{Q^{1} \in \mathcal{D}^{1}}\left|\sum_{\left(I_{j}^{1}\right)} a_{\left(I_{j}^{1}\right), Q^{1}}\left[\left\langle\varphi\left(f_{1}\right), h_{I_{m+1}^{1}}\right\rangle \prod_{j=2}^{m}\left\langle M_{\mathcal{D}} f_{j}, h_{I_{j}^{1}}^{0}\right\rangle\right]\right|^{2} \frac{\mathbf{1}_{I_{j}^{1}}}{\left|I_{1}^{1}\right|}\right)^{\frac{1}{2}}\right\|_{L^{r}\left(\mathbb{R}^{n_{1}}\right)} \|_{L^{r}\left(\mathbb{R}^{n_{2}}\right)} \\
& \simeq|v|\|\left\|\left(\sum_{Q^{1} \in \mathcal{D}^{1}} \sum_{\left(I_{j}^{1}\right)} a_{\left(I_{j}^{1}\right), Q^{1}}\left\langle\varphi\left(f_{1}\right), h_{I_{m+1}^{1}}\right\rangle \prod_{j=2}^{m}\left\langle M_{\mathcal{D}} f_{j}, h_{I_{j}^{1}}^{0}\right\rangle h_{I_{j}^{1}}\right\|_{L^{r}\left(\mathbb{R}^{n_{1}}\right)}\right\|_{L^{r}\left(\mathbb{R}^{n_{2}}\right)} \\
& \lesssim|v|\|\left\|\varphi\left(f_{1}\right)\right\|_{L^{r_{1}}\left(\mathbb{R}^{n_{1}}\right)} \prod_{j=2}^{m}\left\|M_{\mathcal{D}}\left(f_{j}\right)\right\|_{L^{r_{j}}\left(\mathbb{R}^{n_{1}}\right)} \|_{L^{r}\left(\mathbb{R}^{n_{2}}\right)} \\
& =|v|\left\|\varphi\left(f_{1}\right)\right\|_{L^{r_{1}}} \prod_{j=2}^{m}\left\|M_{\mathcal{D}}\left(f_{j}\right)\right\|_{L^{r_{j}}} \lesssim|v| \prod_{j=1}^{m}\left\|f_{j}\right\|_{L^{r_{j}}}
\end{aligned}
$$

where " $\simeq$ " is due to (2.3), and after that we used the boundedness of $m$-linear oneparameter shifts. This completes the proof of (7.40).
7.3. Commutators of full paraproducts. Finally, let us demonstrate the mean continuity of $\left[\boldsymbol{b}, \mathbb{E}_{\omega} \mathbb{F}_{\mathbf{a}_{\omega}}\right]_{\boldsymbol{\alpha}}$. We will modify the proof in Section 7.1 to the current situation.

A full paraproduct $\mathbb{F}_{\mathbf{a}}$ can be viewed as a shift $\mathbb{S}_{\mathcal{D}}^{k}$ of complexity $k=((0,0), \ldots,(0,0))$. Indeed, by definition of full paraproducts, there holds

$$
\left|a_{I}^{\prime}\right|:=\left|a_{I}\right| I\left|{ }^{-\frac{m}{2}}\right| \lesssim|I|^{-\frac{m-1}{2}}, \quad \forall I \in \mathcal{D}
$$

and

$$
\mathbb{F}_{\mathbf{a}}(\vec{f})=\sum_{I=I^{1} \times I^{2} \in \mathcal{D}} a_{I}^{\prime} \prod_{j=1}^{m}\left\langle f_{j}, \widetilde{h}_{j, I^{1}} \otimes \widetilde{h}_{j, I^{2}}\right\rangle \widetilde{h}_{m+1, I^{1}} \otimes \widetilde{h}_{m+1, I^{2}}
$$

where there exist $j_{0}^{1}, j_{0}^{2} \in\{1, \ldots, m+1\}$ so that $\widetilde{h}_{j_{0}^{1}, I^{1}}=h_{I^{1}}, \widetilde{h}_{j_{0}^{2}, I^{2}}=h_{I^{2}}, \widetilde{h}_{j, I^{1}}=h_{I^{1}}^{0}$ for every $j \neq j_{0}^{1}$, and $\widetilde{h}_{j, I^{2}}=h_{I^{2}}^{0}$ for every $j \neq j_{0}^{2}$. Then it is clear that $\mathbb{F}_{\mathbf{a}}$ coincides with a shift $\mathbb{S}_{\mathcal{D}}^{k}$ with $k=((0,0), \ldots,(0,0))$.

As argued in Section 7.2, with (6.51), (7.44), and (7.45) in hand, we are eventually reduced to handling

$$
\Xi(\vec{f})(x):=\sum_{\substack{I^{1} \in \mathcal{D}^{1} \\ \ell\left(I^{2}\right) \leq\left|v_{2}\right|}} a_{I} b_{I_{1}}\left(x_{2}\right) \prod_{j=1}^{m}\left\langle f_{j}, \bar{h}_{j, I^{1}} \otimes \bar{h}_{j, I^{2}}\right\rangle \bar{h}_{m+1, I^{1}} \otimes \bar{h}_{m+1, I^{2}}(x)
$$

where $b_{I^{1}}\left(x_{2}\right):=b\left(c_{I^{1}}, x_{2}+v_{2}\right)-b\left(c_{I^{1}}, x_{2}\right)$, and $\bar{h}_{j, I^{1}}$ and $\bar{h}_{j, I^{2}}$ are defined in Definition 3.11. Let $f_{m+1} \in L^{p^{\prime}}\left(\mathbb{R}^{n_{1}} \times \mathbb{R}^{n_{2}}\right)$ with $\left\|f_{m+1}\right\|_{L^{p^{\prime}}} \leq 1$. Then

$$
\left|\left\langle\Xi(\vec{f}), f_{m+1}\right\rangle\right| \leq \sum_{I=I^{1} \times I^{2} \in \mathcal{D}}\left|a_{I}\right| \prod_{j=1}^{m}\left|\left\langle f_{j}, \bar{h}_{j, I^{1}} \otimes \bar{h}_{j, I^{2}}\right\rangle\right|\left|\left\langle b_{I^{1}} f_{m+1}, \bar{h}_{m+1, I^{1}} \otimes \bar{h}_{m+1, I^{2}}\right|\right.
$$

$$
\lesssim\|\mathbf{a}\|_{\operatorname{BMO}(\mathcal{D})}\left\|\left[\sum_{I \in \mathcal{D}} \prod_{j=1}^{m}\left|\left\langle f_{j}, \bar{h}_{j, I^{1}} \otimes \bar{h}_{j, I^{2}}\right\rangle\right|^{2}\left|\left\langle b_{I^{1}} f_{m+1}, \bar{h}_{m+1, I^{1}} \otimes \bar{h}_{m+1, I^{2}}\right|^{2} \frac{\mathbf{1}_{I}}{|I|}\right]^{\frac{1}{2}}\right\|_{L^{1}}
$$

- Case 1: $\bar{h}_{m+1, I^{2}}=\frac{\mathbf{1}_{I^{2}}}{|I|^{2}}$. and $\bar{h}_{m+1, I^{1}}=\frac{\mathbf{1}_{I^{1}}}{|I|^{1}}$. By the assumption on full paraproducts, we may assume that $\bar{h}_{1, I^{1}}=h_{I^{1}}$ and $\bar{h}_{2, I^{2}}=h_{I^{2}}$. It is not hard to verify that

$$
\begin{aligned}
& \left|\left\langle f_{1}, h_{I^{1}} \otimes \bar{h}_{I^{2}}\right\rangle\right|=\left|\left\langle\Delta_{I^{1}} f_{1}, h_{I^{1}} \otimes \bar{h}_{I^{2}}\right\rangle\right| \leq\left\langle\left|\Delta_{I^{1}} f_{1}\right|\right\rangle_{I}\left|I^{1}\right|^{\frac{1}{2}} \\
& \left|\left\langle f_{2}, \bar{h}_{I^{1}} \otimes h_{I^{2}}\right\rangle\right|=\left|\left\langle\Delta_{I^{2}} f_{2}, \bar{h}_{I^{1}} \otimes h_{I^{2}}\right\rangle\right| \leq\left\langle\left|\Delta_{I^{2}} f_{2}\right|\right\rangle_{I}\left|I^{2}\right|^{\frac{1}{2}} \\
& \left|\left\langle f_{j}, \bar{h}_{I^{1}} \otimes \bar{h}_{I^{2}}\right\rangle\right| \leq\left\langle\left|f_{j}\right|\right\rangle_{I}, \quad j=3, \ldots, m \\
& \left|\left\langle b_{I^{1}} f_{m+1}, \bar{h}_{I^{1}} \otimes \bar{h}_{I^{2}}\right\rangle\right| \leq|v|\|\nabla b\|_{L^{\infty}}\left\langle\left|f_{m+1}\right|\right\rangle_{I}
\end{aligned}
$$

Hence, it follows from (7.46)-(7.50) that

$$
\left|\left\langle\Xi(\vec{f}), f_{m+1}\right\rangle\right| \lesssim|v|\left\|\left[\sum_{I \in \mathcal{D}}\left\langle\left|\Delta_{I^{1}} f_{1}\right|\right\rangle_{I}^{2}\left\langle\left|\Delta_{I^{2}} f_{2}\right|\right\rangle_{I}^{2} \prod_{j=3}^{m}\left\langle\left|f_{j}\right|\right\rangle\left.\right|^{2} \mathbf{1}_{I}\right]^{\frac{1}{2}}\right\|_{L^{1}}
$$

- Case 2: $\bar{h}_{m+1, I^{2}}=\frac{\mathbf{1}_{I^{2}}}{|I|^{2}}$. and $\bar{h}_{m+1, I^{1}}=h_{I^{1}}$. By symmetry, we may assume that $\bar{h}_{2, I^{2}}=h_{I^{2}}$. Then

$$
\begin{aligned}
& \left|\left\langle f_{1}, \bar{h}_{I^{1}} \otimes \bar{h}_{I^{2}}\right\rangle\right| \leq\left\langle\left|f_{1}\right|\right\rangle_{I} \\
& \left|\left\langle f_{2}, \bar{h}_{I^{1}} \otimes h_{I^{2}}\right\rangle\right|=\left|\left\langle\Delta_{I^{2}} f_{2}, \bar{h}_{I^{1}} \otimes h_{I^{2}}\right\rangle\right| \leq\left\langle\left|\Delta_{I^{2}} f_{2}\right|\right\rangle_{I}\left|I^{2}\right|^{\frac{1}{2}} \\
& \left|\left\langle f_{j}, \bar{h}_{I^{1}} \otimes \bar{h}_{I^{2}}\right\rangle\right| \leq\left\langle\left|f_{j}\right|\right\rangle_{I}, \quad j=3, \ldots, m \\
& \left|\left\langle b_{I_{1}} f_{m+1}, h_{I^{1}} \otimes \bar{h}_{I^{2}}\right\rangle\right|=\left|\left\langle b_{I_{1}} \Delta_{I^{1}} f_{m+1}, h_{I^{1}} \otimes \bar{h}_{I^{2}}\right\rangle\right| \lesssim|v|\left\langle\left|\Delta_{I^{1}} f_{m+1}\right|\right\rangle_{I}\left|I^{1}\right|^{\frac{1}{2}}
\end{aligned}
$$

By (7.46) and (7.52)-(7.55), there holds

$$
\left|\left\langle\Xi(\vec{f}), f_{m+1}\right\rangle\right| \lesssim|v|\left\|\left[\sum_{I \in \mathcal{D}}\left\langle\left|\Delta_{I^{2}} f_{2}\right|\right\rangle_{I}^{2}\left\langle\left|\Delta_{I^{1}} f_{m+1}\right|\right\rangle_{I}^{2} \prod_{j=1,3, \ldots, m}\left\langle\left|f_{j}\right|\right\rangle\left.\right|^{2} \mathbf{1}_{I}\right]^{\frac{1}{2}}\right\|_{L^{1}}
$$

- Case 3: $\bar{h}_{m+1, I^{2}}=h_{I^{2}}$ and $\bar{h}_{m+1, I^{1}}=\frac{\mathbf{1}_{I^{1}}}{|I|^{1}}$. By symmetry, we may assume that $\bar{h}_{1, I^{1}}=h_{I^{1}}$. Then

$$
\begin{aligned}
& \left|\left\langle f_{1}, h_{I^{1}} \otimes \bar{h}_{I^{2}}\right\rangle\right|=\left|\left\langle\Delta_{I^{1}} f_{1}, h_{I^{1}} \otimes \bar{h}_{I^{2}}\right\rangle\right| \leq\left\langle\left|\Delta_{I^{1}} f_{1}\right|\right\rangle_{I}\left|I^{1}\right|^{\frac{1}{2}} \\
& \left|\left\langle f_{j}, \bar{h}_{I^{1}} \otimes \bar{h}_{I^{2}}\right\rangle\right| \leq\left\langle\left|f_{j}\right|\right\rangle_{I}, \quad j=2, \ldots, m \\
& \left|\left\langle b_{I_{1}} f_{m+1}, \bar{h}_{I^{1}} \otimes h_{I^{2}}\right\rangle\right| \lesssim|v|\left\langle\left|f_{m+1}\right|\right\rangle_{I}\left|I^{2}\right|^{\frac{1}{2}}
\end{aligned}
$$

As a consequence of (7.46) and (7.57)-(7.59), we have

$$
\left|\left\langle\Xi(\vec{f}), f_{m+1}\right\rangle\right| \lesssim|v|\left\|\left[\sum_{I \in \mathcal{D}}\left\langle\left|\Delta_{I^{1}} f_{1}\right|\right\rangle_{I}^{2} \prod_{j=2}^{m+1}\left\langle\left|f_{j}\right|\right\rangle\left.\right|^{2} \mathbf{1}_{I}\right]^{\frac{1}{2}}\right\|_{L^{1}}
$$

- Case 4: $\bar{h}_{m+1, I^{2}}=h_{I^{2}}$ and $\bar{h}_{m+1, I^{1}}=h_{I^{1}}$. Then one has

$$
\left|\left\langle f_{j}, \bar{h}_{I^{1}} \otimes \bar{h}_{I^{2}}\right\rangle\right| \leq\left\langle\left|f_{j}\right|\right\rangle_{I}, \quad j=1, \ldots, m
$$

$$
\left.\left|\left\langle b_{I_{1}} f_{m+1}, h_{I^{1}} \otimes h_{I^{2}}\right\rangle\right|=\left|\left\langle b_{I_{1}} \Delta_{I^{1}} f_{m+1}, h_{I^{1}} \otimes h_{I^{2}}\right\rangle\right| \lesssim|v|\left\langle\left|\Delta_{I^{1}} f_{m+1}\right|\right\rangle_{I}|I|^{\frac{1}{2}}
$$

In view of (7.46) and (7.57)-(7.59), we arrive at

$$
